Summary Heading: A Peaceful Retreat with a Good Breakfast
Summary: We love this hotel and would love to go back for a longer stay.   It was peaceful,  nice room with balcony and friendly staff.     The breakfast was great....fluffy scrambled eggs, sausage. waffles (with chocolate chips and strawberries!🙂) juices including watermelon juice.   It was spead out so it wasn't crowded.  Big breakfast room and outside area by the pool.  The employee was quick to refill and clean.  We needed a room with an ADA roll in shower and it was perfect for us.   The property is a bit dated but everything worked on our room and had been remodeled.   The bed was comfortable and the linens seemed new and fluffy.  I recommend this hotel.
Room tip: We only had shampoo in our room...you might want to bring conditioner.  We were only given one...
Manager Response: Hello dana B:  Thank you for the wonderful review on TripAdvisor!  We are so glad you enjoyed your stay and look forward to having you back with us again soon.  It was great to read that you were so satisfied with the room, our breakfast offerings and team members.

Everything worked except our slider handle didn’t lock, but it had a lock on the bottom.  The room looked outdated but it was clean enough and suited our needs.  The room was just ok overall.  The location, however, is spectacular, and that gets a 5.  This hotel is walking distance from the beach, and the marina is right outside the hotel.  I walked all along the marina in the evening with my daughter and felt very safe.  There are  many shops and restaurants nearby along the marina and we enjoyed that as well.  I was nervous to stay here after reading the reviews.  I decided to stay anyway because of the location.  The hotel

No map of grounds or adequate directions to room .No carts to be found for moving luggage. 2. Out dated room, small bathroom. No room to put toiletries. Sink did not drain well. 3. Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights.  Room was very old and the carpet had a sticky stain on it that felt like honey.  ALL the carpets in the entire hotel look like they were from a crime scene; stained and dirty.  There was NO cleaning service the entire time.  Had to ask for towels from the front desk each day, only to be told they were "out of towels".  Breakfast lady was incredibly rude in the hot, crowded breakfast room.  DO NOT stay here.
Manager Response: Hi D6028Nlkathyg:  We sure are sorry that your most recent stay didn't go as well as we all would have liked.  Your feedback about Housekeeping and the Breakfast Room was good for us to know about so we can make improvements to our facility and services.

Summary Heading: Great location. Ran out of bananas :(
Summary: Suites are very spacious and connect to the room next door. Older hotel but has new electronics. Plenty of USB ports in the room! A/c. Friendly staff. The breakfast area was super crowded and they ran out of bananas. That is my primary breakfast so I was super bummed about that.
Manager Response: Hi Rbar612:  We appreciate all of the positive feedback but feel terrible about running out of bananas!    Please be assured that we will save one for you on your next trip!  :)

Summary: Not the most luxurious accommodations, but I knew what to expect. A dated gem. I came here specifically to enjoy the affordable nostalgia (of my hometown hotel) before it is torn down and becomes just another Southern California upgrade that common folk cannot afford. I am sad but my stay was great. The rooms are spacious and clean. The staff was friendly enough. The breakfast was ok. But the location(!) is golden. Plenty of walking areas, bike rental nearby, DP harbor just steps away, restaurants, shopping, beaches...the sound of seals and seagulls...I wish I had time for the pool and jacuzzi!... It was a restful stay indeed.
Room tip: I had a courtyard view on the second floor. It was perfect
Manager Response: Hi sdmt33:  We're glad your stroll down memory lane was a positive one!  Come back for another one when your travels bring you back to Dana Point...you're more than welcome with us at any time.

Summary: I can not believe this dump has not been condemned. This hotel is one of the worst places I have ever stayed.  It is FILTHY . . . DIRTY. . .  DISGUSTING  . . . .Do not stay at this slum of a hotel, you will regret it. You have been warned.

Summary: OMG don’t even consider staying here. It’s awful! Dirty room, broken curtains, disrespectful front desk and manager. Disgusting place. Maybe they feel safe with just plexiglass? No mask on housekeeping. Multiple guests walking the halls without masks and no one asking them to put one on.   They do have a complimentary breakfast. Summary Heading: Another Stay at an Old Haunt
Summary: We have stayed here for over 10 years, twice a year for extended stays while I surf OC and visit family and friends.  The pros; the Marina is right outside your door for long walks out to the Point or down the beach, convenient access to the beach and surf spots.  Great restaurants nearby, i.e., RJ's Cafe, Chart House, Olemandi's, Ramos House, Heritage BBQ, Sonny's.  A great Hot Tub and pool area to relax when staying during the week and off season.  A very attentive staff that go the limit to make for a comfortable stay.  The negatives:  the place has been scheduled for demolition for years (20 years) to make way for the larger Harbor Renovation but to date, aside for gaining the myriad of permits the Inn has been in a holding pattern and allowed to quite frankly deteriorate
Manager Response: Hello Dwnptrl:  What a terrific review to read!    Thank you for sharing the good and the "could be better" and we look forward to seeing you again soon on your next visit.

Summary: This poor hotel needs new ownership / management. God knows they try but this hotel is being ran into the ground. Not a safe environment. Not family friendly. Homeless and drug deals seem to be a common theme in the parking lot at night. Seems like safety and costumer satisfaction is not their number 1 priority. Very disappointed how this place is being Run. I did not have my key card on me and the girl at the front desk wouldn’t open or let me use the 1st floor common area bathroom. she  She told me to go across the street and use the boater bathrooms. Summary Heading: Ive never been so insulted or embarased. I literally paid to be harrased by these monsters.
Summary: Its such a shame to have a prime location and great clientele and have it blown by terrible employees and for lack of a better word , ridiculous excuse for management. Iam excited to see what the new constuction of the harbor has in store for us. I know this location will finally get the kind of business it deserves and we will get the treatment we expect when we come to such a prestigous location.

Summary Heading: Fair Price at a Desirable Location
Summary: I was on the fence about booking based on some of the reviews I read through here. I am glad I went with my instincts and booked us a room. We secured a second-floor room facing the harbor, a view I definitely say is worth it for a few extra dollars a night.    Things I loved: parking is free, the staff is friendly, they are dog-friendly, the view of the harbor is a lovely one, the pool and hot tub kept my daughter entertained, the free breakfast made our morning (waffles, eggs, sausage, beans, salsa, bagels, English muffins, cereals, coffees, teas, juices, muffins, yogurt...), there are chairs on the room balconies (some places don't do this!), and there are several shops and eateries RIGHT THERE.  Things some may complain about: the bed pillows are so-so, the towels are so-so,

If you’re on a strict budget this is the place for you!  Clean large rooms with many restaurants within walking distance!  Staff knowledgeable ( when checking in we were advised Catalina Ferry wasn’t running and we had even visited the ticket office and the Catalina staff member didn’t bother to mention this fact as a result we were able to adjust our plans snd make the Catalina express out of a different port) kudos to the gentleman who check us in!  AC was loud and while spacious only 2 seating options.

The staff was super friendly. The pool and jacuzzi were great, but the location is the only reason to stay here if you're going to the Ohana Festival. It is walking distance, but also right next to the harbor restaurants and shops, including a little market/liquor store. The issue with the hotel itself is that it is pretty run down. The carpet (at least in our room) had many stains on it, paint was peeling, the door didn't really fit and the light from the hallway was shining in between the cracks, so much so that it lit up our room at night. The walls are basically hollow and we could hear everything going on the the next rooms. Considering we were there for the festival and just needed a place to lay our head down at night, we definitely would stay here again for that only.

The hotel location is perfect.  We attended the Ohana Festival.  Many good restaurants nearby and easy to walk to the festival.  The rooms are dated but are clean.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was good. It is a great place to get a good night’s sleep and recharge for another day of music.

I spent many summers at this hotel as a kid, so when my wife and I were visiting California at the end of August this year I thought it would be fun to stay there. I have given this review five stars, because of the friendliness of the staff, location and the overall condition of the facility. Yes it’s true that you won’t be staying in a super modern room, but our room was very clean and everything was in good working condition. We paid just under $200.00 a night and had a view of the harbor and I must say it was absolutely gorgeous. We considered staying at other properties, but for $170.00 a night compared to $600.00+ for an ocean view pretty much anywhere else along the coast this place is a fantastic deal. We felt very safe during our stay and the breakfast was very good.

Summary Heading: Good location - Thin walls - Fair Value
Summary: Double queen room for travel partner and self. Rates fair for area. Good location with good restaurants marina and beaches in walking distance. A spot to throw your gear, but nothing to spend time at the hotel for. Noisy second floor neighbor; use wall ac for white sound countering effort. Clean, and felt safe parking car there. VERY good bfast, lunch and dinner spots across streets, none of which were on their "recommended list", however, the front desk person was helpful.

They did not tell us at check in we had no hot water and the water was  going to be shut off the following day.  They don’t provide any service to the rooms, you have to pick up towels In The lobby. Summary Heading: This hotel is not somewhere I would stay again
Summary: We had a good stay, it was fine, but I would not stay here again.  The rooms were just not very nice. They were cleaned well by staff, but there were cracks and rust in the tile, dirty hallway windows, etc, that just made it feel dirty. The worst part was the way the sink and tub would not drain when you were using them, and would fill with dirty water, it was gross. They ran out of towels one night, so we couldn't get more until the next morning. The walls were thin and we could hear the man in the next room snoring, we were worried it would keep us up, but the air conditioner sound drowned him out. There's no safe in the room which I wasn't happy about. The beds were comfortable, which was a plus. The lobby was clean. Another guest was complaining that they had laundry stolen

Summary Heading: Filthy dirty hotel, the worst I have ever seen .

I have never seen a hotel in this condition, horrible.  It is run down and needs a complete renovation or should be demolished. I stayed in room 218, nice and quiet, but discussing, dirty, filthy, cigarette burns all over the carpet, carpet stains on every inch of the room. There was left over soap in the shower, from who knows when.  The bed was like a brick. No pen of paper in the room. I could go on and on, but I think you get the picture, do not stay in this place if you value your health.

We have stayed here several times over the years. Just recently we came for a short 2 night stay. As always customer service was very good. We always book a room with a harbor view. It’s nice the rooms have a balcony so you can sit and enjoy the beautiful weather and the view. The pool and spa were open but unfortunately, the spa was packed. 5 adults and 6 little kids. I went and asked at the front desk about kids in the hot tub plus instructions given at check in said only 4 ppl at a time . I was told that they don’t really enforce it and to come back at night when the kids were sleeping. I wasn’t too happy about that. Summary: Our stay was very nice! The check in staff was outstanding! She made us feel welcomed and was so nice to speak to! The location of the hotel was right on the marina and our room on the 3 floor overlooked the boats and water! The room itself was very clean. I would say though that it due for an update/renovation! Outside of that, we enjoyed our stay!

Then the other mornings there weren’t spoons available for the yogurt and oatmeal. What’s the point of having oatmeal and yogurt without a spoon? Summary Heading: Should be wonderful, but is just okay
Summary: The only reason to stay at this hotel at the prices they charge is because it is the only hotel directly at the marina. Unfortunately, it did not meet our expectations and was very tired. The ONE small lobby elevator took forever and the stairs were very far away. There was no microwave and the bathroom was not female friendly, as it has a pedestal sink with no storage or shelving area, making it difficult to get ready.  The beds, however, were very comfortable.  Won't stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great inn with a GORGEOUS view!!
Summary: My three teenagers and I stayed here during our week vacation in Southern Cali during the Covid Pandemic.  The staff was amazing and so friendly. The pool has amazing views as does everywhere you look from anywhere at the end! It's absolutely beautiful!
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for your wonderful review. We are glad you got to enjoy the spectacular harbor views and enjoyed your stay. We look forward to seeing you again.

I'm assigned another room, this time overlooking the parking lot. Tried for a 3rd time and told the hotel had not received correct info from hotels.com ... hmmm, ok? and no harbor rooms available.  The hotel room was basic but clean & nice enough. very dated tiny bathroom. It's time for a massive remodel or tear it down.  You pay for the location here ... that's about it.

Summary Heading: 2nd visit - still love the location, affordable and comfortable stay
Summary: In August my daughter, my  husband and I stayed at the Dana Point Marina Inn.  In March,  I returned for a solo visit.  I love the location of this hotel.  It is in the heart of the harbor - you can see the boats and water from the pool and many of the rooms.  You can walk to the shops along the harbor; you can cross the street and walk up stairs to an overlook; you can walk across the bridge to the promenade on the other side of the harbor;  and if desired  you can walk to Doheny Beach where you can find bike rentals, ice cream and burger stands and swimming. rent bikes,    The hotel itself is comfortable and affordable.  I used my AAA discount on a Sunday night for a king room at $116 per night.  Parking is free and ample.    The rooms are a good size, with nice bedding, a
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to rate & review our property. We are so happy you enjoyed your stay and we hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: The hotel was decent. Could use a face lift but it was clean and very close to the Ohana festival we were attending. Nothing bad or wonderful about the hotel. However, be careful how you book. We booked through hotels.com. Specifically requested a view of the beautiful harbor and that’s what we paid for. We arrived and were told that not only were we not getting our view, we only had one bed when we booked two. The front desk was less than helpful and basically just blamed hotels.com. They offered nothing to compensate for this massive disappointment. Luckily on our way out in the morning the manager was there and she refunded the extra cost of the room that we didn’t get. This was greater appreciated but didn’t change that we didn’t get what we booked and I had to share a bed
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are very sorry about the service you received during your stay. It has all been addressed with our staff. We are hoping you give us another change in the future.

Summary: This property is a hidden gem, it’s sitting at  a great location, has very big rooms and friendly staff, they were able to accommodate all my needs and lucky for me they had rooms available at noon, (the ritz made me wait till 4 ) it’s within walking distance from delicious restaurants “el torito “ 😋 and bars 🍹. It’s a 10 minute walk to the beach and if you want to go to Catalina island, the Catalina express is just a few minutes away , I’m in love with this property and the prices are incredible.
Manager Response: Hello Mahiasdaone,  Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know you enjoyed your stay with us! We are pleased to hear we were able to accommodate your early check in request, we do everything we can to make sure everyone gets in at their desired time. We look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary: Lame check in time.  Bad “service” already.  Ugh.  Won’t call when room is ready. Just a dismissive gotta come back at 4.  As if 4 is normal. When hotels just phone it in it really sucks.  Skip this conveniently located poor service misfire.

Our Standard check in time has always been 4pm, but when guests arrive early we always try to accommodate an early check-in, this is not always possible. Our check out time is 11am and we do need time to clean & prepare the rooms for the next guest. Thank you again for your in-put.

Summary: I love bringing my family to this hotel due to location and price.  It is close to baby beach for kayaking and paddle boarding and close to restaurants like Wind and Sea.  I appreciate we have a breakfast included in the stay as well
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: The place needs a face lift..as maintenance is needed for several touch ups...re painting g and chipped surfaces.helpful pleasant staff and reasonable rates more than make up for deficiencies.and view of harbor very nice location
Manager Response: Thank you for your observations. We are currently working on updating the property. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Stayed for three nights over Christmas. Staff was friendly. Rooms are in series need of updating. Furniture worn  and sad. Bathroom small, shower really grungy looking but other than that room was clean. Bed was comfortable Breakfast was pretty mediocre- nothing stood out and there was no variation. Convenient location,  just not sure I would stay at this location again unless it was remodeled.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and we are sorry that your stay was not as you expected. We do appreciate the comment you left and strive daily to make improvements based on guests comments and suggestions.

Summary: Great location, easy access to the beach and friendly staff.  Room:  felt a little small and a touch dated, it was more than a little small.  There is very little shelving in the room we were in, plan on rotating bathroom items around.  Breakfast: Pretty standard and not much that stands out.  Staff:  Trust Sam (at the front desk) for insights to local restaurant's he will not steer you wrong.
Manager Response: Hello,  We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with. Our location is so conveniently close to the restaurants and beach!

Summary: Stayed here before it has its location going for it if you want to be right by marina. My complaint is the ac froze up and was not working properly water had been dripping on carpet for sometime. Ask twice at front desk and was given an excuse as to ac effluence. Note I have built a motel for myself 60units and have rentals residential and commercial oh yeah I am also a general contractor I know if an ac unit is working properly. I was willing to leave slider open to let evening breeze in but you could see into our room from hallway window. Asked for another room and was told their 100%full. Must be nice if indeed that was the case. Complain is nobody real cared one way or other it was our problem no offer to compensate us for their issues.  Should have taken responsibility and
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am sorry it was not a great stay for you. We are working to make sure next time you have a more enjoyable stay.

Summary Heading: Don't trust Booking through Trip Advisor
Summary: Listed a 48 hour cancellation policy, then trip advisor charged a full prepaid no-cancellation stay. Shady bait and switch. Book with hotels directly. Avoid trip advisor. I have stayed here before. It has a great breakfast buffet. Hotel is older, but okay.

Summary Heading: Great location for visiting Dana Point
Summary: I booked this place in March for the Ohana Fest in Sept. Arrived on Saturday and the front desk found us a room a couple hours before check in; 3rd floor with a courtyard view/marina peek. Love being on the top floor, much quieter, no room next to us either. The rooms are older, but it doesn't matter when you aren't there to sit in the room! Nice free breakfast in the AM (waffles!!) and a nice pool area. Definitely will return!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We look forward to seeing you again.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Doheney
Summary: Easy walk to festival at Doheney State Park. Stayed here when we came for a concert. Rates at this hotel much cheaper than surrounding properties. Nice rooms. Definitely worth the price and made the concert experience much nicer than having to drive home after it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review ! We look forward to seeing you again!

Summary: This is a great spot with a tremendous view of the marina. Only a few things that were no good. We were on the secound floor, rm 246. There is a street light right off the balcony that has a broken infuser lens. The light is so bright yhat you can't sit on the balcony after it comes on. There are street bloweres all day long, right under the window in the parking lot. They seem to want that parking lot clean of leaves for some reason. The next morning a street cleaning truck started a 4 AM.  While the blowere was going we tryed closeing the door and put the air on but it was loader than the blower. It is hard to rest inbetween outings because of all this.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and insight to what you experienced during your stay. I have made note of it and passed it on to engineering to see what options we have to correct this. WE look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: The Dana Point Marina Inn overlooks the marina in a great location. We were able to walk to the Tall Boat Festival and not be bothered by parking. In front of the inn is a walkway which winds its' way around the bay in one direction and restaurants and amenities the other. I find myself disliking the majority of free breakfasts, but I go to them anyway. The Dana Point Marina Inn had one of the best free breakfasts I've ever experienced, nice clientele, spacious and no one parked in front of the food while they wait for their waffles to cook. Most important, the room rates were very reasonable. When we decided to stay an extra day they went out of their way to accommodate us. The rooms were quite and clean, which is all that I ask for. Our room was the least expensive and had a
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review! We look forward to you visiting our property again.

Summary: What a great find....excellent room value and it includes breakfast!!!!  Cannot wait to go back next year.   Pleasant front desk staff and management who are very helpful.   Loved being a two minute walk from the Harbor with lots of restaurant and shop options.  Excellent vaue.......
Manager Response: Thank you for your review & we appreciate your business! Looking forward to seeing you again.

Summary Heading: Better than expected, good value, super nice staff!
Summary: Was pretty worried based on some reviews but this hotel was great! It's obviously nothing fancy and pretty basic so just be prepared for that- but the location is amazing, we didn't drive anywhere the whole time we were there. Our room had a lovely view of the pool and harbor, and was well equipped with a little kitchenette type area.  Our King was comfortable though pillows were not the best as others have indicated.   Breakfast seems to have been recently expanded and included several options including waffles and eggs etc The staff is extremely nice and helpful! Julie was great over the phone and every person at the front desk offered smiles and friendly service. The hotel is dated and worn here and there, but they are really trying and if you can get a deal it's great value
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We look forward to you visiting us again.

Summary Heading: Can't beat the location,  good value even with dated accomodations
Summary: My husband, 20s daughter and I stayed here to be close to my son in San Juan Capistrano. We were very happy with the beautiful location.  Dana Point Harbor is very scenic and the Marina Inn sits right along the harbor.  It  is within easy walking distance to all the shops and eateries along the harbor.  It is also walking distance to some chain restaurants along the PCH.    Doheny Beach, with its beach, bike rentals, changing rooms etc,  is a short distance past the harbor - definitely walk-able.  Other places within easy walking distance is over to the bridge to the park on the other side of the harbor and crossing the main street to climb the stairs and see the vista from above.     We enjoyed our stay at the Marina Inn  and felt it was a good value for the money.  We used our

The pros: very reasonable, location next to harbor with many restaurant choices, coffee cafe, etc. across the street is an amazing (albeit pricey) juice bar, nail salon, more restaurants, beautiful views at Heritage Park, staff was nice. The cons: rooms are in need of update (lamp shade broken, sink cracked, shower curtain torn, shower curtain rod rusting, closet rod plastic cover ripping), beds were kind of hard, can be noisy if you like to sleep with the door open and are facing the pool (it was past 10 and people were still playing loud music).
Manager Response: Thank you for your observations and we are currently working on updating the hotel. We hope you see a difference on your next visit.

Summary: clean rooms and nice people. nice pool and great location. near doheny beach and trolley stop. clean pool with plenty of seat around it.  great places to eat and browse in the stores right next store.  wonderful ice cream shop down the boardwalk.
Manager Response: Hello Ann,  Thank you so much taking the time to let us know you enjoyed your stay!!  We love coffee importers ice cream too!

Summary: The rooms were okay, except.  the breakfast brunch was most disappointing..  Lots of places to dine in the area. The views of the area was excellent.  The staff at the hotel were always ready to assist you.
Manager Response: Hi Drocktroad,  We are glad to hear you enjoyed our hotel overall and took advantage of our great location. Breakfast improvements are underway!

Summary: Read reviews on Dana Point Marina Inn and was happy to make a reservation to stay here. The location was great, right on the marina within walking distance of many shops and restaurants.  The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Was given a first floor room ( brought my puppy with me) which made life easier for me in the mornings taking him for his walk.  The room was a standard room with 2 queen beds which were very comfortable but the 3  pillows were much to be desired very flat.  As I said before I got a first floor room but by doing that it I was open to the constant noise and pounding of the floor above me which kept me up at night. As usual there were inconsiderate people slamming doors a hours of the night.   The room was dated and the bathroom was in need of a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay! I am so sorry to hear about your inconsiderate neighbors. I appreciate hearing your feedback inregard to the rooms, we are currently making improvements so it's good to hear where we need to make some. I will pass onto Julie how much you appreciated her!

Summary: I really don't know of any hotel in Dana Point with a better location than this hotel. Easy walk to restaurants and beach. We usually stay with our children when we're in Dana Point but because of other family coming in, we chose to stay elsewhere and picjed this hotel. I love having coffee at the Harbor and this was just a 5 minute walk. The Room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  I would have given this a 5 star rating except for the bathroom was more like something you would find in a Motel 6. There was absolutely no where to put vanity items and the little shelf that was provided had a slope that allowed everything to keep rolling and falling off. The staff were very friendly and aside from the bathroom we really enjoyed our stay there.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review! We love our locaton and are pleased to hear you do too!!

Summary: That location is beautiful. The beds are comfy. That's about it. The TV kept freezing last night, no shampoo or soap in the bathroom, just a half used tube of body lotion. Lightbulbs over the bathroom sink with no coverings. Shower went from hot to cold to hot to cold. Meh.

TV  randomly shuts off   called the front desk several times but they never answer.  Only got them to pick up when we called from an outside line.   Sunday morning at 8:30 we were woken up ( after finally getting to sleep because of the very uncomfortable bed) by vacuuming!!!  yes! Vacuuming on Sunday morning.  Called the front desk-again, only answered from an outside line and he said that it is customary for them to vacuum early.  This place cost way too much for this type of service and run down "motel like" atmosphere. Water from the bathroom sink smells like sewer and the tub has a leaky faucet and wasting water. I would tell the front desk but they don't answer the phone!  AND tried to get water two times in their vending machines and lost money both times -two different
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay

Summary: Ahhh a beautiful Sunday morning here in Dana Point...unfortunately (#1) if your expecting to enjoy a leisurely rising after a night of sleep...YOU WON’T FIND THAT HERE!!! I didn’t request a ‘wake up call’ but the hotel feels that VACUUMING RIGHT OUTSIDE OUR ROOM at 8AM on SUNDAY is acceptable.  (#2) If you’d expect to watch tv, which should be quite simply, YOU WON’T FIND THAT HERE... push the button on the remote!?!  Nope, you need to check plugs, and disconnect box, then try and reset!! Umm do I work for COX cable?!? And (#3), If your having any sort of issue(s) and you call the front desk expecting someone answer...YOU WON’T FIND THAT HERE EITHER. We stayed here 3 days, 2 nights...I attempted to contact the front desk a minimum of 5 times, at different times of the morning or
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try!

Summary: I heard this place was going to be torn down and rebuilt and I think that's the best idea.  The hotel sits on prime real estate by Dana Point Harbor so it's in a great walking location.  However, the mattresses were really worn with depressions and uncomfortable.  The continental breakfast was dismal with very few options and it is in a very crowded room so we were unable to sit.  Throughout the room you see walls in disrepair, tiles cracked and missing, bathrooms in desperate need of renovation.  I would not recommend.
Manager Response: The hotel is being torn down in the next 2 to 3 years. We will be replaced by a Full Service 5 Star Resort and Spa.

Summary: We just needed a staycation and I’m happy we chose this place. It is located in the middle of all the action in Dana Point and still has a quiet , laid back vibe.  We had room 307 , a standard two queen bedroom which means no marina or pool view. However , it has a nice view of trees, a nice balcony and it’s super clean.  I mostly have this a five star review because of the front desk check in and check out. Julie at the reception gave us the customer service you only see in 5 star resorts!! She was super attentive and went out of her way to ensure that we have all our questions answered and we have the best experience. Thank you , Julie, for outstanding professionalism and your warm and welcoming smile.  And yes, the beds are super comfy , too.  Some might think that the place

The staff is absolutely wonderful and very helpful. I stayed here for a week when I was at a surfing camp in Dana Point. The rooms are clean and comfy w/ private bath. I had a room w/ a patio which was wonderful. The hotel is next to the harbor. Walking distance to restaurants and sightseeing. If I ever go to Dana Post again I will stay here for a second time.

Summary Heading: place to stay in Dana Point – what a joke
Summary: This place is ancient – carpets are stained throughout, aircon louder than a Boeing 747, beds likely not changed since the 70’s and are super soft. You have to run around in the shower to get wet, which changes from scolding hot to ice cold.  Reception staff are clueless, they forgot to give us the room key card, forgot to tell us WIFI information, breakfast, check out information but they did wish us a pleasant stay and complained about the weather.  TV never worked – as reception never picked up phone – walked down to reception to be told all I needed to do was pull out cables and restart (like I hadn’t tried that) they asked to do it again. I did and to no surprise to me it still did not work, again they either never answered of were engaged so walked back to reception to
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: This was our first time staying here although we good to Dana Point often. It was our anniversary and we thought it would be nice to hang out at the harbor and not have to rush home...just stay the night. We had dinner at Harpoon Harry’s listened to their musician sing and had a couple of drinks and then walked back to our room and had a restful nights sleep. It was fun and the rooms were very nice.

The location of this hotel is fabulous! Literally, right on the marina harbor and within a 5-10 minutes walk to multiple restaurants and boutique shops. Dog friendly hotel. The complimentary continental breakfast was nothing to rave about. The usually faire, waffles, bagels, toast, cold cereal, yogurt, coffee, tea, etc. If you like a lot of carbs, then this is good. The walls are quite thin, I could literally here someone snoring in my room! Staff was friendly but my card key kept getting deactivated! Don't keep it near your cell phone; somehow, it deactivates the card key, weird!

Initial impressions of the location and reception area were good but once in our room things went downhill. It was a decent size but the all-pervading odour (difficult to identify) was horrible. All the furniture was chipped, worn and dirty. The white bedside lampshade was grey with filth. The carpet had only been superficially vacuumed, electric sockets sparked/crackled, the basin plug didn’t work and the toilet cistern ran constantly but after a long journey we really couldn’t be bothered to complain. The night was noisy - from the exterior (road & air con) and interior (doors banging/tv/talking/creaky floors in adjacent rooms). Breakfast food was fine but the breakfast room had VERY limited accommodation (seating for about 25 in a hotel with about 140 rooms!) We spent 10 days
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: I've been coming here for the last ten years, 2-3 week stays in the Fall and Spring to surf the nearshore breaks.  This is simply a great place to stay and recreate.  Walking distance to the beach and the Dana Point Sunset.  The Inn is very clean and the staff exceptional.  It is not the Ritz Carlton but an affordable place to stay and be near the water.  Breakfast is served from 6-9.  Fresh bananas, apples and oranges along with fresh coffee and milk.  You can toast a bagel, make yourself some cereal and cook up a waffle.  If you want a wee bit more breakfast just go across the street to RJ's Cafe.  Oh yea, this place has a great pool and hot tub!  A great place that's affordable to take the family.

Just being honest. It’s a little run down. Stains on the floor and small rooms. Breakfast is sub par at best and the bikes in the exercise room do not work. For the $200+ price tag I thought there’d be more but it’s on the ocean sooo…. Guess that’s what’s the selling point. Good enough I guess
Manager Response: Hi Joseph,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay. We are always looking for ways to improve and your feedback helps us look to those areas directly.

Summary: So we’ve been coming here for several years but for the past few months we noticed that the water is residing the water is farther away and there are a lot more rocks which makes it harder to swim in but you can still paddle board or surf which is what most people do here now you can fish here too, they also added a little store at the end of the parking lot nothing fancy just necessary but they do carry bait.
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear you enjoyed all Dana Point has to offer while staying with us at the Dana Point Marina Inn!

Summary Heading: if you are looking for quiet spot in the Marina and close to restaurant this is the deal
Summary: older hotel but well managed, very nice attentive front desk, best value for the location, free parking, nice pool and jacuzzi, standard breakfast, gym!   We stayed 3 nights and definetly would return for similar rate (hotwire)
Manager Response: Hello Joe,  Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know you enjoyed your stay! Our staff works hard and I will let them know you appreciate their hard work.  We will see you next time!

Summary: rooms clean, laundry facilities, nice breakfast---a little tight on the eating timeline in the am.  lovely views.  good eating places in the vicinity.  helpful staff.  rooms a little dark-need a few brighter lights.
Manager Response: Hello Voyager,  Thank you so much for staying with us! Thank you for your feedback, we recently under went new management and one area we are improving is the lighting in the room! Brightness coming soon!

Summary: I absolutely love staying at the Dana Point Marina Inn when I visit my son.  The front desk staff are so pleasant and helpful.  The hotel rooms are very clean.  Everyone that works at the Inn is always so pleasant!!  Very convenient location for me even if I don't rent a car.  Lots to do.
Manager Response: Hi Anne Maries!!  Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know you loved your stay! I know the front desk works hard to make sure everyone is enjoying their stay, so I know the positive feedback will mean a lot to them. I will get this passed on to the team. We look forward to seeing you next time!

Summary Heading: Great location - good property - nice staff
Summary: Love this hotel - great staff and the location is outstanding. Miss the bikes they'd have for use and the nearby bike rental place, a long walk or a hassle parking is in some transition and they have junky big toy type stuff or rent and during holidays were not open. Bring back the bikes please, we'll pay to rent! Only other option is to drive to San Clemente near train station. But, enjoyed my stay a lot, extended due to great weather and vibe at the harbor over holidays. Will be back again (have been before a few times.)
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your positive feedback, we love our location, the 5 minute walk to Doheny State Beach is a breeze. Your feedback regarding the bikes has been noted. Thank you so much for your loyalty!!

Summary: It was perfect . Nice clean rooms ,lots of parking loved the balcony. It was in walking distance to doheny state beach. Free Breakfast . We will stay here again .fast easy check in and a great value . Close to the marina as well.
Manager Response: Hello Melissa,  We appreciate you taking the time to let us know you enjoyed your stay with us! Our location is such a highlight and I'm so glad you got to enjoy the easy walk to the beach. We look forward to seeing you next time!

Summary Heading: Great Location and on the harbour.
Summary: Lovely staff - got in in the evening, jumped into the perfect temp jacuzzi and enjoyed the buzz of the restaurants nearby.  Lovely little shops to meander around the next morning.  We had one of the new rooms - just perfect!
Manager Response: Hi Sharon!  Thank you so much for taking the time to let us know how much you enjoyed your stay. We love our location and are so glad you do too! The shops being in easy walking distances is such a plus. We look forward to having you stay with us again soon!

Summary: Standard, bit dated hotel but perfectly situated in Dana Point harbor. Ask for a room overlooking the marina. Smallish pool, bike rentals available, plenty of nearby tourist traps and restaraunts. Reasonable rates.
Manager Response: Hi Michael,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know you enjoyed your time with us! We love our Marina view rooms and are so glad you got to experience the wonderful view. We look forward to seeing you next time!

Summary: The hotel was built in the 70's and not all of the rooms updated, but still very nice. We reserved a standard room and realized that it was not going to work. The manager was very helpful and up graded us to a suite and a discount. The contenential breakfast had a lot of selections and was by the pool. Close to shopping and restaurants/ walking distance. Husband and I enjoyed our stay. The staff is very helpful and very friendly!
Manager Response: We are so glad you enjoyed your stay! We look forward to having you join us again soon!

Summary: Receptive staff, rooms neat and comfortable, pool very nice.  Could use a change in pillows though.  A bit noisy on the road side but still tolerable. Good value for your money and the breakfast made it easy for our trip to Catalina and our departure..
Manager Response: Our location is such a highlight!! Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay!

Summary Heading: Nice older property with some great marina views
Summary: The Marina inn is a very convenient location, Easy walking to the marina, Baby beach, and the local waterfront eateries. The rooms are comfortable, a little dated but perfectly comfortable. Nice Balcony views.
Manager Response: Hi Joe!  Thank you for your review, we love how convenient our location is and we are glad you got to experience our wonderful Harbor. We look forward to having you back out next time!

Summary: My husband and I spent four nights here for the Ohana Festival.  We had zero complaints.  The vibe is very peaceful.  Even though the hotel was full, the loudest thing around were the seals in the harbor at night.  The location is perfect if you like to walk; right out your door is a steady stream of cute dogs, ice cream, restaurants and beaches.  Sitting on the balcony and watching life go by brought me to the most zen place.  The hotel is super clean.  The coffee and waffles at the included breakfast were the best way to start the day.  The coffee requires no adornment; I drank it black and it was really good.  Loved the pool-very clean and a comfortable set up!  Overall, this place is legit and a great way to experience Dana Point.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the inn for the Ohana Festival.  We forgot our phone charger so we asked the guy at the front desk if the motel had an extra one.  He said he didn't.  My boyfriend said he knows that motels often have extras from other guests leaving them behind.  The guy became extremely rude and started cussing.  We finally just asked if we could have a wake up call at 6 a.m., since it was Sunday night and we had to leave early to drive back to San Diego for work the next morning.  He said he would give us a wake up call.  We never got one.  Luckily our phones had lasted overnight and our phone alarm went off.  The next morning when we checked out, we told the woman about our experience.  She said they definitely have extra chargers and she wasn't sure why the guy
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: Location was awesome!  To be honest, after reading some of the reviews, I was a little worried.  The rooms are a little dated, but it was comfortable.  For the price and location, it was a great stay!  I would stay again.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: I had never been to California. I had no idea what to expect. I found this place on line. When I arrived it was right on the harbor and only a short walk to OHANA Fest. There were several great local eateries within walking distance. The people were all very nice and helpful. We love the area and will stay here again.

This visit was a return to our Honeymoon Hotel of 40 years ago. Same great service, clean and comfy, but a little dated.  That said, it was just what we wanted!    We might even go there again on our 50th!
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: It was a really nice stay. We checked in late and the person at the desk was very nice and accommodating. Rooms were clean and nice. And more water pressure than most hotels. All rooms have balconies.  I can't wait to stay again.

This is the only hotel in the harbor proper. It’s a little tired, to say the least, but it works. Great hospitality, lots of parking, and amazing midweek prices. Restaurants are everywhere and Doheny Beach and Park are a 15min walk away.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: I have stayed here over a handful of times and every time has been a great experience.  Check in is always fast and easy.  Garrett at the front desk is always super nice and very helpful! This place isn't the fanciest of places however the rooms are nice and clean and all of them have refrigerators along with patios/balconies. The pool and spa is very relaxing and over looks the Mariana.  Perfect for a weekend getaway.

You get what you pay for. The beds were very uncomfortable, along with the pillows. The continental breakfast is very basic, nothing special. I would never stay at this place again. There are definitely better options in the area.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: I checked-In Sunday, Sept. 2nd, 2018 around 5pm. The guy at the front desk was not helpful or pleasant (He had no name tag but he had dark hair). Also the bathroom mirror was very dusty and I had a very bad view from my room. Very sad my 1st visit was terrible.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: My best friend and I planned a weekend getaway and this hotel was perfect! Everything you need is walking distance, food, shops, boat excursions, and scenery.  The room was very clean and large with a nice balcony looking at the harbor.  The refrigerator came in handy for our leftovers!  The pool was relaxing and the towels provided were large and soft.  We have decided that this is going to be our annual getaway.  Makes for great memories and a fun time!

Summary Heading: Good Stay, great location, family friendly
Summary: Just one night stay at this older but well-kept hotel right on the Dana point marina. The location is awesome, close to the freeways, stores, restaurants and of course marina and beach. The hotel is a little older but everything was clean and we had an updated/modern style room.  I had a small group of teen girls and we had adequate space as well as pool towels for the pool, which they enjoyed a lot.  The bathroom is a little small but sufficient especially for a short stay.  Parking is a little tight and the lobby was very hot but I would recommend and return. I got a good deal through a third party for $150/night
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: Our room was very nice, with small fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Included continental breakfast. Easy access to the Marina and gift shops and restaurants. All within short walking distance. Rooms are very reasonable!

The location of this hotel is awesome and enjoyed walking to the marina. We stayed in one of the suites and it was a very large room. The breakfast was great and the workers did a great job. Also, a large plus was the A/C in the room. The rooms are seriously outdated and need repairs. You can tell management is not putting any money into the property. There were multiple cockroaches, bathtub faucet didn't work, tub didn't drain, and room smelled. They really shouldn't be able to charge what they do. You are paying for location only.

Spent a good night’s sleep at the Dana Point Marina Inn. The room had a coffee maker and mini fridge. There was a wedding going on at the time but very little noise. Access to the harbor and nice spots to sit outside. A bit dated but clean and quiet in a great location. The only flaw was I had to have my room key exchanged twice as it demagnetized??

We finished our trip to legoland and our hotel wouldn't extend our stay. Found this place on trip advisor. Outstanding location. The guys in the lobby were helpful. The room is decent. But you're in walking distance from restaurants,  gift shops, beach, and ocean institute. If we're down in that area again we will try and stay here.

Summary Heading: A bit Old and Dated but still OK
Summary: The Hotel is well located , close to the water and eateries. The rooms are spacious, and have their own fridge. A reasonable breakfast is provided, and their is a small pool with spa on the hotel grounds,

Clean comfortable room in a great location at a good price. Decent (not great) breakfast with make-your-own hot waffles, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, etc. Good service at the front desk. Housekeeping knocking on our door at 8am woke us (next time use the Do not Disturb door knob hanger). I would stay here again for sure.

Summary Heading: Beat the heat in Dana Point
Summary: Our getaway was highlighted by cool ocean breezes and many wonderful eating places close by. Our room on the third floor had a balcony with two comfortable chairs. Though not facing the marina, we still had a nice view. Despite the fixtures and decor being a bit dated, we found everything clean and well maintained. Very nice pool area. Amenities include a coffee maker, fridge, hair dryer, iron and ironing board and a nice selection of channels on the flat screen. A breakfast is included and featured DYI waffles, fruit, pastries, yogurt, etc. You can take the Dana Point trolley if you want to drink or just don't feel like driving.

We have stayed here often with our grand kids.  The location is great, the price is right and it's a good value.  There is only one chair - the desk chair.  We were poolside, which was nice but it's noisy.  The lighting and bathroom lighting could be improved.   Bedding was okay but the pillows weren't, thought you got 3 per bed.  The free wifi is awful!  Continental breakfast is basic but decent.  The breakfast room is very crowded.  Parking is free and the staff are very good, as was the housekeeping.  Bring a nightlight.  The pool area and spa were very nice with a lot of shaded tables.  Lots of affordable restaurants within walking distance in the marina for all meals.  Hotel rooms have been updated since our last stay in 2012.  Pedestal sink in the bathroom is awful because

My mom and I really enjoyed our trip. The room was clean and the view from balcony was awesome. It’s very close to te beach. All restaurants are 3 minutes away. Very nice place to walk around meet other people! The breakfast was super! Thank you!

Stayed here with eight other family members for a wedding nearby. The accommodations were clean and well maintained. Hotel location is fantastic. Walking distance to beach, shops, restaurants and even a liquor store right across the street. Pool and Jacuzzi  were just the right temperature and the pool furniture were clean and comfortable. The staff was great. They really knew how to please a loud raucous bunch.  For price location and service this place is hard to beat.

This gem of a place has been around for a while. It is great to unwind and enjoy the slight after beaches and marina. Prices are fair, and the staff even better. The  workout facilities are dated, but very serviceable. We really loved the weekend here.

This was our second time here. Came here one year ago for a friends wedding, this time for my wife's birthday. Nice, well kept facilities, very cordial and helpful staff, clean pool and spa. Plenty to do, walking around the beautiful marina area, bike riding, and going to the beach, all right close by, and plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance. Last time we had a second floor pool side balcony, this time a second floor outside balcony overlooking the restaurants/shops (south side). We actually thought this was nicer as it was quieter and more secluded. The continental breakfast is very good, but they could truly use a second waffle machine as the wait time on both visits was quite long for the very delicious waffles. Two things we highly recommend to everyone, Dana

We had drove in for an evening wedding and arrived early since we didn't run into much traffic. We walked around the shopping center and grabbed a bite to eat but it still wasn't time for check in. We explained the situation and asked when room would be ready.. Politely they said room was ready and allowed us to check in. The room was clean and had all the basics(and a kitchenette). Everyone was super nice

Summary Heading: Much Needed R & R..........and we did do just that!
Summary: Over the years we have visited this area of So Cal and keep coming back.  This time we stayed at the Dana Point Marina Inn, what a treat!  Our room was facing the Marina and so convenient to all the shops and restaurants.  We were able to walk the marina any time day or night and enjoy the breeze and look at the sea lions.  We did not leave the marina once.........never got in the car at all.  Took lots of naps and just enjoyed each others company.  My husband and I look forward to our next stay at the Dana Point Marina Inn, Oh and did I mention the free breakfast that is included in the stay.  Very clean and the people that work there are very kind.  What are you waiting for...........make your reservation today, you won't be sorry.  See you there soon.

Summary Heading: On the Marina with good access to ocean.
Summary: This hotel has balconies.  They charge more for rooms with full Marina view.   We had balcony over looking the pool and marina.   Very nice room and fun sitting on balcony.   No restaurant but many within walking distance.     Only 3 floors so lower floors not a great view for price - so ask for higher.     Breakfast just standard -  nothing great.   Staff very helpful and pool and spa clean.   Would stay there again.

Love the location. The room was clean quiet and comfortable. The continental breakfast was great. The staff was pleasant. Highly recommended hotel to stay at with convenient access to great restaurants, gift shops, the Marine Institute and the beach. All are within walking distance. No complaints here.

Our first night our room wasn't ready. After waiting we were told it was ready. However it was mistakenly entered completed. They gave us a discount for the inconvenience. The TV didn't work and was taken care of in less than a minute. Excellent customer service.

Summary Heading: First Come First Served-Reservations not Honored
Summary: For many years we were satisfied customers, not necessarily with everything, but the perfect location always made up for any other deficiencies. But the last 3 years have finally exasperated us to no end and we are ending this " One Way Loyalty " . My wife was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis years ago and is also a Breast Cancer survivor for 3 years, and now has a Service Dog. Because of these issues we always made reservations far in advance, requesting only One Thing, a First Floor Garden Room and after a long and sometime very tedious 300 mile trip from Las Vegas, we arrive and have been told there are No First Floor rooms available at all. This has happened for the last 6 trips (we average 4 to 6 trips a year) and Someone named Amir continues to treat us like lost sheep.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: Huge room, excellent location, nice staff.  Clean and comfortable.  Free breakfast was standard and good - waffles, cereal, breads, and pastries, etc. We would stay again.  The shower head was low even for 5'4" me!  Kitchen area was big with counter space, micro, mini-fridge.

Bed was worn in one spot. Like someone only sleeps in the one spot. Left side of the bed. Other than that they had very nice and clean room. Nice view. Affordable. Clean. I'm trying to write 200 characters for this review to accept.

Summary Heading: Just stayed for the night for a party near by
Summary: We were invited to a party near by and since it was Cinco de Mayo and Kentucky Derby, we decided not to drive back home. We booked a room a few weeks in advance.   Its pretty nice here. Older but right on harbor!!  Room was clean, lots of towels!!! Still had free soap, shampoo, lotion & a shower cap!!  Good size in room refrigerator.  Kept our wine ice cold.  Even had ANDES chocolates on desk!!  Our mini mini patio had a chair but the view was the parking lot.   Good rate compared to anything else. Will go back.

After too much driving on LA freeways, it was a relief to park the car at the Marina Inn for a couple of days and walk everywhere.  Whale watching, restaurants and shopping are all within easy walking.  The Harbor is beautiful with over 2500 boats!  The staff are friendly and helpful, but a little "relaxed" about service.  The room was nice and clean with microwave and refrigerator..  Breakfast was a little "slim".

Great place for small gathering of family or friends. They recognize the need for a place where it’s not expensive yet still want quality service. Near the pier and close to the highway and shopping centers.

Summary Heading: Very clean, nice location and modern rooms
Summary: This hotel was very clean, set in a nice location close to the water, restaurants and 2 blocks from Doheny State Beach (Where concerts are held), they also provide a very good continental breakfast (waffles, bagels, cereals, oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt, danish and muffins). The room was modern and nicely furnished, but the mattress was very old and lacked any kind of firm support. The WiFi was not very strong either. Lastly, don't count on getting an early check-in during any kind of special event/concert weekend. Although, the front desk attendant provided us a parking pass to leave our car there, so we could head directly to the concert and check-in after. With those last things in mind, I give this hotel 4 out of 5 stars.

Summary Heading: Needed an overnight by the marina
Summary: We booked this very last minute because we needed to be at the marina early in the morning and, well, sometimes we're too lazy to get up early. Check in was simple. Everything was in order. Our room was neat and tidy-it could use some updating. We'd read some not so favorable reviews of the rooms being dirty, but that was not the case with ours at all. The linens were in great condition. There was a small fridge, which I always appreciate. They have a breakfast room and it was well stocked. The typical waffles, cereal, yogurt, juice, and coffee. The outdoor patio by the pool was a nice place to enjoy my coffee. Some rooms have a small patio, others a balcony. If you want an ocean view-of which I didn't care since I live near the ocean, expect to pay about $100 more per night. I

Really good hotel with particularly helpful staff. My sister had a refurbished room which was very nice. I was up on the third floor in a clean but very tired room. I can only assume that they are working their way through the hotel in order to bring it all up to the same standard.

Summary Heading: Best Economy Hotel in Dana Point
Summary: Spent weekend in Dana Point for a retreat with my wife. Have to say that for the price, this was a pretty great place to stay. I’ve heard complaints about the hotel being outdated, but honestly, to me I found it very charming. Plus the views from the hotel were pretty amazing.  The room that we stayed in was newly remodeled and had a more modern feeling in comparison to the entire hotel. Breakfast was served daily. Not the best breakfast in the world, but definitely something to get you going on your day.  We looked at other hotel options in the area and they were all at least four times higher than what we currently paid at Dana point Marina Inn. If your goal is to check out the sites, to go enjoy yourself, and need a place to stay that won’t break the bank, this is definitely

This hotel is located within walking distance of the Dana Point Landing which is why we chose it. The management was friendly. The room is in need of updating/remodeling and the bed was so hard I had a really rough night. It could really use a topper.  The breakfast was average.

I have stayed here a few times before, and always found it pleasant, well situated, and good value. We checked in approx 4pm on a Saturday, and were allocated possibly the only room in the hotel with no balcony. We were there for two days. On leaving, my wife queried why we didn't get a balcony room, and was told it was first come, first served. I queried this later by e mail to the hotel. The manager, (to his credit,) gave me a lengthy response, but didn't answer the question, other than it was busy. I don't accept at 4pm, all rooms were allocated. We were also told breakfast was until 10am. On Monday, it finished at 9am, so we missed it.  The man who checked us in was functional and not welcoming. He was the same man who my wife spoke to upon leaving. Upon being shown, in his
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: The location is good but the Inn is a dilapidated dump that should be condemned  at the very least. I am shocked the board of health didn't close it down.. I have stayed here with group travelers 3 times, much to my dismay. I had a decent room facing the boats the first time. The next 2 times they put us in the room of horrors. The tub was stained , the bathroom filthy looking. The bedsreads scary! Didn't want to touch them. I asked 'Daniel', at the desk," the manager", to please change our room. He was condescending, surly, sarcastic and down right nasty. I told him I would like an upgrade and would happily pay for it. He said all the rooms were the same. I begged to differ since I had a better room before. He told me tough luck and I told him to get a refund ready because
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: This is the NICEST hotel for value in the Dana Point / San Clemente area overlooking the Dana Point Harbor and walking distance to good restaurants and fun activities in the harbor. The Dana Point Marina Inn and staff has been THE favorite of our family for over 30 years. The rooms are large, updated and super clean (half overlook the harbor and pool area!). They have a beautiful quiet and clean pool area that is so relaxing. The lobby and breakfast area are very welcoming. Most of all General Manger Tony, Night Manager Amir, desk staff and the service crew (who have all been there for many years and take great pride in the hotel and its accommodations) are wonderfully pleasant and obviously enjoy their job of serving the visitors. What more can I say... 5 star operation! We
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: What a treat the Dana Point Marina Inn is! It is an older place but has all you need to enjoy a stay in southern Calif. So many convenient great restaurants nearby. Easy walk to catch a boat ride to Catalina or go whale watching. There is a pool and Jacuzzi as well as a decent continental breakfast. A nice place that i would visit again.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: The harbor area is very relaxing and enjoyable!
Summary: We recently stayed 4 nights, and enjoyed out time there.    The rooms need some updating, but they were clean and maintained.    We appreciated their morning breakfast area and food.     It was good basic food and the staff was attentive to any service needs.

Summary Heading: Not so nice stay in a very nice location
Summary: This hotel was the most awkward stay I've ever had.  It was sort of like the hotel was trying to be nice, but just was not cutting it.  They had been doing renovations it seemed, but the rooms were all over the board. Some were nice, some were old and dingy, some were half-way renovated, it was really bizarre. When we first checked in, the bed in our room broke the second we sat down, and the T.V. didn't work.  The room itself was just recently re-done though, had a nice bar/counter-top area and looked great, but the bathroom wasn't touched, it was the original from before renovations, the tub had stains and overall it did not match the room.  Since the bed was broken, we switched rooms to down the hall, same type of room, but this one had a balcony, no bar area, and the
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary Heading: Good location from which to catch the morning ferry
Summary: This seemed like a nice hotel, but for us, it was merely a staging point between a long day at Disney - about 40 minutes away - and the morning ferry to Santa Catalina Island. We arrived after 10 p.m., and had to skip breakfast to be at the ship around 9 a.m. Ironically, the ferry’s long-term parking brought us right back behind the hotel where we left our vehicle. So we didn’t have a not of time to check the place out, but we had a second floor room which seemed large and comfortable. The desk clerk said they upgraded us to a “pool view” room, which basically meant we were on the ocean side, but could only see the hotel’s pool because all the docked boats blocked any view of the Pacific. From our walk back to the ferry after parking, there were definitely a number of dockside

Stayed two nights at the Dana Point Marina Inn. Room was clean, comfortable with a great shower. Loved having the patio to sit out on. Checked in earlier than planned with no issues. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Yes this is an older hotel but from what I saw was well cared for. Could use some updates on the hallway lighting. Excellent breakfast in the morning. Close to many restaurants and shops in the harbor. Would stay again.

This large hotel has seen better days but the location is outstanding. The hotel was built sometime in the 70s and has had just enough maintenance to keep it going. The breakfast room has seating for 28 inside and about half that many outside. The breakfast itself is on par to a Hotel 6 or 8 except they do have a waffle machine. If it were not for the location I would not give it 3 starts, as there is a lot to do in the area without requiring transportation.

Summary Heading: Please update to match the scenery
Summary: Spent a weekend with my wife at the Dana Point Marina Inn. The location is wonderful, as to be expected from Dana Point. Great Doheny beach and the pier has a fantastic view. Saw the sea lions on a nearby dock (sunning themselves-suckers wee big too. About three adults and one kid).inwas part of my church group for a retreat, so you should be pleased with what you get. I go to the room, and wasn’t too thrilled.   I understand the age of a hotel, and how updating the furnishings, carpet, and halls can make a (seemingly) not so attractive hotel become something you can envy for your own home. This needed an overhaul all around. Pool area was nice, but they had a fountain fixture near the courtyard that needs a new motor. They had a quaint continent al breakfast on Sunday, but can

Summary Heading: older but clean, comfortable and great location and value
Summary: Yes the property is not brand new. I had none of the problems some of the other reviewers mentioned. We had a large comfortable and clean room. Garden view which was fine at a good rate. The location at the harbor cannot be beat with restaurants, marina and shopping right there.  Free parking on the premises. The Wifi was a little spotty, other than that our stay was great. Checkin was quick and staff was pleasant and good with advice on the area.

Rooms are dated, poor water pressure, room had jalousie window missing, bugs got in.  Air conditioner from room above had condensation dripping on my a/c unit...noisy.  Elevator is SLOW.   Last night there, kids were running rampant in the halls.  Close to restaurants,marina.  Housekeeping leaves 3 chocolate mints every night.

Summary Heading: Great location and a good value
Summary: We spent a weekend with family here renting about 10 rooms.  The location is great for exploring Dana point. It is located in the harbor and it is easy walking distance to the beach, restaurants and shops.  The hotel is not high end but it does have nice pool, wifi and continental breakfast.  It is clean and a good value compared to other hotels in the area.  The quality of the rooms improve based upon the price of the rooms.  Nicer rooms are not as faded as some of the other rooms but these differences are really cosmetic – peeling paint, wear and tear, etc.  I would definitely stay here again.

The staff at the reception were so friendly and helpful.  As I said in the title....I just loved the location.  Dana Point Marina is a beautiful place....amazing views.  The room was clean, big and nicely decorated.  I would definitely stay here again.  I went to meet a friend at Laguna Beach....and the drive on the Pacific Coast Highway was wonderful.

The location is perfect. The hotel is older but nice and clean. Very simple but the location is so great. I have stayed here several times. The service is always good. Walking distance to many nice places to eat and shopping.

This place has a great location and the prices are good. The staff was helpful and nice. The building itself is pretty tired. The walls are very thin so you can hear people talk and the tv in the next room very clearly so it made trying to sleep difficult. The bathroom fixtures were damaged. I have stayed here may times but it really needs a renovation.

The hotel was fine , but they put us in adjoining room next to a baby and at 5am , she was screaming. The Continental Breakfast was fine but there was no plain yogurt. Beautiful location near harbor , but gave us room over looking roof.

I rated the hotel 4 stars because of the location and the staff.  Greg & Andrea, who checked us in, were very informative in reference to local restaurants and all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful.   The location couldn't be better. The marina area has many shops and restaurants and seems very family friendly.   The hotel building itself is dated and what I would rate as 3 stars...average. That said, it's clean and everything in our room worked as it should. The towels are thick and fluffy, nice pillows and comfortable beds. We were on the parking lot side on the ground floor and had a small patio with two chairs. There was minimal traffic noise even though we were there on a weekend.   The wall mounted air conditioning harkens to the past, as does much of the

Summary Heading: Good value in a marina location
Summary: This is a larger hotel with three floors and ample parking.  Our standard King room was good sized with a bar sink and long counter.  We liked having an extra sink in the room, even though it didn’t drain well.  Our first floor room opened to a courtyard and was quiet.  Front desk staff was pleasant.    The small AC unit was newer and worked well.  The half sized refrigerator had a small freezer.  The closet was large but the bathroom was smallish.  Steps away from the harbor and marina and a few hundred yards from the Ocean Institute.    On the negative side the carpets were a little worn and bath tub fixtures very old.  Also a few minor paint nicks and tile issues.  Disappointing there was only one chair in the room, a room for two people?!  We didn’t eat the breakfast, but

The appeal of the Marina Inn is that it is right on the harbor.  You aren't looking across busy Dana Point Harbor Drive.  The property is older but clean and well maintained.  We enjoyed sitting on the balcony. The rooms are a good size but sparsely furnished.  We wanted a little table with two chairs so we could play a game or two, but there was just a big empty space in the room where the table should have been.   The heated salt water pool is very well maintained as is the hot tub.  Lots of restaurants and shops are near the property or a short walk across the street.  Don't miss Heritage Park up on the bluffs, directly across Harbor Drive from the Inn.

Summary Heading: Lovely place to escape the heat
Summary: Really enjoyed my stay here.  Love the room with the balcony and chairs.  It was pricier than I usually spend but worth the birthday treat for myself.  The only thing I can fault was noise from a generator running all night outside my room.  Really wanted to sleep with the sliding door open to enjoy the evening air but the noise never stopped and was like a train passing.  So if you want an open room, try not to get around 203 which is 2nd floor by a side street.  Otherwise its close to many restaurants and nearby Baby Beach is better than the pool.  Dana Pt is cooler than my place only 20 min away.
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind words.  Not sure about that generator thing on the 203 side.  I wonder if they were doing some type of work on that side near the shops.  It is a higher traffic area for sure.  Thanks for the feedback.   Hope to see you soon!   Tony (GM)

Summary: The hotel is OK - 3 stars is about right. On the Dana Point harbor and next to the eateries and bars there (Turks is one of my favorites). Always fun to hang out on the wharf and see the people going out for fishing and Catalina Island. I have stayed there 3 times. We skip the continental breakfast and got o the harbor for breakfast.
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind words.    The Dana Point Marina Inn is a great value when you can get promotional rates around the $100 range for a standard room.  To stay in the Dana Point harbor right next to 20 awesome eateries and bars.  The shops in the harbor are very cool.  Woody Hut is my favorite! Coffee Importers for the California Bagel is high on the list as well.  Walking distance to Dana Wharf Sports Fishing and Catalina Express.   We host many social gatherings - Reunions, wedding groups and retreats.  Its sorta funny that other hotels in the area are WAY more expensive and they may host a a portion of the group...but they all seem to find their way to the Dana Point Marina Inn.  The vibe and atmosphere is not intimating and very relaxing.    Hope to see you again!   Tony

Summary: We were travelling from Sanfrancisco to San Diego and stopping off along Highway 1 we came across Dana point marina bay hotel and enjoyed two nights there the staff and other residents were very helpful and friendly towards us making our stay lovely. The sun terrace and pool area was lovely too. We really enjoyed our stay here thank you
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: i know that Marina Inn rooms need to be updated, but for me as long as my room is clean,i'm ok with that, and housekeeping there is excellent . the 1 thing i wish they would do is put safes in the rooms, i dont like the safety deposit boxes in the lobby.

Was traveling with a group.  When we arrived the staff was waiting.  Very efficient checkin.  My room was perfect.  Breakfast was a nice assortment with enough for all.  The only problem was the short hours.  If I was on vacation I wouldn't want to be rushed to finish breakfast by 9am.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Excellent deal in a great location!
Summary: I enjoyed my stay at Dana Point Marina Inn hotel. I was a little worried to book it because the reviews seemed luke-warm, but I decided to try it because of the low price. I was really impressed for what I got for my money. My room was inexpensive, but was clean and well-maintained. The hotel is a little dated, but I spent my days outside my hotel room and just needed a safe, clean, comfortable place to sleep. I had a view overlooking the marina, and was a few minutes walk or drive from all the great stuff Dana Point has to offer, including the state beach.  No complaints about my stay, the staff, or the facilities. Especially good for bargain-hunters who value location over flash.
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind words.    Yes, the Dana Point Marina Inn is a great value for the location.  The hotel is a little dated...that's part of the historical California charm, but its right in the middle of all the action.  We realize this hotel is not for everyone.  But, if you are looking for an inexpensive (compared to other hotels in the area) getaway this is the place.  Cant beat free parking, heated pool and Jacuzzi, no resort fees, free wifi, free cont breakfast and being 100 yards from the water.  Not a bad deal!   Hope to see you again.  Tony K.

Summary: We were looking for an inexpensive, close to home getaway for a day. After looking around the Dana Point area, we decided to try this hotel.  While the reviews were pretty good but not really fantastic, the price was right so we decided to go with it.  What a surprise ~ a fantastic location (and just down from the $350+/nt resort up the street!) near the beach for surfing and restaurants/bars for the evening.
