And, even though we booked online, the very nice manager upgraded our room to a balcony overlooking the harbor.  It was perfect!  Our room looked recently updated, fairly modern and very clean.This hotel is greatly underrated.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Smoking in a non smoking facility
Summary: I came to my room to find cigarette ashes and two water bottles full of butts on the porch and then after they cleaned it up (which they were very prompt with) I wanted to sit outside and a lady across way is smoking. Shower had dirty washrags hanging on rod.Location is great but facility very old.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: My room was clean and very large with a view of the harbor.  The rate was the best in the area.  You could walk to almost everything around the harbor easily so this was very convenient.  The staff was accommodating and helpful except that my room was missing a clock and the front desk said they'd have one delivered but they never did.  However, I was on vacation so perhaps not having a clock was a blessing.  It's an older hotel and could do with some updating but as I mentioned earlier it was clean and pretty quiet so I was satisfied.

Don't expect four-star accommodations, but if you need an easy, affordable place to stay in a great location, it's worth it. Great harbor view. walking distance to many shops, restaurants and all along the harbor.
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind words!   Tony K.

Summary: The Marina Inn had the most reasonable price on short notice for a one night stay, so I wasn't expecting much. I was surprised to see how spacious the room turned out to be. I enjoyed the night I spent there and would definitely look into staying at the Marina Inn again.

Summary Heading: Location Perfect, Older Hotel, Great Value
Summary: I was in the area for a wedding and needed a last minute hotel that wasn't >$400 like the rest of the other hotels in the area and came across this gem. The location is right in the middle of everything within Dana Point or at least just a quick lyft/uber ride away. For me I was looking for something close to the beach, was affordable, and didn't smell like mold. We ended up booking this hotel at $160 for the night on a Saturday and was able to check in just fine and the staff was very helpful/friendly. They recommended I get the second floor room because the first floor can get noisy in the morning from all the old folks going to get the free continental breakfast.   Overall a great hotel for the price, only thing that bugged me was when i came back for the night there were a

Great location on the waterfront in the middle of everything.  Hotel though is a bit dated.  Not a 4 star.  Wifi is terrible, kicked you off constantly. Pool small but enjoyable if not many other people in it.  Free breakfast is ok, wish they had some more protein in AM (hard boiled eggs are simple and cheap).  Housekeeping did a great job each AM.  Front deck check in was lacking and not engaging, forgot to give me a gift bag for a group I was booked with.

Summary Heading: Good location & value. Not very customer friendly. HORRIBLE WiFi
Summary: The location is great right on the marina.  The room was spacious and pleasant.  Some of the common areas, particularly staircases, were very worn.  The breakfast was free, but basic.  The free WiFi was horrible, effectively unusable. The staff said that the problem is known, but unfixable due to their location, but that seems highly doubtful.  The staff is rigid about the end of breakfast at 9 AM. NOT client friendly. And the desk staff refused to rent one of their bikes to us because we had already done an early-morning checkout. They said "No", with a smile, but whatever happened to accommodating the client. Rigid policies. NOT client friendly.
Manager Response: Thats a bummer about the breakfast and bikes.  We try to accommodate all requests.  Not sure what happened with the breakfast room.  I know it closes at 9am, but allow guests to stay sometimes till 10:00 am.  Something on weekends....we extend it a little longer.  The bike rental is an easy fix.  Just post it on your room.  I will bring these issues up at our next staff meeting.  We want be as accommodating as possible.   Thanks for the feedback.    Tony /GM

Summary: This is a very modest hotel, with clean rooms and comfortable beds with firm mattresses.  While the amenities are minimal, (continental breakfast - no restaurant on site) the location is excellent.  It is located next to the harbor, less than a mile from Doheny Beach, a clean park with bathrooms and picnic tables, and friendly park rangers.  They provide free wi-fi service, but it is a tad slow.  For a So Cal popular beach town, the room rates are pretty reasonable.  I was billed at $140/night.  I love this region of Southern CA, and definitely plan on returning and staying at the Marina Inn.    There are several restaurants in the area, all within walking distance

Okay, so no crystal chandeliers greet your entry, nor does a well dressed bellman...or a bellman of any stripe for that matter, but located virtually on the water in Dana Point Harbor, parking aplenty, steps away from shopping and marina walks, and...at a price which attracts a second look (could this be true?) the Marina Inn is a huge bargain. Friendly desk folks, a modest but satisfying continental breakfast, rooms with frig, microwaves and toiletries, we come back again and again!  Love this place!

This is the only hotel in Dana Point Marina and it is within walking distance to restaurants and 2 beaches.  Doheny and the Baby Beach.  The hotel was in good shape.  They have a built-in pool which i believe is heated and hottub.  We stayed in Room 334 which was noisy due to the air conditioner from the unit below us.  Each room has a small balcony.  Ours overlooked the courtyard.  They have a breakfast area with waffles, danish, cereals, yogurts, fruit, coffee & juice.

Summary Heading: The Marina Inn is an older hotel, but a real bargain if you're staying 5 to 7 nights or more,
Summary: This hotel is in the Harbor just a little northwest of the main parking lot for the restaurants and the shops at the Harbor. I have stayed here several times while moving to Dana Point or when my landlord has to do repairs that require me to vacate my rental. I have stayed overnight and for as long as two weeks. Many of the rooms have kitchenettes so you can cook and keep perishables refrigerated. Friday and Saturday nights  are more than expensive than Sunday through Thursday,  which are, depending on the season and the market, usually $79 to $99 a week night. If you are staying  local for  a week or more talk to the staff, the manager has given me better rates  in the  off/slow season with a two week plus stay. I think of the Marina Inn as being nostalgic and very reasonably
Manager Response: Hello 333Greenman,   Thanks for the kind words.  We pride ourselves are a very community oriented hotel and love our locals.  We do offer midweek discounts.  Our rates are VERY reasonable considering the location (Dana Point Harbor).    Hope to see you again.  Best regards,   Tony K.  - General Manager

Summary: We celebrated our wedding anniversary with our children and grandchildren and had a really good time in the DP Marina Inn. The rooms were comfortable, breakfast was good and the children liked the pool and hot tub. The price of the rooms are reasonable and are good value for money I can certainly recommend the Inn and if we go back to Dana Point in the future we plan to stay in this inn again
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind comments.  We really try to be a family oriented hotel.  The shops and restaurants and beaches are only steps away.    It makes for a great value family get-away.     Hope to see you soon.  Tony K.  Manager Dana Point Marina Inn

Summary: We stayed here because it was cheaper than hotels in Laguna Beach. But remember you get what you pay for.  The bathroom was unpleasant. Someone had used an abrasive cleaner on the bathtub unit and it was wrecked. It looked unclean no matter what they tried. The ventilation fan was so noisy it sounded like a spaceship was about to land! The wifi was inaccessible in the room. The only decent wifi was in the depressing lobby.  The hallway carpets were very dirty (especially in the stairwells).  Breakfast consists of nothing but sugar & carbs.  This place has a monopoly on the bay, they really need to up their game.
Manager Response: Hello Goldfinger66,   My first question is you mentioned the hotel was on the bay.  We are located in a  harbor.  There is a hotel with a similar name located near a bay.  So, I just want to make sure we are the correct hotel.  This error in hotels happens all the time.    If we are the hotel you stayed at I would like to apologize and ask if you seeked a remedy during your visit - Did you tell the front desk about these issues?  We encourage our guests to seek immediate resolution to any issue so we have the opportunity to make it right.  Most issues can be fixed immediately if we are aware of them.  Your name, date of stay and room number would be most helpful in researching the problem so we can correct any issues to avoid future guests in having the same problem.   We value your feedback and constantly try to improve our hotel in every way we can. Thank you for staying with us and please feel free to contact me directly if you would like to discuss these issues in more detail.   Best regards,  Tony Kaspar General Manager Dana Point Marina Inn

Summary: My friend has a boat at the Dana Point Marina so I always come down and stay at the Dana Point Marina Inn which is conveniently located directly across from the Marina. There are great eating establishments close by and trails to walk along the Marina.   The room was clean with mediocre decor that gave it an older beachy vibe. Never really spoke to the staff so I can't comment on that. The pool and Jacuzzi were nice to utilize during this stay. There weren't any towels at the pool which was a bit depressing since I hadn't brought a towel from my room. Had to run back to the room dripping wet.   If you want to stay in Dana Point and enjoy all it has to offer, this hotel is in the perfect location and will give you everything you need to enjoy your stay. PS: The waffles in the

Great location rooms all have a small kitchen and fridge. Walk at the door and your looking at the marina. Nice restaurants all around the marina. Located 5 minutes from laguna beach . Took a boat ride to see the dolphins and the seals. Loved it
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Called I believe the Travel Lodge, Prices were quite high, asked if he knew anything in the area more reasonable, and was referred to Dana Point.  The room was $99.00.  Trust me, we had paid $110. 2 nights previously for a Hotel 6 or "whatever"  A TOTAL DUMP!.  Could not find the TV remote on arrival (VERY serious issue for me) !!!  Called the front desk, I found it between the mattress & the headboard at the same time that a fellow was at the door with a replacement....IMPRESSIVE !   WONDERFUL / COMFORTABLE BED (King) Nice Balcony / VERY CLEAN ROOM / WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND !!   The Marina is basically a one minute walk.  Nice clean Continental Breakfast included.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Great location for a great price
Summary: There are not many places in California where you can stay on the coast for this price.  This is not a 5 star resort and the price reflects that.  The rooms have everything you need, the bed is comfortable and breakfast is thrown in.  Everyone we spoke to who worked there was lovely.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: It's dirty but hey... at least it's noisy!
Summary: Bathroom fixtures are really old and worn and look disgusting. (See pictures) The walls are thin to the point of easily hearing conversations next door, bath fans are noisy and so is the refrigerator. They don't have any door closers so people can slam the door to the room next to you and keep waking you up.  They have a patio in the courtyard so people sit out there till all hours whooping it up ( kept me awake till 1:30 AM despite 3 calls to the front desk). They switched us to another “non smoking” room but it reeked like smoke and the sink was plugged.    3rd room was fine so it shows they have some good rooms (hence the good reviews you will read).  You just don’t want to come here during busy seasons or long weekends when, if you get a bad room, you can’t get switched.
Manager Response: This an odd review.  First and the most concerning are the pictures of the bathroom.  They are absolutely NOT of our hotel.  Secondly, we do have a Manager on Duty at all times.  In fact, there is a resident manager on site, a upper level sales manager 7 days a week and the General Manager works six days a week.  There are also supervisors and lead personnel scheduled at all times.  All but the most obscure issues can be addressed immediately 24/7.    Are you sure you posted this review for the right hotel? If so, why would you post pictures of another hotel? And why did you not reach to the manager directly....This review with additional guest information would be very helpful for resolving any issues you experienced.  We are requesting additional information be sent to hotel  regarding your stay for further action.    We deserve a chance to make things right!   Management and Staff  Dana Point Marina Inn

Summary: Just spent 9 nights here, visiting from the East coast. I was quite pleased with this establishment. First, its not the Hilton its a Marina motel so these are motel accommodations so I judge/review on this basis. Very nice, clean and comfortable. Really LOVE the location as well. At night from the balcony I could hear the sea lions barking out past the harbor and even a few rabbits running by.  The sunsets were wonderful and the overall relaxed feel was just what I needed. If your not looking for the upscale experience this is a really wonderful pick and in walking distance to all the harbor shops and restaurants

This place is such a gem in the middle of Dana Point. MY fiance and I celebrated our anniversary here over the weekend of Nov 19th and it was simply beautiful. Here's a quick run through of the hotel.  LOCATION: This spot sits on the Dana Point Harbor which means you have a full dock full of boats nearby giving it that small town feel (at least that's how we felt) , with plenty of gift shops and places to eat nearby.  Rooms: 5 stars all around. The room 326 was clean and comfortable with new beds, a spacious bathroom and and nice view of dana point harbor and highway 1. Comfortable,  Clean, calming.   Service: this hotel is wonderful.  I requested an early check in due to our early arrival and they happily got us in without and any hassle and were so kind to point out great
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: A nice friendly place in a beautiful area.
Summary: My wife and I stayed here last week while looking for homes in the area.  With all of the traveling we do, it was nice to be greeted by the friendly desk clerk who was very helpful with suggestions on the local fare.  Our room, overlooking the marina on the second floor was a basic but clean room with a balcony, king bed and refrigerator.  Towels were plentiful and comfortable.  We did take advantage of the gym, pool and hot tub, where we met and talked with other people staying that the Inn.  They include a basic continental breakfast, where we met and spoke to Carey, an employee with a very friendly smile who keeps the food flowing.  Being that we are moving to the area in the spring, Carey gave us some valuable information about living in the area.  When we return to the area

This hotel is a great value for being situated right of the Harbor and next to Baby Beach.  The hotel is now owned by the county and managed privately and always being maintained and upgraded.  It's general atmosphere is nothing grand or luxurious but really perfect if your main objective is to enjoy the water sports nearby.  The renowed surfer and paddle boarding haven of Doheny Beach is adjacent to this hotel and is the site of numerous music, water and family oriented festivals year round.  This hotel has no fancy dining halls, meeting rooms or spas but the front desk is generally friendly and courteous.  It is not terribly pet friendly, although many visitors enjoy walking their dogs around the marina.  The breakfast area allows for nice vistas of the marina as does the pool
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: WOW the location could not be more beautiful!  Also easy walking to lots of dining options, convenient to Pacific Coast Highway, the beach and the freeway.  The staff are super friendly - totally making up for the fact that the rooms are little tired.  The bathrooms especially are really in need of an upgrade.  Honestly, the price with location and friendly service make up for it.  Free wifi, coffee in the room, a good continental breakfast is included and a free business station with free printing, free parking.

Have stayed here several times.  The hotel is a great location for the whale watching near by.  The staff is more than helpful.  The breakfast is ok, could be a lot better.  Within walking distance to many fine shops.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Very modest hotel in a fantastic location, right in the middle of Dana Point harbor area. Walking distance to restaurants, paddle boarding, marina, water excursions. Short drive to Hwy 5. Some rooms are updated and some are not. Not a luxury hotel, but perfect for couples and families on a budget. My family has stayed here for close to 30 years for family reunions. Nice continental breakfast buffet, which is included for hotel guests.

This the 2nd time I've stayed at the Dana point marina inn. My husband's marine battalion has its reunion here every other year.  Beds are super comfy. Pillows so nice you sink in. Everything is pretty great.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Room is Comfortable, Customer Service is lacking
Summary: Customer Service is not good, especially with manager Tony Kasper. I left the hotel and didn't know I left my USB hub with phone cords in the wall until later. I called the main number and was connected to Lost and Found. Nicholas took down my information and said he would call me back. After a couple of hours, I was still not called back. I called the manager to let him know. He said he would connect me to Lost and Found again. I said I have already spoken with them but have not received a call back. He said, "I will be out of the office the rest of the day for a meeting and will not be able to help you".  I told him I was sorry I didn't mean to disturb him, I would not disturb him again and before I could even finish my sentence he hung up on me. I was not being sarcastic or
Manager Response: Thank you for selecting the Dana Point Marina Inn.    I was simply implying that I was on my way to a meeting and would not be able to immediately help you in your search for your lost item.    Before I could ask for anymore information about your lost item, it was clear you were upset and interpreted my complete response.  After you said that you would never stay at the hotel again I heard a click.  It was apparent to me the conversation was over and you hung up.    I apologize that we did not meet your expectations.     Best regards,   Tony Kaspar General Manager Dana Point Marina Inn  949-496-1203

Summary Heading: Dana Point is worth a visit it's beautiful!
Summary: A Very nice Marina resort in Dana point. Nice balconies and rooms at this inn.  The location is phenomenal as it resides within a mini restaurant community, the marina and it's just a short walk out to the point. Breakfast included!
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Most Convenient Hotel Stay in Dana Point
Summary: Having been a resident in Dana Point Harbor for over 13 years, when I revisit my prior home, I always stay at the Dana Point Marina Inn, mainly for its prime location right in the Harbor.  It is ideal for excercising, shopping, dining, boat tours and there is no need to even get in your car for anything.  Many, many restaurants within short walking distance from the hotel, El Torito, Harpoon Henry's, Coffee Importers, Chart House, Waterman's (new) Proud Mary's and of course the famous watering hole of Turk's which has the best Fish n' Chips around.  Venturing out shopping is a must.  The hotel is vintage but very neat and clean and the staff is always pleasant.  Breakfast is included in your stay, and is a must if you want to enjoy Dana Point Harbor.  I recommend it highly.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: When we checked in, there were a couple of young males at the reception. Customer service was very mediocre, but that was OK. Then we took the elevator to our room. The room was very small with two beds. The carpet was visibly dirty and stained. The shower still had short hair in it. Not very clean by all standards. Went out for dinner that night and stopped at the reception to ask a question. The gentleman working was watching TV and barely mustered up the energy to look at us and answer a question. He moved his head away from the TV in slow motion just so he didn't miss whatever was on. Best were Ok. The room supplied the basic need of getting some sleep.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: We stayed here, and reviewed it September 2015. Since we had a good experience we decided to stay again when returning for the Toshiba Tall Ship Festival in 2016. Unfortunately we could not get the same room as we had before, but Kayla was very helpful in selecting a room for us. As last year, the room was quite large. Enough room for us to move around and not be bumping into each other. My husband enjoyed having his morning coffee on the balcony.  The beds were comfortable, which is the most important factor. The WiFi worked quite well. Large closet. Hot water, good shower. Clean throughout. I don't walk barefooted on hotel carpeting, but even the carpet appeared to be clean, no dirt on my socks!. The reception desk personnel were very helpful, even recommending a restaurant
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We spent two days at the Inn last week and had an enjoyable stay. We like to stay here because it is within walking distance to the wharf/marina with its shops and varied restaurants. Baby beach is close by as well as the Ocean Institute, and a nice area for walking and biking-they have bikes to rent.  The pool is good sized with a separate spa. Two nice covered cabana areas with sofa's, etc. are inviting. Plenty of lounges and chairs for seating too. They offer a continental breakfast as well with the usual fare. The price is right and yes,  it isn't a high priced fancy hotel.....but it is clean, well kept, and they seem to be continually upgrading. Our bathroom counter/cabinet appeared newer as did our drapes. I must say though that I have never been impressed with their front

The rooms are very small. The day we checked in the hotel was not booked, I asked if there was a bigger room available, he did but he charged me $30+ extra 1 night. My partner followed me with a second car and was asked to park by the bar....elsewhere, when there were spots open in the garage the whole time we were there. The room said, hot breakfast included. Hotel served continental breakfast. Just did not meet the expectations...we were disappointed with the customer service.
Manager Response: Hello Cynthia,   Are you sure you have the right hotel?  We dont have a bar or parking garage.   Best regards,   Tony Kaspar Dana Point Marina Inn General Manager

Summary: The DP Marina Inn is a nice , clean, inexpensive budget hotel with some rooms facing the harbor and boats. When friends come to this area, I ask them what is there budget and what kind of hotel type they need or want.  This hotel is owned by Orange County on County Harbor property. So the rates are set differently than any hotel I have ever stayed at.  Mid week $89+tax is a deal. $120 on weekends is still a steal around here. You can go across the street at the Marriott and pay $350-$400 and be closer to the water than they are.   Lots of families use the pool by the boats in the afternoons. Good base camp for 1 hour drive to San Diego or 30 minutes drive to Disneyland or 1 hour ( no traffic ) to LAX.  But the smart people go to train station ( 5-10 minutes away ) and don't

Summary Heading: Love the old style Southern CALI
Summary: I love it, so close to family and the beach.  Please don't tear it down, Dana point is going to change too much! We need to preserve some of the Old Beach Life!  The Girls at the front desk were so helpful and friendly!!
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: OMG What happened to this hotel?
Summary: After making a multiple night reservation at this hotel, we left the next day. This mainly was due to lack of responsiveness of the hotel staff, specifically Amir (self-proclaimed Supervisor).  Upon check-in, the first room (yes first) was reeking of cigarette smoke. We went back to the front lobby and requested another room, which quickly provided. The next room was more upgraded, with a small (32”) flat panel TV instead of the more typical 25” tube TV that we had in our first room. It even seemed to have upgrade beds, a plus to say the least. The bathroom was dark but functional.  After settling in we decided to get out and enjoy the Jacuzzi (one of the main reasons we stay at this hotel) only to find it roped off with caution tape and orange cones. This is where things went
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary Heading: GREAT LOCATION, SPACIOUS ROOMS WITH MANY AMENITIES
Summary: When rating any accommodation,the rating should be based on value.  I've stayed at the Dana Point Marina Inn many times while attending the Pageant of the Masters in Laguna Beach.  Some hotels in Laguna are more luxurious - but much more than twice the price. Dana Point is only 20 minutes south of Laguna Beach - a short drive to save at least $150 a night.  And I love this hotel.  Sure, its a 40 year old hotel and it shows but the rooms are spacious, clean, and beds comfy with high quality linens.  Some rooms have kitchen facilities.  All have small balconies and from most you can get at least a peek at he harbor.  Its delightful to be able to step out the door and be right in the middle of a large small boat harbor and close to many interesting restaurants, some fine dining,
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We stayed here for two nights over the weekend in order to attend a wedding near by.  I read mixed reviews and to be honest was a bit concerned.  This place could actually be awesome.....with a little extra effort.  Seriously.....the owner/manager should realize that the place has a lot going for it and EXTEND some effort to be great.  Pluses = price was reasonable (less than $150/night); room was clean; continental breakfast included and coffee was good;great location in the harbor; close to restaurants, beach, bay; big pool and free parking.  Negatives= the majority of the staff just didn't seem to pay attention or go even an extra inch, let alone an extra mile.  For instance, no one monitors the pool area AT ALL😕 . Pool furniture was broken, but not removed; there were never

We stayed 2 nights at this property which is located right on the marina with many shops and restaurants nearby. The location is perfect and the price very good. The next highest priced hotel in the marina area was several hundred dollars a night higher. The room was clean and the king bed was comfortable. There is even a small kitchenette in the room. The bathroom was clean but in need of serious updating. The breakfast was just okay with fresh fruit and muffins, cereal, etc. in the pre-packaged variety and not fresh. The staff was friendly and helpful. If your looking for newer and modern, this hotel would not be for you. If you don't mind an older hotel in need of updating but with a great location, this would work. We would stay here again because of price and location.

Summary Heading: Couldn't get much closer to the beach and the harbor.
Summary: Stayed 5 nights and loved the location!  It does need a little updating but for the price it was a bargain.  The continental breakfast wasn't very good and after 1 day we were eating somewhere else.  Wi Fi was iffy unless you went to the lobby.  Everyone friendly and it was adequate but they could spruce up their breakfast.

Needed a place to stay the night, and on ORBITZ the price was incredible. So we booked on line and drove right to the inn. Booking on line was about 50% less than when we walked in cold call and inquired on room availability and rates. The facility is located convenient to the harbor, restaurants,and beach. Parking was free. The room was large, with a balcony that opened to a courtyard below. The area was quiet and we slept with the balcony door opened, enjoying the cool ocean breezes.  The bed was comfortable; the bathroom was very small, but considering  this is an older complex, this was not surprising. The commode and shower/tub were behind their own door; there was a sink, mirror, and a closet area outside the commode room My husband sat on the plastic chair on the balcony,

Summary Heading: Great location- will definitely stay here next time.
Summary: Our son lives in Dana Point and we used to stay at a different hotel. From now on we will stay at the Dana Point Marina Inn. What a great location! We could walk everywhere and its fun to walk past all the boats that are docked in the harbor. The breakfast choices aren't as good as the place we stayed at before but the location makes up for the breakfast. There is no charge to park your car and the pool is bigger than most beach hotels.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Can't complain if I wanted to!
Summary: In the heart of quiet but well appointed (shopping, dining) Dana Point one finds Dana Point Marina Inn. I "could" stay literally across the street for a few more "stars" and in the process triple my cost, but here I'm ON the water, get a free continental breakfast, park a few strides from my room, have free WiFi...oodles of fluffy towels and a comfortable clean bed. Patios for all rooms add to the comfort. We have been coming here for years...can you guess why?

People were very friendly and the amentityes were bearly adaquate. I stayed on the second floor and it was 200 steps one way to the ice machine. There are no free weights or weight machines  in their gym. There is a TV set but it only works with a remote which I could not locate.

This hotel is very dated.  It has an amazing location and walking distance to the beach.  They offer a fair breakfast compared to other hotels.    The room was just fair.  The sink was all chipped and scratched up.  They only gave 2 towels and the bed was very uncomfortable and bouncy.  The room had a fabulous patio with chairs and that was great.   Overall it was a great location next to an event that we were going to, but if I didn't have that event planned in advance, I wouldn't stay at that hotel again.

Have been coming to Marina Inn for last 7 years for convenience and price for the Doheny Blues festival. It is in a great location near restaurants and the beach and harbor. The rooms are clean not fantastic but comfortable. It is not bad for price and location.

The highlight for me was the bar tender at the pool! Paul was amazing and provided high level of personal service. My kids love that the pool was right in our back yard and they played a movie ever night at the pool! My wife also enjoyed the spa:)- Tommy
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Nice beds, secure parking and close restaurants. Wish I had view room but quality a+  Staff friendly and breakfast above average.  Wide hallways. Quality froyers on every floor. Clean rooms and nice large Flat-screen televisions.   I stayed only two days mid-week but enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere...   Cannot think of a downside except that I did not try room service.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We're locals from San Clemente and stayed here for two nights midweek while our house was being fumigated for termites.  We have a 3 year old son, so paid the extra money for a Marina view room, which kept him partially occupied out on the balcony looking at all the boats.    The hotel is in a great location with many things to do within walking distance around the marina (Marine Institute, beach, shops, etc) and would be a great starting point for a trip to Catalina Island as the ferry dock is close by.  There are also many choices for restaurants within easy walking distance from pizza to high-end seafood.  Although the hotel is 30 to 40 years old our room was updated, clean and well maintained.   We did notice some wood rot on the exterior balcony railing and siding which is
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Stayed here for 4 days and it was a nice experience. The room was clean, the service was good and it was at oceanfront. There was no outside noise, and we all enjoyed our stay. However there was a couple of drawbacks. Parking was a bit of a problem because there wasn't a lot of it near the main entrance. The other point I wasn't too keen on was the free continental breakfast. It was set up in a room that used to be a rented room. It's very small and the choices of food are minimal. There is nothing hot.

We were told that the property had not been updated for 30 years at the front desk when we complained about the calcified bathtub.    • worthless WIFI • vintage and LOUD A/C unit • bathroom door would not close • everything was very well worn • Rude front desk staff member  We could never recommend that anyone stay here.  Rude and unprofessional staff member(Younger female who was training others).
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: I had a wedding at the Marriott which was sold out. Walk was less than 2 blocks and this hotel is right on the Marina.  Room was very clean and very quiet and 1/3rd of the price. Staff check in was efficient and quick.  Very impressed overall and this is one of the best bargains around.  Will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: The hotel has nice ambiance and a good location for exploring the surrounding area.  It leaves signs in the room to conserve water because it is "...our most precious, limited resource." Guests are encouraged to shut off the faucet when brushing their teeth.  This rings hollow, however, when one uses the showers.  It is only possible to control the temperature and not the volume of the stream.  A dramatic decrease in water use could be easily realized if flow restrictors were placed in the shower heads.   I was also amazed that there was no evidence of the use of compact fluorescent lights anywhere throughout the facility.  So much for conserving energy.   The  spastic Wi-Fi connections were well below average, with guests having to go to the lobby to use their tablets and smart

Hotel was clean.  Check in staff was so friendly and welcoming.  Gave us great advice on local restaurants.  The walls of this hotel are a little thin so you can hear your neighbors sneeze but that's really the only drawback.  The location is fabulous as you can walk around the marina and there are great restaurants and coffee shops close by.  You are minutes away from wonderful beaches.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: A five star hotel it is not but a clean and resonable hotel with a perfect location IT IS.
Summary: We have been staying here for the past 6 Super Bowl weekends.  The people are frendly and helpful.  The rooms are very clean, a little dated with older TVs, the room rate for a beach area and location is walking distance to most everything is very resonable around a hundred bucks.    It includes a continental breakfast in a clean dinning room and great choice of breakfast items.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Good value hotel in a great location
Summary: I stayed at the Dana Point Marina Inn nine nights while on business. The hotel is old and worn but my room was clean and the bed was comfortable. It is located adjacent to the marina and you will find several very good restaurants a few minutes walk from the hotel. The room rate includes free parking, Internet and breakfast. The front desk staff were kind and responsive. The only issues I had were the very slow internet and noisy AC unit. I would probably stay here again.

Picked this because I stayed there few years ago and was satisfied.  Well this trip I stayed 5 nights and except for weak wifi signal in rooms, was told by front desk, due to location of hotel between water and a hill not much to complain about.  For the price and location can't be beat.  Room was very clean, staff friendly, what else could you ask.

How often do you find a marina/ ocean oriented hotel in California for under $100/n? You don't. Yeah the DP Marina Inn is a little tired, but it terrific for an overnight associated with a coastal or Catalina cruise. Have used it for years. Keeper

We go to this hotel (this was not the first time) because of its proximity to the Ocean Institute and reasonable price. Unfortunately the rooms seem to get more and more run down. Leaking faucet. Only one pillow per person and no spare pillows or blankets. The heater was noisy. Staff was friendly. We may need to consider a slightly less convenient location in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for your insight as to the property. Information will be passed on to the proper department.

Summary: We have worked for over 2 years with the Marina Inn. We bring guests from all over the world to Dana Point. The Marina Inn is, in many ways, perfect. Its unique location and neighborhood is just wonderful. You have a lovely area with great restaurants, shops and a nice beach within walking distance.   The rooms are big and always clean. The beds are comfortable and the breakfast is just right. We are yet to have a guest complain. We have looked at many hotels in the area and the price you get for that standard is more than fair.  The people who run the Hotel are more than accommodating. They are helpful, understanding, and very flexible if needed.  We personally, can only recommend the Marina Inn. We are happy because we always know our guests will love what they offer.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Great price and on the water
Summary: We are staying here while are home is being fixed and it's really nice. The hotel is pretty old and a little dated but for less than a hundred a night and on the water it's a great deal ,throw in a good free breakfast, decent internet and the fact it's 5 minutes walk to half a dozen restaurants and I think this place is jem of a hotel . Now remember I didn't say this is a 5 star resort and im sure some folks will say it's kinda dumpy but for the price and location I don't think you can do better

I would love to start my Travel Advisor with a great experience.  I had to planned a Wedding from Chicago and Reunion for our families near and far.  I was so concerned with my group and how they would like the hotel and restaurants along with the wedding on the beach.  With the help of the sales manager, staff and family in California, all went off without an issue.  The value and location of this property along with the group of rooms we had and the ease of checking in and friendly staff made my life and our families reunion with a wedding go wonderfully.  I realized the hotel was in the harbor but I did not realize how convenient and easy it was to walk and enjoy coffee, restaurants, nightlife and beautiful holiday lights.  Some guests of the wedding made their own plans but

I booked a block of rooms here for another place for my wedding guests to stay. Almost two weeks after my block was to have been released they called and said no-one booked there and they were going to charge me. At that point I couldn't have switched myself and all my guests. I did put some people there that hadn't booked yet including paying for one of them myself. When I walked into the lobby to pay for the room they had no clue how to transact the prepayment and the lobby was just dingy and very shabby. I did end up getting charged an additional amount for not meeting the "minimum". When I told the hotel management that I was unhappy with this outcome as I did put some people there including personally paying for one of them their response was very derogatory and said they
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: We started out in room 113 near the lobby. It was dirty and downright disgusting, not to mention dreary and dusty. The tub and sink were a disgrace. I sat on one of the 2 beds to call the desk to get a clean room . Daniel spoke with me. I happened to look down at the box spring had dust with wiskers on it all along the headboard wall.  Daniel was not very helpful and was downright rude. He asked if I would like to change to another room with broken TV , in the same condition. He told me every room in the hotel had never been renovated and all looked the way 113 did. . He kept insisting there were no better rooms and there was nothing he could do, I was on tour, with 40 other Bible Group folks and so I was stuck there, I had also been there a few years ago and had a lovely room.

The Dana Point is a little dated, but very comfortable and pleasant. Nice staff. Service is standard and basic, but the staff was responsive and helpful. The location is terrific and the area is beautiful with nice restaurants, beautiful harbor view and off the highway location. It's got alot of activities, nice walking area, beautiful harbor and beach. Very fun and pleasant. The room was nice, bed was comfy, bathroom clean. The kitchen area was old, but very functional and just fine.

Good location, clean rooms, nice staff, but the wifi is brutal especially if you're on a business trip. Also, make sure to check in later so you can for a room without sharing a wall with noisy neighbors. I can hear every word the family next door said. So don't expect to be well rested for a full day's of work.

Summary Heading: Great as stop-over for Catalina weekend
Summary: PROS: Convenient access to harbor and stop over spot to Catalina; rooms were clean, everything functional; staff was friendly; continental breakfast was nice - had several items in "take away" packaging (including coffee cups) which was nice if you have to get out quickly.  CONS: parking was painful, required pick up of placard when we arrived late at night which we only knew b/c friends had informed us; we could not even pay them to leave overnight when taking side trip to Catalina - had to drive to another confusing parking place - suspect this is Dana Point rules on the businesses to get more $ out of tourists so probably not fault of hotel.  I would return, there was nothing wrong with hotel, just nothing notably great or interesting.

Our room was spotless and extremely comfortable to sleep in.  The beds were very comfortable and even though our room was right across from the elevator, we never even heard noise from there.  There was a good variety at breakfast even though everything was prepackaged.  Seems to me that the hotel could maybe provide some fresh bread instead of only prepackaged bagels and muffins.  Would be a bit more appealing to eat and probably even save them money but in any case, we were relatively happy having breakfast there 6 mornings in a row.  Definitely couldn't complain with all that was included for an incredibly inexpensive rate.  The seemingly unlimited supply of Andes mints was a nice touch too.  We really liked the location and were very happy with the hotel.  Wouldn't hesitate
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: I agree with the other postings..This is my favorite quick get away..It is a short drive for me and once there..I am soooo relaxed..The staff has always been wonderful and helpful..The breakfast staff helping with the FREE BREAKFAST are sweet,kind and so helpful and good food choices.The location is perfect!!!.You can walk around the harbor,walk to shops and restaurants and don't even need to take your car..There is so much right there on the harbor within walking distance,,Many happy hours with discounted food and beverages and NO DRINKING AND DRIVING NECESSARY!!!..Water sports,paddle boards to rent,a sandy beach nearby,bike rentals,whale watching and fishing boats all within walking distance..The rooms are nice and I always get one with a pool and marina view..It's
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: This hotel is one of my favorite places in the whole world. Every single year my family and I takes a trip to Dana Point to enjoy the marina! This hotel always is clean and the staff is always phenomenal. Every year I look forward to going back to Dana Point, because I know it'll be another great experience
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Right on the marina, where boats and some yachts dock, this is a excellent spot for a get-away near many beaches. There is a small coved beach within walking distance (Baby beach) and many places to take nice walks. Near many restaurants (some walking and short drive) and some souvenir shopping available. Although still needing some updating in the hallways and bathrooms, for the price, it suits it's purpose. Hotel staff were extremely helpful and courteous for our conference/retreat stay. Very pleased with the comfort of the beds, decor and room amenities (coffee maker, fridge, wifi). The key cards and door locks are a bit difficult to use. Noticed many other guests having to try 5+ times to get their door unlocked for entry. The bathroom shower was chipped and needed an update

Summary Heading: Can't beat the location and price!
Summary: This place is older and was formerly a nightmare.  New management has done a nice remodel with what they have and the staff is pleasant and helpful. Pool and hot tub area are very nice and updated.  You are right at the marina w shops and restaurants and a great path to walk many miles on.

Summary Heading: Accident with luggage carrier after no offer of help from management to transport luggage
Summary: Last weekend I attended a state convention for the California Questers, a group with mainly older women members. None of us were offered any help with our luggage. My friend/roommate has a lot of trouble walking, and since our room turned out to be as far from the reception area as you could be, I asked for a luggage carrier. The one I was given was very wobbly and difficult to maneuver, but I figured once I got my luggage on there, it would stabilize. Another friend offered to push it from the back while I led it from the front. However we went down a small incline at the middle entry and the carrier rolled over, knocked me down and hit me in the head. Two employees, who were nearby, did come to my rescue, pick me up and load up the cart and then took our luggage to our room.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary Heading: So relaxing every time we stay.
Summary: Friendly, helpful, nice staff always personable & wanting to make your stay the best . Relaxing, with every stay. Rooms are clean, large & the view is awesome of the marina. You have so many choice of good restaurants as well as stores to browse & walk on the marina - lots to do.  Tony, Gen.Mgr, your staff is excellent.  It was a pleasure to visit again - Thank you.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: On the water can beat the price
Summary: Clean but old Hotel. Rooms need updating. Great location best in Dana Point.  Close to all shops and restaurants. Walk to beach, great views, great restaurants. View of the marina and the ocean. Staff is very nice and helpful. I would recommend If you not planning on lounging around in your room.

From Arizona we used to live in this area.  We stayed 3 nights and we very pleased with the room and value for the price especially because of the location.  We had a Harbor view.  Plenty of parking and the beds were comfortable and linens and pillows very satisfactory which is very important to us. Close walking distance to many nice places to eat and shopping.  We would stay again for sure!

Summary Heading: Our 12 night stay Mid to End August 2015 Dana Point Marina Inn
Summary: While this property deserves a 3* rating due to some short-comings, the location is absolutely superb. It is the only property in the midst of Dana Point harbor, a yacht "garage" for some 2500 boats, sailing, kayaking, stand-up paddling and swimming. My husband and I booked the "De Luxe King Room with Balcony and Harbor View" which has a marvelous view of the harbor, just a 100 ft away. Our room was completely remodeled with taste and contemporary furniture. The only complaint we have about the room is that is was under-furnished. Actually, it looked as though the hotel stopped voluntarily or involuntarily to provide a table and chairs, a side table for the couch, to place a glass of wine or a coffee, or a $ 5 small plastic table, matching the low quality plastic chairs on the

Summary Heading: Oh, My! don't stay in room 112!
Summary: What an absolute mess!! We've stayed here numerous times. The location is idea and usually any problems encountered were manageable, but this time...! First, they said I didn't get the better rate because I made the reservation on line, which was not true. Next, the refrigerator did not work (it took two calls and two workers to get it fixed, and  the room was smelly, dank, and creepy. We left a note the next day asking them to air the room out, change all bedding, leave two bath mats because they were so small, and if possible, flip the mattress. We also stated that there was mold in the bathroom. The room did smell better that night,and on that day only they left two bath mats,  but nothing else was done. As much as possible, we left the sliding door open but not only was it
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary Heading: Sorry it was only two nights
Summary: We were participants at the Toshiba Tall Ships Festival. Dana Point Marina Inn provided a wonderful place to rest and refresh after a long day of ship tours and sails. First, I had sent an email to Tony the General Manager, asking if it would be possible to get into our room early, if it was convenient for the housekeeping staff. When we arrived Nico, at the front desk greeted us and asked us our preferred location. I left it up to him and he gave us such a convenient room. The room was quite large and had a patio facing the "Village". Everything was clean and in place, and comfortable. The beds were pretty good, hot water, plenty of towels. Even chocolates on the bedside table. At one point I incurred an injury requiring a bandage and the lady at the front desk was very kind to

I stayed there one night and took the Catalina Island Express to Catalina the next day. A great place to stay, reasonable priced, great location on the marina and plenty of restaurants to chose from. Just a short walk to the Catalina Island Express office so you don't have far to go to check in.

Based on the nightly rates, we were hoping to be satisfied with the accommodations; instead, we were more than pleased.  The room was spacious and clean, with many amenities of higher-priced places.  The continental breakfast was adequate -- nothing fancy, but a good variety of breakfast food.  The only negative was another hotel guest talking on a balcony at 11:45 p.m. until I called the front desk and asked that they shut them up. All was quiet again in about five minutes.  We would recommend the hotel.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We were in town for a wedding last Sunday and this place was perfect.  It wasn't expensive and not too fancy, but that didn't matter.  It was comfortable and close to all of the awesome breakfast places in the marina.

Summary Heading: Location, Location, Location. THE DANA POINT MARINA INN letter to the Director
Summary: Mr Anthony Kaspar, Thank you for the pleasant friendly service you and your staff provided for my stay at the Dana Point Marina Inn, A diamond in the rough, what a great location, sailboats, the Pacific Ocean, what  a gem of a property and asset to Dana Point Harbor.  The Dana Point Marina Inn is a trendy spot for travelers, families with children and boating enthusiast that's why its booked solid every weekend.  Mr. Kaspar, what a pleasant hotel environment, friendly service and amenities the Dana point Marina associates provide excellent customer service and high quality housekeeping staff.  Suggest that you contact Kenzie Martinez at Dream Catcher Yachts regarding the hotels internet service Dream Catcher Yachts has an excellent WI FI system in place, I was ale to connect to

Stayed here for  6 days and nights and had a great experience.  Rooms are dated but comfortable and great food and shopping are just steps away.  Front desk very helpful. I'll come again for sure this was a great family vacation combined with a family wedding in nearby San Clemente.  A/C is outdated and noisy was only complaint

Summary Heading: Dated but great for the price
Summary: Spent two nights at the Dana Point Marina Inn and although our first impression of the seansoned hotel was somewhat aprehensive, it turned out to be a great stay. You can't beat the location in Dana Point and it is very close to Laguna Beach and San Juan Capistrano.  The room was clean though as I mentioned old. Plenty of hot water and comfortable. Breakfast (continental) included was nothing special. Great pool and spa.

I recently stayed at this hotel at the recommendation of a conference I was attending. I was not expecting much at all from the reviews but it was even worse than I expected. The entire room made you feel like you needed a shower yet when you went into the bathroom it was even worse! The tub and sink were stained and peeling, the outlets didn't work, and the whole place smelled of must and mildew. The through the wall air conditioner sounded like a plane taking off every time it kicked into full gear and made it very difficult to sleep. Overall I would recommend steering clear of this place!
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: We were in a harbor front third story room. Clean , quite and very relaxing. Good view of the boats in their docks. Had the breakfast the next morning. Coffee good , not hot food except for bagels or toast but still ok. A short stroll to all the little shops and eateries.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: If I could give this place a zero I would. I went to a conference and this is the "hotel" that was recommended due to us receiving a better rate. Thankfully I'm being reimbursed for my trip through work otherwise I probably would have been even more irritated. We had to request new rooms NOT just once, but twice. By the time we got into our THIRD room that was considered "livable" it was going on midnight. Our first room smelled like musty mildew (imagine wet towels forgotten in the washing machine for a week). The 2nd room was worse! It smelled like sewage. We tried running tbe garbage disposal thinking it was coming from that (it had a little kitchenette) and it made the smell worse...actually made us gag!! We had to switch again and the 3rd room didn't have a smell
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: This hotel needs help! The location is good, but the rooms need to updated. Old bedding, old fixtures, old carpet, old...old....old! Kind of makes you feel yucky! Sliding door screen didn't fully close or lock. No sound barriers so you can hear neighbors and people in hallway. There is a breakfast in a tiny room with mostly processed, packaged foods. Coffee is bad! Suggest you only stay here if you prefer low cost knowing you'll get poor quality.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary Heading: Great hotel and location for the price!
Summary: We always check the low ratings before we book. So to negate a few of those comments... yes we had air conditioning (GREAT AC which would negate any musty smell which is understandable this close to the ocean but we didn't experience that at all) No, the room was not in DIRE need of repair (garden view room) maybe other rooms need to be updated, ours was quite nice. Breakfast was decent, nothing cooked but toasted bagels/cream cheese and the usual packaged danish / muffins, cereal, fruit bowl, juice, coffee etc lite fare. (7/15)  Our room was extremely spacious, nothing at all to complain about, comfy beds, great fridge in room too. Hotel staff was really nice. Plenty of outside parking, nothing covered if you need that. For us, room rate vs quality = 10. We're working so we're

Not a pleasant stay. Paid way too much a night for this hotel.  Extremely nauseated from the smell of the air conditioning. Sliding door does not lock. Low Security around the building and strong smell of smoke in a non smoking room.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: The room and hotel are nice enough.  But I wont go back. We come down to checkout and clerk says 'gee were you expecting a taxi?' Answer yes.  'Well he was here a while ago, came in and looked around - maybe he's still here'.  At these rates, in a boutique hotel I would expect the desk to ask who he was looking for then call the party!  Not impressed.

Summary Heading: Great Value in a Great Location
Summary: We had to be in  Laguna Niguel for a function, and decided to stay over night near by in Dana Point. We booked this hotel, expecting a mediocre motel, based on the great price they offered. Wow! What a pleasant surprise! The hotel is a bit dated, but the room was very clean, with some upgrades, and the staff was terrific and friendly. We got there a bit early, and the room was not ready, so they let us keep our luggage in the manager's office. The location is SUPERB, as it is located right in the harbor, with easy access to numerous restaurants, bars and shops. You just can't go wrong, as everything is in walking distance with many options for food and drinks.  Its' a perfect location, and a very comfortable large room with a nice flat screen TV and frig. We will be back, if we
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Recently, we had the opportunity to stay at the Dana Point Marina Inn and were pleasantly surprised!  The location is excellent, on the marina and convenient to Doheny Beach, the Harbor and all of the shops and restaurants.  The hotel is clean and well represented and it is an outstanding value for the price paid.  The rooms are clean with all of the amenities needed. I would highly suggest this hotel if you are looking for a good location.  There is no restaurant or bar on property, but that really is not required as there are so many within walking distance.  A great stay for the price paid!  This hotel provides all of the basic amenities required and also offers a nice pool area for a limited service hotel.. Well worth a visit!
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Dana Point Marina Inn surpassed all my expectations
Summary: I was so pleased with the Dana Point Marina Inn.  Our third floor room  was clean and looked freshly painted with a balcony and many other conveniences and a free continental breakfast,   The area is just filled with lovely little shops and restaurants, many right on the sea where you could sit outside by the ocean and all just steps away from the Inn.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: I had a nice stay here with my husband for our 12th anniversary. We also stayed here during our honeymoon. While the building is a bit dated, the staff is excellent. We loved the hot tub, but didn't swim in the pool, as it was getting time for them to close. Walking around the harbor area is nice, and there are quite a few good places to eat. We did have a small housekeeping issue that was addressed as soon as I brought it to their attention, which was appreciated. Parking is close and free. Most rooms looked like they had patios, air conditioning as well. There was a fridge, but no microwave. I would definitely go back again when visiting. The continental breakfast looked ok, but we chose to eat bagels and coffee at a place nearby.

Summary Heading: Stay at Dana Pt. Marina Inn @ $99
Summary: Nice older, refurbished motel overlooking harbor/marina with clean room, comfy king bed, great bath, third floor room (motel elevator) has balcony with lovely view of marina. Paved walking paths everywhere, heated pool and jacuzzi.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We had a great stay. This is are annual family Memorial day weekend getaway. We picnic all day at beach and return to hotel at night.  The rates are pretty reasonable. The front desk was very nice specially (Dano). My room was not ready at the time I was trying to check in so Dano said we will give you a up grade if you come back later. Boy was I a Happy camper when I seen my room.

the hotel room was beautiful and the view of the harbor was amazing. the rooms are very quiet. parking is very convenient, there are no long walks to your room and there is 24 hour security. I felt safe and didn't worry about the car getting broken into
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Good location if your there for boating.
Summary: Nice location but hotel is in definite need of a facelift.  Rooms are decent size but very worn and dreary and bathrooms very small.  Free breakfast of coffee, packaged sweet rolls, dry cereal and over ripe banana's.

To begin, I was pleasantly surprised to find a vacancy for my last minute decision to get away on Memorial Day Weekend. I was further surprised to obtain such a reasonable rate! The room met my basic needs, although I had to remind the folks at check-in that I had reserved a room with a microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator -- the first room they gave me only had the refrig. I requested 1st floor and got it. I absolutely love walking about in beach areas and DPMI was right on the harbor, so I was content. It also is very close to Doheny State Beach, so I walked over there, as well. There were shops nearby and many dining establishments within walking distance. The complimentary continental breakfast had many choices, although they ran out of bananas fairly early. I enjoyed

Summary Heading: Harbor close hotel but could use some updating
Summary: This is our first stay at the Dana Point Marina Inn and all in all it met our needs. I should point out that this is an “older” motel with three floors and it’s starting to show its age. It seems that some rooms have been updated while ours was stuck it the 1980s (the 25” Tube TV gave it away).  We were placed on the 3rd floor (at our request) with a peek-a-boo view of Dana Point Harbor.  Beds were firm and the linins were sparse (I suggest you bring your own pillows).  Wi-Fi is advertised as free on their website but was non-existent on the 3rd floor on the far north end of the hotel, so much so I resorted to using my iPhone hotspot. Parking too is free along with a continental breakfast which worked out fine. Parking is plentiful although minimally secured, not that’s it’s a

Since late March and most of April of this year, my wife and I stayed at the Marina Inn almost every weekend. We have been guests there for over 14 years.  We had relatives that had rented a 1 bedroom apartment there for 30 days and we visited them. As usual the rooms we has were spotless and in very good condition. We did have one incident that marred or last stay. My wife left a couple of items in the bathroom of our room ( Nbr 227). We realized our mistake on our drive home and called the desk. They checked with the cleaning lady and she stated there was nothing there, also my wife's sister checked with the desk with the same results. Our property was not found. Other than that our visit was great. The pool and hot tub are clean and the area surrounding the pool is very
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We were pleased with our clean, secure, and convenient location of DPMI. We noticed a plumbing problem upon checking in our room and the manager personally exchanged our room promptly. The pool and hot tub were clean. The breakfast room was well stocked. Will return here.

Summary Heading: Great location but hotel is down at the heels
Summary: We travel through Dana Point occasionally, but I think we need to stop staying at Dana Point Marina Inn.  It's located right down in the marina, which is great for early AM walks and watching the boat traffic and SUPs and kayakers.  But the rooms are really showing their age.  We arrived without a reservation and the unenthusiastic desk clerk sent us to a dark, grubby room with a kitchenette along one side of the room that was floored with sticky linoleum.  The TV didn't work, so he moved us to a slightly better room in working order and without noticeable film of dirt on the floor.  I know the price (under $100) is very good, so I don't want to be too hard on them.  The place requires a lot of upkeep, and the pool area is clean and sunny.  But it feels like the owners don't

Summary Heading: Keys Rarely Worked, Thin Walls, Rude Staff and a Room That Smelled Like Pot
Summary: About the best thing I can say about this hotel is that the price is a great value for the area it is located.  I’m by no means expecting perfection but when one encounters the same issue over and over at a hotel, well you have to wonder.  Several family members recently stayed at this hotel and repeatedly room keys quit working.  I’m not talking once or twice over a five day stay but rather four or five times in the same day.  The hotel staff was incredibly rude when we asked to have keys replaced, often blaming us.  The walls and doors in this hotel are very thin.  Even at normal conversation levels I could hear the conversations of the guests on either side of me.  One evening returning from travels of the day, I returned to the room of a family member to have it smell like
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: Considering the area, The Dana Point Marina Inn was a bargain, had great amenities and a fantastic location. Located on the marina, the inn was within walking distance of 2 great restaurants that we tried as well as the best smoothie and bagel shop I have ever been to! We stayed here to have privacy while visiting some family who lived in the area. We rented a car to explore the area, which was also within walking distance from the inn. Overall we had a fantastic time in the area and the inn definitely contributed to it. It was January and the inn had a heated pool and hot tub which we had to ourselves!

Prior to making a reservation I specifically asked the front desk if the wifi worked well. I said I HAD to get work done and could not take a slow connection.  The individual I spoke with said the connection was fast and nobody ever complained. In reality it runs at dial up speeds, so slooooww. beyond that its noisy at night from the marina. not quaint.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: We arrived, the outside of the hotel and lobby looked great, we had high hopes. Its next to the marina, great view from the patio in our room, next to the marina restaurants and shopping, and the price was great too. BUT, when we got to our room, and it was ten steps back. The bed was hard, squeaky, and old. The curtains were old and dusty, the bedding looked old and couldnt keep us warm enough. And to top it all off, I arrived feeling well, I left with the worst allergies I have had in a long time. I would like to say that we will be back, but unless the rooms are upgraded, I doubt it.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: This is the third year we have stayed at the Dana Point Marine Inn and we plan to return next year.  Our room and bathroom were very clean and the bed comfortable.  The continental breakfast was quite substantial with plenty of choices.   The ambiance was very welcoming and the staff helpful.   Good value for money.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near the Harbor
Summary: My husband I stayed here on a last minute trip to Dana Point in August. Its definitely an older and more run down location than we are used to, but it was still good. The property itself was a little old, the decor in the room was definitely outdated and could have used some replacements, but for being right on the harbor it was perfect for us. We were able to walk to the harbor, the shops and the nearby beach. Great location if you ask me.   The complimentary breakfast was really crowded the one morning we went, but the food was what you would expect, and it was all fresh.

This is not a Doubletree or Marriott.  So if you are looking for that experience, this is not the hotel for you.  Its more like a really decent Best Western. I was pleasantly surprised how much I liked our 2 night stay.  Being from that area, I know something about the hotels in the area.  Basically, very very expensive to stay in Dana Point/Laguna Niguel - even during off season.   The room was reasonably priced, very clean and not badly decorated.  The staff was friendly, professional and accommodating.  The pool is heated year round and there is also a jacuzzi, which my sore back (from driving) utilized to the fullest both nights. I actually liked the casualness of the place. Felt comfortable walking to my room with a hoodie and towel wrapped around me after the jacuzzi.

First this place needs a serious update.  They have not done any improvements to this place in probably 20 years.   The water from the sink smelled of sulfur.  The front desk wouldn't answer their phone.  And the heater unit was a 20 year old wall unit that was so loud it was hard to sleep.  Will never go back.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: This motel has an exceptional location for anyone who trives on marinas and seashore areas with decent restaurants and services such as whalewatching and dolphin tours or, in this specific location, to catch a ferry to Catalina Island. There is ample parking but you will need a sticker to put on your dash so your car is identified as motel guest vehicle.  The Motel per se is average and the bathrooms, while always clean, are a bit outdated and in need of reinvestment. The rooms are fine and well maintained. Make sure you are not charged the posted daily rate, they can do better which is a little less, How much, I wont tell you. It's for you to find.

Summary Heading: Well it was a bed and room
Summary: Came down to see my mom. This hotel was a place she picked. It's right next to a lot of restaurants on the water. But it's just an old hotel nothing really great about it. But it was clean and close to food and shops. I didn't feel very safe in my first room on the first floor the door to the balcony wouldn't lock very well so they moved me. The price of the room was like a 3 star hotel this is a 1 or 2 star hotel. But I was glad to see my mom. So it's all good :)
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary Heading: Good value, clean and right down at the Harbor
Summary: We returned for 2 nights this November after spending a lot of time here in the late 1990s commissioning our boat.  It's still a 1970s-style motel but it is clean and affordable, in an excellent location for walking around the harbor for exercise and dining/shopping.  The front-desk folks were friendly.  Our room was functional, 100% quiet.  It faced the pool on ground floor so we had a little outdoor patio where we enjoyed a glass of wine in the evening.  And at least it's not a bland hotel chain!

This is a really great hotel. My wife and I have always stayed at the Doheny  Doubletree, but this is a much better find. The location is amazing. Right on the water front with so many restaurants and shops within walking distance. We had a Marina View room which was very spacious and clean. It did look like it had been remodeled fairly recently.  Our stay was very comfortable and quiet. This will be our new place to stay at Dana Point!

The walls were paper thin (kids on both sides).Third floor above the lobby and the parking lot and busy street .Smoker on the balcony down below singing lewd songs.Very strange stains on the ceiling.No armchairs,only a wooden desk chair. The bathroom was disgusting~~black around the drain .Shower head hanging out of the wall.I cannot even discuss the toilet and the filthy floor!. My frugal husband chose the price and as we all know  "you get what you pay for" But,the towels were fluffy.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: We stayed in one of the newer rooms overlooking the water. The room was the biggest we had stayed in on the trip so far , the views were great.  breakfast was nice from the restaurant on the same property and a reasonable price, although the pancakes had the taste of cardboard, very plain. Rooms were cleans , pools were nice and the movies at one pool on the weekend was great for the kids. We will stay again in the new area.

When I originally called to book a room, I was told that the weekend I was looking to book had a minimum for 2 nights. When I explained to them that other family members had booked for 1 night with a pool view for $89.00 ( I guess the different views have different prices)/ When we checked into out room, we had a small kitchen with tons of gnats. When I called the front desk to complain they basically told me that's what we got for checking into our room early. A few hours later I asked then if they could switch me rooms and they were able to accommodate and the room looked nicer and no gnats. When we checked out I told the employee about the poor customer service and they gave us a discount. This hotel is a great location next to the harbor but the hotel itself could use some
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: Although we've visited Dana Point many times, this is our first time to stay in the town. This was the perfect hotel for it. The location can't be better - right on the marina. From our balcony, we could see the sea even though we got quite a cheap room rate. Room was clean and there were plenty of facilities (vending, parking, pool, etc).

The location is perfect, as you are within walking distance to much of Dana Points attractions. They also rent out bicycles for $5/hour to ride around town. However, the accommodations are mediocre at best. The hotel seems old and pretty run down. Our bathroom toilet did not work, you had to lift the lid and manually add water a few times. The sink and bathtub drains are clogged and do not drain well. They could use some renovations! If you have kids or are a light sleeper be weary as the walls are VERY thin, I could hear everything from the room next door and the people on their balcony below. Staff was friendly,

We just stayed for 4 days at our favorite place in Dana Point. The location is perfect. It is so convenient and comfortable along with a nice view of the harbor.  There are a number of restaurants within walking distance and some fun shopping. They have done some nice updating of the rooms and they are always clean and a nice large size.  The front desk was most helpful and the staff friendly. We try to come here at least once a year and are always happy with our experience. One should know that the port keeps talking about redoing the whole marina so it is hard for business to justify updating.  This property has chosen to do some limited updating without going bankrupt and we appreciate that very much.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: ...and I'm being generous with the "Average" rating.  The reason for my generosity is the inexpensiveness of the room -- $179 a night for a Harbor View room.    THE GOOD:  The location and the view.  If you love Dana Point, this location won't be beat.  THE BAD:  The Bad began at the Front Desk -- someone needs to remind the Front Desk attendees that they are the face and the voice for the hotel.  We were there for a funeral at sea and let's just say that the Front Desk didn't treat some in our party with very much kindness.  There was a very obvious attitude of uncaring as it pertained to any questions some in our party had.  I didn't share the experience, but I didn't deal with the Front Desk at all.  If it were 20 years ago I would say that the hotel needs a facelift.

Just returned from a wonderful weekend at the Dana Point Marina Inn.   The hotel is clean and well maintained,   The staff are pleasant and welcoming.  We stayed in the honeymoon suite and it was lovely.  Very comfortable and spacious with a nice jacuzzi tub and four poster bed.  We enjoyed walking to the harbor, sailing on the wine cruise and a great meal at the Harbor Grill.  Wonderful weekend and we will be back.

This hotel is in a fantastic location. I first stayed there about 2 years ago and returned on august 1st 2014. The decor, fixtures, bed linens, carpet etc, appeared to be the same as 25 years ago, now well used, worn and decrepit. the continental breakfast was almost plastic. The price was the most expensive we stayed at during our drive up the west coast to Vancouver, at $230 per night.. The shower was grungy, taps broken, tub with black ring around the plug hole. Do not stay there it will ruin your day and possible your vacation. Whoever owns this hotel should be ashamed to call him/herself an hotelier.
