Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: Noisy but clean hotel with just okay hotel rooms.  Breakfast is included (surprise!), and was adequate.  Wi-Fi is free.  Would someone explain to me why inexpensive hotels don't usually charge for Wi-Fi but expensive ones charge for it or included it in a "resort" charge? Grrrrrrr

This is really overpriced for what I got.  It was 140 a night for a room by the noisy ice machine and elevator facing the parking lot.  The air conditioner is placed in such a way that the air blows right on your head when in bed.  The paint is chipped and the Formica on the furniture is also chipped.  There was no shelf in the bathroom to put my makeup on when using the sink.  I would not recommend this hotel and will not stay there again.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary Heading: Fabulous location; great hotel for the price
Summary: This hotel is in Dana Point Harbor and backs up to the marina. The rooms are on the small side but are clean and comfortable. There is a refrigerator in the room and ice/vending machines are available. No restaurant but they do serve a continental breakfast every morning. The shopping and dining area of the marina is right next door to the hotel so you have plenty of options for food. The pool area is adjacent to the marina walkway so you see all the boats while you're swimming. Free parking and free WiFi. I found the staff to be friendly and attentive. The "clean filter" light on our AC unit was on. I told the desk and someone came to change the filter within 10 minutes. If you're expecting a 4 or 5 star resort you'll be disappointed. The hotel is older and basic. But, I saw an

Well, I wasn't quite sure what to expect from the mixed reviews I had read, so I gave it a whirl for myself.  I had to travel alone this trip, as my hubby got called away for business, so I was going to be even more sensitive to the accommodations. I was very satisfied with my decision.  It's a great little hotel very conveniently located to shops, dining, killer stair workout, marina, and of course, my fav the beach. I walked each morning down to Doheny to check the surf and start the day.  There's a great coffee and bagel shop to stop at, and everything is within walking distance.  I had dinner with friends at Mahe, and had awesome sushi.  I felt very safe, and the staff was very friendly, and helpful.  I would definitely recommend this little gem.

Summary Heading: ONE ITEM I FORGOT TO MENTION :-)
Summary: I wrote a review about this charming Hotel and I had to drive an hour to see this Hotel for my self. Why you ask? Because the reviews were horrible & I wanted to view this Hotel first hand!!   Many Reviews comment. " This Hotel is Old" WELL Have you ever lived on the OCEAN? ( SALTY Ocean Water ) I have lived on the Ocean and the Salt from the Ocean makes things weather! The ocean is not exterior friendly!!! It takes year around maintenance to keep it looking NEW!!!!   This Hotel staff does the very best they can! The inside , pool area is NOT OLD LOOKING! Great GEM! Clean, great staff, great quite lobby & rooms! Perfect location and we plan on staying at this wonderful Hotel! Travis, Once Again! Thank you for showing  my husband AndI your charming Hotel!! Love the water
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Dana Point Marina Inn to be close to the Catalina Express office.   The hotel was very economical and clean. The desk staff were friendly.  Our room was equipped with a king bed, which was very firm. We liked that. The fridge worked, but took some time to get to a reasonable temperature. Room size was large for 2 adults, and the shower had decent water pressure.   The small balcony overlooking the harbor was refreshing.   Breakfast consisted of packaged foods and coffee.   The workout room contained the usual machines and no free weights.  For the money, Dana Point Marina Inn is great! The harbor views are nice and our room was large and clean.   One can walk to a multitude of nice restaurants and the Catalina Express departure/arrival site.  For you

I booked in January to stay in may and had 30 rooms booked for our kids wedding.  I was the one they treated with disregard.  I requested a room close to my daughter the bride and a view.  My room was at the opposite end of the hotel.  I had knee surgery and kept asking daily to be closer.  They told me no but upgraded 2 people in our huge party to suites close to my daughter. 1 they are rude and the hotel is old decor.  The rugs smell bad and my room with a view was of the parking lot.  I paid nearly a thousand dollars for two room booking 6 months in advance and got our entire wedding party and many family members to book here and was treated like crap.  Waste of money..
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary Heading: Our entire wedding party loved this hotel!
Summary: We were able to book several rooms here for our wedding guests and it was everything we hoped for.  The honeymoon suite was exactly what we needed and the other suites had plenty of room for everyone to get ready and head to the wedding location.  They also had regular rooms available for my friends who didn't want a suite and they loved those too. We scouted a lot of locations for our wedding in Dana Point and this spot had easy access to all of them and the restaurants.  I walked right outside to the marina shops when I wanted to take a stroll which had Doheny State Beach just past them, so easy!  Also Heritage park across the street gave us a great view of everything nearby.  It's cozy and quite near there and we didn't have to deal with difficult beach access, noise from the
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: This hotel is in a perfect location for enjoying the Marina activities and the harbor area in general.  It is close to parks, beaches, walking trails and wonderful views.  Many of the rooms have been renovated and they are in the process of updating the rest.  We stayed in an updated room - we did see non renovated rooms which are definitely dated, but still functional.  The breakfast is very basic and can be crowded.  Seating is inside and next to the pool area.  We found the hotel quiet for sleeping and the room comfortable and functional. Our pool view room had a small balcony with seating as well as a kitchenette with microwave, fridge and bar sink.  We walked everywhere and had a great visit.  Staff was friendly and helpful, but the hairdryer worked only intermittently.

Summary Heading: The best location in the Harbor!
Summary: We needed a room for one night for we boarded the Catalina Express the next morning. The hotel is located across a packing lot from the boarding dock, so the location is excellent. Many fine and fun restaurants are located within a short walking distance from the hotel. Our room was The Deluxe Harbor room located on the 3rd. Floor facing the harbor which was fun to watch the boats coming and going. Our room was adequate and it appeared we were in a room that had recently been upgraded with new carpeting, paint and crown moulding. The bed was comfortable and clean, good water pressure in the shower, with more than enough, but small bath towels. The general condition of the hotel is old and it feels like management is doing their best to keep it together. Hallways and elevators

Summary Heading: WOW Travis! Your Amazing asset to this hotel!
Summary: I made reservations to stay @ this hotel and when we read the horrific reviews I was very worried to stay at this hotel, with ALL the negative reviews! For one being a clean fanatic. I was very concerned to stay here!    On June 7-2014 ... My husband and I went to this hotel to see if all the Negative reviews were true.  Let me tell  ALL of you who are Leary.   Amazing location, we walked up and herd a water fountain, so tranquil and two benches to sit and enjoy the fountain and the cool breezes. The lobby was clean, quite, welcoming staff! Travis assisted us and I told him we were concerned to stay here due to all the horrible reviews & photos. I asked if we could see a room, Travis kindly gave us a tour of the hotel, we were able to see a charming room Double queen pool view,
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We spent the weekend here for the Doheny Beach Blues Festival.  We had a one bedroom suite with a kitchenette.  Very spacious and clean. Friendly staff.  Our room had a view of the harbor. Called the front desk for fresh towels and they appeared within minutes.  Walking distance to restaurants, shops, and about a 30 minute walk to the entrance of the Blues Festival. Continental breakfast. The pool was very nice. Exterior and common areas are freshly painted, well maintained, although the rooms could use an update.  I would stay here again.

This place is pretty old and not very updated. It was very clean, just old. But the blankets smelled weird. And the pipes must be rusty because when I turned on the bath water it was brown at first.  But the room did have a kitchen which was a plus. The bed was smallish, maybe a full. Overall we didn't mind it too much. Not my favorite hotel though. There was free parking, wifi and breakfast so that as nice, and the breakfast was not bad. Didn't deal with the staff much but they were reasonably friendly.

The Dana Point marina Inn is located right next to a large harbor, hence its name. Our room, with two queen size beds, was large, very clean and comfortable. it had a small balcony from which one could partially seethe harbor; the room faced the swimming pool,too. The Inn is situated next to a number of shops and restaurants for those inclined toward shopping for such things as souvenirs and clothing, plus foods ranging from hamburgs and sandwiches to more upscale dining. the staff deserves kudos for service and friendliness. The Inn rents bikes and there are plenty of safe bicycle lanes to take to visit the area, including the nearby ocean institute. Breakfast was just so-so, nothing to brag about.

I made my second visit to this hotel, which says it all really. The location is excellent, on the marina, which has a good variety of places to eat. It is away from all roads, so the location is quiet, yet a 5 minute walk into town or to Doheny beach. The rooms are big, clean, and comfortable. Breakfast is simple and more than adequate, and staff are courteous. It is ridiculously good value. Some of the churlish and mean spirited reviews here bewilder me

We used United Miles so I don't know what it actually cost but I imagine about ninety. Yes, it's old. We found it to be perfect for our needs. Walking distance to Capt Dave's. Walking distance to restaurants the night we arrived. They gave us Andi's mints, love! Breakfast buffet was good. Our only complaint is we booked two queens but got one king with a kitchenette. They said it showed that's what we booked so I could have screwed up. We would stay again for sure.

Location is the best part of this INN.  Although they serve packaged breakfast goods, coffee & tea in the morning you are walking distance to good breakfast spot like RJ's. Walk along the shops for an outdoor cup of coffee and people watch in the marina.   Try Harbor Grill for lunch or dinner. Channel 12 gets you a $50 dining coupon at Wind & Sea. Walk past the boats, over the bridge to picnic.       The hotel itself is old and pretty run down. I hated the smell from the parking lot to the elevator, though the cleaners spray a lemon mist as they go, I looked for an outlet thinking a Glade plug-in would help here.  There were definitely smokers staying on the first floor near the laundry room.   Still, it's the most reasonable of the larger hotels in the area. Just don't expect a

The hotel is located at to the Dana point harbor, access and parking are extremely easy. The rooms are comfortable with sufficient space. The price is very good value for money. The hotel needs to be refurbished, you can see everywhere, especially in the rooms that the hotel needs some fresh painting or some new carpet or tapestry.  The hotel can also be noisy if you room neighbours watch Tv or talk together.

We stayed here with 36 friends while touring the area on motorcycles.  Nice accommodations and close to many great restaurants and shops.  Nice pool area and breakfast selection.  Everyone wants to go back again next year!
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Fabulous location, but some easily fixable problems
Summary: Pro(s) and cons for choosing the Marina:  PROS The location of your establishment fit our needs perfectly. The pool and hot tub were fun (and unexpected) The room was in a quiet area and, fortunately for us, the bikers who were in the room next door were not party people. We enjoyed the in room coffee The location also gave lots of privacy. See * below LOTS of restaurants within walking distance  CONS The location of the microwave was NOT convenient. We wondered (and only know this because someone on the front desk volunteered the information) why the LEAST expensive rooms had microwaves. No table on the patio The hours for the "continental breakfast" should be extended by at least 30 minutes on either side. No comment about the packaged "sweet rolls and muffins". The bathroom

When we booked our whale watching excursion at Dana Point and the booking agent recommended this hotel so I trusted her recommendation since she said other customers have liked this "nice" hotel.  Well it's anything but nice.  It's so rundown and I think $98 is too much considering the shape of this place.  I feel like $50 would be too much.  I wouldn't stay here and wouldn't recommend this place.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: I stayed at the hotel that was booked for a wedding.  Great price!  I opted for no view since we were right there at the harbor. Good choice for me. Would definitely refer others to this hotel! Staff was great and helpful!

We stayed here one night while we were in town for a wedding. We didn't want to pay the extra money for a view of the harbor since we can easily walk outside and see it so we opted for the cheapest budget room which was on the ground floor. We were in room 105, a king size room. The room was very spacious and very very clean. Bed the is very firm which we like. There is also a small kitchenette in the room. We arrived about an hour and a half before check in and they were still able to accommodate us. The bathtub looks so clean and inviting I wanted to take a bath but the drain stop was broken. I called the front desk and we had a new drain stop within 10 minutes. I was also very happy that there is a small terrace attached to the room. It was cold and raining that day and the
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: It was very clean and the staff were exceptional.  We had a room with a balcony looking out to the ocean and to our surprise it had a living room and a kitchen sink.  It's directly across the street from the beach.  I would definitely go again!
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Large, Clean newly remodeled room with balcony overlooking harbor.  Super price & location.  Included breakfast like most, bagels, cereal, etc.     the refrigerator in room very convenient.  Comfortable bed and quiet sleeping.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Older property that is smart in not overcharging just becuz location at the harbor is great. Our room had an adjoining room door that was warped and couldn't completely close. Thin walls added to unfortunately listening to neighbors/tv show selections all night. Bathroom remodel achieved best use of small space. Nice/large fridge. All the creature comforts you need, but bring earplugs. A good value for your buck primarily for the location if you can forgive the acoustics.

Last year, my husband and I visted this hotel over the Thanksgiving holiday, and this year, we returned for a longer, two-week stay.  Once again,we had a superb experience.  This hotel on Dana Point Harbor is squeaky clean, well run, beautifully maintained and without a doubt, boasts one of the most gorgeous views of the harbor.  It's magical to wake up to the peace of the harbor and the picturesque yachts docked there.  The rooms are cleaned thoroughly every day, and the fresh linens and towels are among the best.  We found a smiling staff, including a few of the people we met during our last visit.  We were met like family and treated with courtesy, professionalism and respect.  The continental breakfast is lovely, and there are always interesting people to meet and greet.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: What this hotel has going for it is the location.  It is actually in the harbor and you can walk to everything.  We watched the boat parade from our 2nd floor balcony.  It was about 1/4 mile, maybe less, from the actual boats.  If we wanted to be closer we could have gone to the bridge and frozen our you-know-whats off with everyone else. But this suited us fine.  The actual hotel is a nice, clean, upgraded motel.  Don't expect anything fancy and you won't be disappointed.   We had a problem with check-in, losing our friends' 2nd floor reservation, but they made it right within a few hours and apologized profusely.  I'd stay here again.

Stayed here to visit friends in the area. The front desk staff were very friendly and informative. The room was very nice.  The view from the balcony was first class all the way. The area is loaded with shops and restaurants. This is a nice place. The value is there.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: The Management and Staff are very courteous and friendly.  Our room was spacious and comfortable with our own private balcony.  And the view of the Dana Point Harbor is magnificent.  We are looking forward to visiting again soon.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: This is our second visit, we love this hotel, really good central location, our room was on third floor with pool and harbour views.  We stayed for 6 nights and asked for mugs, plates, knives and forks etc. and they arrived in 5 mins.  Good friendly staff, good breakfast always filled up, cereal, yoghurt, muffins, bagels, danish pastries, fresh fruit.  Lots of different restaurants to chose from including fish and chips or pizza all within walking distance.  Good wifi connection in room, and we walked to whale watching boat trip at dana wharf which was so good we went twice.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Being the only hotel directly on harbor, they could charge whatever they want yet they keep rates reasonable.  Front desk was most pleasant with me, even after just completing dealing with an arrogant and unpleasant guest.  Room bathroom and kitchenette spotless.  Only minus for my needs would have been an additional pillow or two.

I agree with most of the other reviews.  The hotel was average but the price and location were perfect.  If you have average expectations then you will enjoy your stay.  We stayed in two separate rooms over a three day stay due to a busy reservation weekend.  The Harbor view room was much nicer and more updated than the pool view room.

This hotel is older, but it was the most affordable on our entire trip along the Pacific coast. Our room on the 3rd floor was spacious, with a kitchenette and a comfortable king size bed; the continental breakfast was the usual fare, but we appreciated having a coffee and something to eat. Negative aspects were the noise (walls seem to be quite thin) and a weak wifi/internet connection. But all in all, it is a very good deal.

This was an awesome affordable hotel right in the heart of Dana Point and right on the Harbor. It was clean and the rooms were spacious. Would definitely recommend and would stay there again! We had an awesome view of the harbor and it is right next to quaint shops and restaurants.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Lovely hotel great location friendly helpful staff, my family and I had an amazing 2 days at this hotel we had a family room with two queen beds with harbour view, lovely large clean room, great pool, great breakfast, every thing is close by, do captain Daves whale and dolphin safari its the best experience, do sunset cocktails at wind and sea.  Good value for money at this hotel.  Only thing I would moan about is the guy blowing away leaves at 7am and mowing lawn during breakfast.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Very satisfying experience on my recent stay at this property.   Great staff, recent upgrade of rooms makes this a good value if staying in the area.  Close to many coastal communities with easy commute via scenic drives.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: At the Marina in Dana Point
Summary: What more can be said than looking out the window and seeing hundreds and hundreds of boats.  Easy walk to shops and dinning but most important is to walk around the Marina.  Take a drive up the Pacific Coast Highway and return to the peaceful Dana Point Inn.  The rooms are older but the price to be right on the water is a great bargain.  Very friendly front desk staff.  Morning breakfast was continental and self serve but nice.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Yes, it is an older hotel -- an oldie but a goodie!  Consider where you are and the convenience to so much -- restaurants, shops, views, walks, ocean.  Hop on the express boat and spend the day on Catalina Island.  Cross the bridge -- turn right to where they teach the kids sailing and other water activities; turn left for more great views.  Very doggie friendly area.  Breakfast at the hotel was adequate with many choices including yogurt, fresh fruit, cereals, bagels, packaged pastry (may still be a little frozen), etc.  Eat it out on the patio by the pool.  Since we are part of a touring group, we found we had a variety of rooms.  Ours had a kitchenette.  We heard others had a small fridge.  The furniture is tired but perfect for the beach scene.  Our room was very clean with

Enjoyed our stay at this motel.  It was clean and had a nice view of the harbor.  Staff was friendly too.  Dana point is a beautiful area and we recommend driving up the coast through laguna beach while there
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Great deal.  You get what you pay for.
Summary: Know this before going in....it's an older hotel.  But are you going to travel to Dana Point and hang out in your room all day?  Negatives:  it's older...dated...noisy a/c...continental breakfast is nothing to get excited over.   Positives:  it's reasonable...free breakfast...free parking...helpful people that work there...and a perfect location. Request a harbor view room - 3rd floor.  There's a small balcony with plastic chairs - you can sit out there and look at the harbor.  It's right next door to shopping, restaurants.  Dana Point tide pools are wonderul.  Get a tide chart and find out when low tide is before hand and plan your trip accordingly.

My sister wanted to vacation near our family in Dana Point so she booked 3 rooms for herself and adult kids and grandkids 6 months ago. She asked that at least 2 of the rooms be close together (grandkids are young) and that 1 be next to the pool so when the little ones needed to nap, they could still enjoy the pool. She called again in July and also a week before they arrived restating her requests. Bottom line, she did not get either request and the staff she spoke with had a take it or leave it attitude. Not even an apology was offered, much less any effort to accommodate her.

The location can't be beat if you're looking to be at the harbor. That said, I couldn't help but wonder why they couldn't invest about twenty dollars to put new vinyl on the bathroom floor. It was very old and torn up, and although the place needs a lot, something like that is cheap, fast and easy to do.

The staff was awesome, answered all our questions and took care of our needs.  Continental breakfast was very good, wish it would last until 9:30 instead of 9am.  The pool was clean and warm, the jacuzzi was on the hotter side for me, but kids enjoyed it. We had great views of the pool and harbor. I left my cell charger in the hotel room and didn't call until a week later and they still had it. It wasn't fancy, but the price was good for what we received.

We stayed two nights and wanted to make popcorn...when we asked for a pan with a lid housekeeping brought us her personal pan from home.  We couldn't ask for better customer service than that! Rosario you rock!!   Rooms are ok, pool is nice and spa was great.

you get what you pay for.  Inexpensive. Pool. Free breakfast.  My room was in desperate need of a make-over.  It had been painted and repainted (with paint that didn't match) way too many times and there was a smell that you couldn't quite put your finger on.  The bathroom was probably original, scratches, chips, rust, crud, nothing that could be wiped down and made to look good.  I wouldn't walk barefoot in the room.  However, if that kind of stuff doesn't bother you....the location and price can't be beat.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: Check in was fine and the location was perfect for what we had planned but the service after check in and the room were horrible.  AC leaked water the whole night making a ton of noise and soaking the carpet. Went down to the front desk in the morning to let them know about the issue and they said they would take care of it.  Came back from a long day and the carpet was dry but after about 30 min of being on the AC started to leak again. The shower situation was also not good. Any use of the sink or toiled by anyone else on our floor would cause the shower temperature to fluctuate violently. We ended up checking out a day early and the Front Desk staff didn't even bother to ask why we were leaving or how our stay was.  Would not recommend this property to anyone.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: I stayed here for its super location and wanted to try it out.  I had a queen bed on the 2nd floor towards the middle of the hotel.  The room has the queen bed, desk, coffee table, stove, and refrigerator.  The bed seems to be aged and too soft.  The refrigerator took a while to be cool but it worked fine. Bathroom is average clean and a good shower.  It has free wifi and free parking outside the hotel.  Location is superb.  It is close to the harbor, park, and freeway.  The interior of the hotel looks dated though.  Its walls are pretty thin as I could hear next door people talking loudly.  The next night was quieter perhaps people checked out.  One thing though I was surprised is its side entrance doors (Not the main entrance door) were not locked in the evening.  Anyone can

Summary Heading: Worth the stay even if it isn't the Ritz
Summary: Location is great and the price is right.  Yes, it is an older hotel that continues to get a facelift, but it's close to places we enjoy.  New updated bathroom was a nice surprise.  Rooms are large and we slept fine.  Continental breakfast is just that, nothing special.  If I had known we would have a large frig and even a stove/oven I would have brought things to make a real breakfast.  But overall like coming here and will continue to.  Good size pool and ok size spa that we enjoyed.

Summary Heading: Hotel gets better with each visit
Summary: I have the pleasure of staying here about once a year. Last year the hotel was looking a little tired and worn but they have been working hard since that visit. The room that I had was clean and bright-recent paint and a new a/c were evident as well as improvements made to the front entry area. The free breakfast was very good as always. This hotel is a wonderful place to stay if you are visiting the area. Front desk staff is helpful and friendly as is the housekeeping and maintenance staff-they understand what customer service is all about. Lots of places to visit and great food are all nearby-the hotel's rate is excellent-I'll be back.

Visited recently and was very surprised and not in a good way.  Walls were thin, hallways sterile and interior very dated.  I can't imagine how this hotel has received 5 stars by anyone.  The price is low and the location good but if you want to sleep, forget it.  Our room looked across a "courtyard" into someone else's.  Heard noise from above and next door.  Sorry, I could not recommend staying here to anyone.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: A perfect location for meeting all our adult friends. The DP Marina Inn is large and spread out, extra large rooms and just comfy! An older location but in a prime location in the marina with plenty of activities, food and cocktails. Not modern but comfortable furniture and large balconies overlooking the marina. Note, the walls are a little thin, lol, but balconies offer great accessibility to meet your neighbors if you so please! Great rates, highest we've seen is $129.00 with a king, marina view. Great bang for the buck!!!

Summary Heading: terrible wifi, dated and needs an overhaul
Summary: Terrible wifi in room so I moved over to the lobby,  not so much better.   What you read online is pretty accurate, this place needs an overhaul,  Great location, that's the only thing going for it.  I mean the value is pretty good.  If the wifi worked and the staff even pretended to be happy I would have been OK with this place.  If the front desk smiled and greated you when present I would have given them an extra star.  No matter how bad or good a property is the staff and front line make the experience. This was certainly not the case.  Wouldn't stay there again.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary Heading: Wi-Fi and business center computer horrible
Summary: Stayed here once a year and once again they have not improved on the internet situation. Because of poor connection had to use computer in lobby which was so slow it took me almost 2 hours to try and complete my tasks.  Had to check out late, missed lunch with family, and then had to stand in line for an hour at my next destination to get the tickets I was trying to print at hotel.  Seriously considering not staying here again.  Was really upset that the staff trying to act like this was some unusual problem when I've had problems every single time I stay here and overhear other guests complaining also.. I have never been able to get cell service in my rooms here and always assumed it was my provider (Metro PCS), but this time I had Sprint and I still couldn't get signal in my

We stayed here on Apr 9; my sisters and I had three different rooms but all three were tired. I had a small refridgerator, stove, and sink in my room, think 80's style. The hotel was situated on the harbor, lots of small shops and eating places nearby. It was adequate for spending the night but really needs a makeover and a good cleaning, carpets worn and dirty. You can tell they tried but what this place really needs is a good do-over. A/C units were a little noisy. My sister had asked for a handicapped room and actually did get one! She was pleased with the grab bars in the shower. Breakfast in the morning was your standard pre-packaged food: bagels, muffins. Cereals were available as well as some fruit. I will say that the wifi (one of my criteria) was excellent once logged

I've stayed in a variety of hotels in Dana Point, but this was an unexpected bargain. The hotel sprawls a good deal, but when you walk out of the back, you are straight on the marina, with all you would expect, as well as a variety of good restaurants. The situation is also good to get into town, 10 minutes on foot and a few minutes by car. It's also a five minute walk to magnificent and legendary Doheny Beach. The staff were courteous and helpful, breakfast acceptable and the rooms were a good size. The price was low, so all in all, a really good place to stay

When I am in the Southern CA area, , I always stay at this GREAT hotel by the beautiful Harbor. I have been staying here fort years, and I am always perfectly pleased!  The staff is always friendly and helpful, and the facilities are always first rate. I highly recommend staying here.  Sincerely,  Joe Moros
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We rented 20 rooms with no complaints from anyone. All understood that this was an older hotel. I always ask for written reviews from my folks. General results were favorable. Clean rooms. Good baggage service. The key here is location, location, location. Right on the marina walk way with plenty of shops and restaurants. Several excursion boats include fishing trips, Catalina express, and whale and dolphin watching. For us it was whale watching. We were not disappointed. Yes there are times when there are no whales, but there is almost always a large pod of dolphins that like to play around the boats.

This is an old Inn, but the price is right, it's clean and quiet and the room I stayed in was huge.  It's centrally located, right on the harbor and across the street from some pricey but fun boutiques and a huge variety of restaurants. Overall, not a bad place and I would definitely stay here again.

There's not much at Dana Point unless you're a sailor. This is a great place right in the heart of Dana Point Harbor. Doheny State Park is nearby just off the Pacific Coast HighwayI. If you plan to see Catalina Island, ferries leave from here but they leave from all over the place around here. Keep an eye out for special midweek rates. Drop the kids at Disneyland and come to Dana Point.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Visiting Dana Point again and just really enjoy being right in the harbor.  The Inn is a great place to stay with a nice little kitchenette.  We are close to the shops and to the Ocean Institute.  Everything is walking distance and the walking is just beautiful.  The birds are just so much fun to watch and it is possible to see dolphins and seals from the shore.

Summary Heading: Two visits - Same results, Great Location, Clean, Simple
Summary: We have stayed at the Dana Point Marina Inn on two vacations and we have been happy with our two stays here.  The prices are very good for this location.  You are right on the harbor which is great for walking the beach and for the whale watching and fishing at Dana Wharf, as well as its proximity to a couple nice places to eat and shop.  The rooms are simple but they have been clean both times.  The beds are average in comfort, but not uncomfortable at all. Our room had an enclosed patio that faced the harbor.  There was a refrigerator that was moderate sized as well.  The bathroom was average but clean.  They also had a continental breakfast.  They are very courteous and help with whatever you need.  I would stay there anytime I am in Dana Point.  Great deal for the price.

There is no way you can beat this Hotel for the money.  The service is great, breakfast and coffee in the morning included in the price.  The location can't be beat and all the service people can't be nicer.   Rooms are clean.    I would think a comparable hotel in this area would be double the price.

An old hotel with plain rooms but in great location in the harbour. Room I had faced into courtyard right at other rooms, so not private and asked to change but no available rooms. Fairly good value but not a memorable place to stay.

I always stay here when I visit my brother in Dana Point & his guest room is occupied with family!  Nice staff!  Clean!   Great location!   Some rooms have kitchenettes!  Pool side view rooms just as nice.  Try the Harbour Grill next door for dinner. Fantastic!

Summary Heading: Great location in Dana Point on the harbor.
Summary: We had a wonderful Time at the Dana Point Marina Inn! Older hotel on the harbor, well cared for and great service by all staff and the administration. Highly recommend the hotel for a great escape. We loved our visit!

Summary Heading: The kitchen, location, view, value all great!
Summary: As an 84 year old woman on my own, the hotel was a very pleasant, safe and comfortable experience.  It was nice to make a meal and yet it was easy for me to walk to several restaurants.  I could see staying here for a longer period as their was a pool, jacuzzi, laundry facilities, kitchen, computer in the lobby, a convenience store nearby and the other people staying there were friendly and itneresting.    The staff was informative and helpful.  The room was clean and comfortable. My patio with a view of the pool, harbor boats lit up for the holidays and the sunset was very nice.   The shops nearby were filled with post holiday bargains.  The Harbor Grill and Proud Mary's restaurants nearby were my favorites.    I liked the fact it wasn't all techno on me.  I could figure out

great location in dana point harbor.walking distance to shops an restaurants,easy parking,great staff.easy check in ,clean an comfortable.i would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay.my girlfriend an i love the place.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Can't beat the value and location.
Summary: Yes, it's an older property.  That's part of the charm.  Walking distance to several great eating establishments and the marina.  Room was comfortable and met my needs.  Staff was welcoming and check-in was pleasant.  Four stars, it is not.  Good value with excellent location, it is.  I plan to stay here for future overnight excursions from San Diego to the O. C.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Location Location Location at dana point harbor so you can enjoy the shops and restaurants or relax in the jacuzzi or take a dip in the swimming pool friendly helpful staff or take a short walk to Baby Beach where you can relax under the covered picnic tables, grassy area.. steps to the sand and water, where you can rent kakaks, jet skis, and paddle boards good price  evon Anaheim Hills, ca

My boyfriend and i stayed here last week. all in all...Clean,comfortable,affordable and better selection of vending machines! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel at a very good price . The receptionist was very nice as well. Plus you didn't have to pay to use the phone like most other hotels,
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We stayed here again in Dec ...probably our fifth time staying...vastly improved and renovated...new paint colors, flat screens. We just love the location...you can walk for miles along the marina and beach. Nice to have a laundry for guests. Continental brkfst could improve..but, great coffee pubs are one minute walking distance. plz keep improvement s coming..and, we will b back again and again.  My sister visited and wants to return for their anniversary in July!!!

The hotel overlooks the gorgeous Marina.  You couldn't ask for a better location.  There's a beautiful path that runs along the Marina where you can walk or bike.  Lot's of places to eat and sight-seeing are all within walking distance.  You can tell that the hotel has been going thru some upgrades.  The flat screen tvs are very nice.  The bathrooms are starting to get upgraded.  They're not there yet.  Still needs new bedding, carpeting and furniture.  And they can use some better padding between floors.  Neighbors walking on the floor above sounded like herds of buffalo.  But overall, this is a great place to stay.

Summary Heading: The hotel is in a perfect location!!!
Summary: The Dana Point Marina Inn is possibly one of the most convenient locations. The staff is always just friendly enough. The rooms are getting remodeled, although they aren't in bad shape now, Just a few things need updating. Each room has it's own patio to sit out and enjoy the view. There are plenty of places to catch a bite to eat as well all within a five minute walk. Walking around all the shops that are on the marina you'll find something for everyone. It's also close to the beach. Don't pass this hotel up

On two occasions, my husband and I have chosen the Dana Point Marina Inn for week-long stays in Southern California.  This hotel offers all the comforts and feeling of home.  The rooms are squeaky clean; the staff super friendly, knowledgeable and courteous; and the location, five-star.  The hotel is right on the harbor and a minute's walk to retail stores and restaurants.  It's hard to resist the view--hundreds of boats languishing in the blue water of the harbor.  We would rate our experiences at this hotel among our very best hotel stays.  It offers a continental breakfast in a newly refurbished breakfast room.  There, we met several interesting people, including a Ph.D. anthropologist, who was absolutely fascinating.  If you are planning a stay near Dana Point, and you are
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We stay one to two weeks, several times a year at the DPMI. It is a great location, reasonably priced, and the staff are the greatest. Several restaurants are within walking distance and the harbor area is a nice place to socialize. The latest renovations will add to the ambiance.  A stay includes continental breakfast. Most staff are long term employees, knowledgeable, and eager to help out with touristy information. CJDP
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: The location of this hotel is fabulous, the staff is,always friendly.  We stay here two or three times a year and always enjoy our time there.  The harbor area is a grand place to walk,eat and just relax.  There are several restaurants in walking distance from the hotel.  Laguna Beach is just a short drive.  The Christmas lights at the Ritz are a must to see.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Great location right in the Dana Point Marina. The rooms are spaciou, with vending machines on each floor. There is also a nice continental breakfast included each morning. Will definitely recommend it to friends and family.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We had an amazing stay with superb restrauents within walking distance. We also enjoyed the walking areas around the harbor and to the nearby ocean.  The Inn employes were very courteous and informative with any / all questions.  This Inn was very nice, we enjoyed the room, the grounds and the delicious complementary breakfast.  I would highly recommend this Inn to anyone who loves the beach and enjoys walking in areas surrounded by beautiful landscape.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Great spot. Staff was friendly and courteous. The room was beautiful and very clean. The hotel was quiet, and even serve a full hot breakfast in the morning. The surrounding of the hotel is clean and in good shape. Easy to park and its free. Absolutely more than I expected.

Always clean with great customer service! We always enjoy our time here. Close to everything. Love that we can walk everywhere from here. Will keep coming here. The room is usually ready early which makes our stay even better.

We have been going to the Marina Inn since the early 80's and more frequently after we retired and have a 2 year old grandson near by.  We have always been pleased with the friendly front desk and have only not been able to check in early twice.  The rooms have always been clean and while outdated, for people that matters to, you will be happy to know they are in the process of renovating all the rooms.  The harbor side rooms have been done and the pool view rooms are currently being done.  We like the casual atmosphere and ambiance of the Marina Inn.  This will be our "vacation home" for a long time.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We stay at this hotel twice a year for an extended time and it is one of our very favorite stops.  The rates are reasonable for a waterfront accommodation with a lovely view of the marina.  We love to shop, and eat good food that is within walking distance from our room.  It has nice walks  for exercise, a laundry for customers, and free WiFi.  We enjoy the harbor side on either the second or third floor.  The staff is very pleasant and helpful, and the room are nice and large, with a small balcony to enjoy the outdoors and view from you room.  It is a central location for visiting other areas along the coast. We look forward to returning in February.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: My wife and I live in Henderson, Nevada.  Four times each year we travel to Dana Point to do some fishing and visit friends and relatives.  We always stay at the Dana Point Marina Inn for several reasons.  It's right on the harbor, walking distance to shops, restaurants and fishing.  The room rates are reasonable, rooms are clean and the staff is friendly and helpful.  We give this hotel our highest recommendation.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: we stayed at your hotel at least 3 times a year and have done so for the past 30 years. It always has been a positive experience. We glad to see that you are renovating the hotel, which will make our future stays even more so enjoyable. Rooms were clean and the staff a pleasure to deal with, informative and courteous as well as making you feel welcome. The continental breaskfast was great, with a good variety of breakfast items. With the harbor and the restaurants within walking distance it was defintely a plus to stay at your hotel.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: everything you need is right there
Summary: we selected our rooms on the harbor side, third floor and the view was great. We went whale watching, day trip to Catalina, and the beach without having to get into our cars. During our stay we walked to the restaurants and shopping along the marina. The rooms were clean and the staff terrific + extremely reasonable for the area.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: I am repeating what many others have said in extolling the location of this hotel.  If it was any closer to the water you'd be swimming.  We have stayed in other hotels in the area, but from now on this is our first choice.  Since we were trying to stay on our budget (: we opted for one of the rooms not on the harbor side.  As it was it still had a very nice view of the bridge and part of the harbor.  The hotel is older, but very well maintained and I noticed the harbor side rooms have many upgrades. The room was neat, clean and generous in size.  How nice not to feel you were in a closet!!  A small balcony with enough width for a chair gave me a nice place for my morning coffee.  The breakfast had a good variety and the fruit was fresh.  The staff was friendly and helpful with
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: There can be no better location for saving gasoline. You can walk to the best of restaurants an shopping. It is clean and quiet. The employees are courteous and informative. We go there once a week, to take a mini vacation without having to drive far at all. Try it. You'll like it. Walt Stevens
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Great Location at a Value Rate
Summary: We have stayed here many times in the last 7 years due to family nearby. The location is wonderful - on the marina, next to the park, beach, lots of places to walk to and many restaurants. Don't expect a remodeled property but it's clean and quiet and we have always gotten a great rate.

First off, the location: you are close to all the restaurants, bars and attractions of the area. and i mean WALKING distance.  i was there for a concert at the Doheny State Beach and we literally WALKED there in 10 minutes. the hotel makes you feel at home right away, there' something so chilled out and nice the minute you walk in there that you feel relaxed and at ease. the rooms are ok, could be a little more "modern" but overall i cant complain: they were clean, and the beds quite comfortable. the tv had most of the channels i needed (it was the nfl kickoff weekend) and the internet was pretty fast. the location, once again, was perfect...and they even had a pool which i didnt use but looked ok. overall a nice place for an ok price, i'll be back for sure when i'm in that area.

My husband and I have been staying at the Marina Inn for our California vacations for the past 21 years.  We love the place!  It's clean, comfortable, well staffed and the location is wonderful.  Close to beautiful beaches, great restaurants and the Marina area provided a great area for watersports, walking and people watching.  It's a great value.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: My husband and I stayed at Dana Point Marina Inn on the recommendation of a family member. We found it to be a great value. It is located at Dana Point harbor and we were able to walk to some great restaurants and shops. It was very clean and the hotel staff was very friendly.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: This place is great and family friendly.
Summary: This place is great! We stayed here twice in one month, once with kids and once without. Both times the staff was friendly and accommodating to our needs. The rooms were clean, and while a bit dated, nothing was in need of repair. The location is the best! Close to the marina and bay water sports.

This is a must stay hotel close right on the harbor. The mountainside view rooms are great and the harbor view suites are fabulous! The rooms are very clean with upgraded amenities in the harbor view rooms. You are within walking distance to wonderful restaurants and shopping. Lots to do at the harbor. I stayed with my one year old in the harbor view room and the space was great for him to play around while I was able to still get work done.The staff is extremely helpful. I could not have asked for a better place to stay here. I will definitely be coming back every time I visit Southern California.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: I love staying at the Dana Point Marina Inn, especially in one of their harbor view suites.  The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable with panoramic views of the harbor and easy walking distance to fabulous restaurants, great shopping, the Catalina Express and many other interesting attractions.  The staff is friendly and efficient and the prices are lower than anywhere else in Dana Point.  I would recommend it as the best place to stay in Dana Point for location and affordability.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near the harbor!!
Summary: We stayed here because we needed a place close to where they were holding a music festival event. It was last minute so we thought we wouldnt be able to get a room anywhere- this place was recommended as a little known secret only known by the locals. You are right on the harbor and close to everything. Our room was only $93 dollars with tax. We met a few older guests that seemed to know their way around and were repeat customers since the 1970's.We can only imagine the history of this place and the harbor. Check in was really easy as was check out- definitely will be staying here for our next adventure!!!
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Week end stay at the Dana Point Marina Inn
Summary: This place was a very convienient location to Doehny State beach which is why I chose this place for my daughter and her friend to stay the weekend for the music festival at the Doehny beach the weekend of Sept 8 and 9th. However, the rooms were very average, could have used some updating and cosmetic make over all over the place according to my daughter. The biggest disappointment was , my daughter's favorite feathered earrings given to her by her boyfriend as a gift were stolen from the night stand in the room by housekeeping and they denied it. No one else entered the room. Who else could have taken them?

The rooms are clean and comfortable but the building needs some improvements Good location near the harbor, restaurants and shops. The area is perfect for a nice walk near the sea, very quiet so if you like crowds, you better avoid it.

Summary Heading: Good location, average rooms, below average staff
Summary: My wife and I drove into town from Oregon and had no hotel reservations.  We stumbled upon this hotel and went in to check prices and whether rooms were available immediately.  The front desk woman quoted us a price of $129 for either a king room or room with two queens, and both types were available immediately.  We chose the king room, gave her the credit card and filled out the registration slip.  After taking our information and card to hold the room we were informed that the only room that was available immediately was a room with two queens.  How unprofessional to state one thing and once payment is secured, reverse that statement.  We took the two queens (same price, we're not picky) mainly because we wanted to shower and lay down asap. I have booked friends there for years warning them not expect anything great. Front desk understaffed, probably some employees are hiding afraid of work.They have only one guy who is into helping you making it a nice stay, he will be hired away soon. Location is great, expect a roof over your head, that's it.
