Summary: I write this with the knowledge that staff and management will never read it because THEY DON'T CARE! Something they seem quite happy to share with the customers as often as possible. Read another review that says it all...they are doing the bare minimum to maintain the place. Minimum service, minimum maintenance.  The main reason I write this is to tell others to avoid a very, very poor vacation experience.  Beware fellow travelers.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: We arrived here late Friday from John Wayne and were quite welcome here.  The bed was comfy,  pillows needed some work as well as the older furniture.  Overall it was a good stay,  to be back home in So Cal right on Doheny.  Shops and restaurants next door.  We ate at El Yorktown and walked around afterwards.  The area was so nice saw no need to brood in our room.  Everything was clean and well taken care of.  Thank you for a nice stay.  Also great continental breakfast!   A great stay in OC can't wait to move back!
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for one night and it was horrible. It is old and outdated. The bathroom was nasty and I didn't even attempt a shower in that shower. The pool closes early and the rooms are old and kinda smelly.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary Heading: Worst Hotel in this Price category
Summary: We're traveling around California and this Hotel is the worst In Relation of Price and Achievement. Old Rooms, a terrible bathroom and the worst breakfast wie had in all our Hotels around here. Would Never Book that Hotel again and Would Not recommend ist to others.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: We were pleasantly surprised last week that they are finally doing some upgrading.  The decor was really lacking before and they have added some new paint, furniture (outside and lobby areas) AND, a new hot-tub.  Still disappointed that they do not have in room microwaves.  Could not get cell service or wi-fi in the rooms I have stayed in (however, apparently they have a list of rooms that do....wish I knew that before!). Above review stated new A/C, but I was really uncomfortable the entire time even with the AC blasted; it never really cooled down.  As usual, love the location; plenty to do within walking distance.  They also have beach comber bikes available for rent for $5 hr. which I plan to do next visit:).  Wish they would get some new mattresses.

We have been coming here for over 20 years now! Such a great location in the harbor. You can park your car and leave it for the entire time, as shopping and restaurants, and all the amenities are walking Distance. You can walk to the boat to take you whale watching, on a harbor cruise, or to Catalina Island. You can walk to Doheny beach or Baby beach, the Ocean Institute, and all around the harbor.  There are so many wonderful choices of restaurants! Turks is the best bar, Proud Marys is awesome for breakfast, The Brig is a great lunch spot and there are at least 5 excellent places for dinner.  We tried El Torito after staying away about 10 years and they have really stepped up.  The staff at the hotel are very nice, and they will always accommodate your special requests.  Dana
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We have been staying at the Marina Inn since the 70's----more frequently now that we are retired.  They do a great job keeping the rooms up and frequent changes to the lobby.  This trip we noticed new air conditioners.  Would you believe when we first started staying there they didn't even have air conditioners in the rooms?  It's not a 5 Star hotel but there is one of those across the road if that is what you care to pay for.  We are very pleased with housekeeping staff and front desk clerks.  I can't begin to tell you how many times we have stayed but we have been able to check in early every time but two.  We call the Marina Inn "our vacation home".
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We arrived on Friday, July 13, 2012 mid afternoon to see if we could check in early.  We had reserved a harbor view room.  We arrived to the 2nd floor and our room was nice.  We had a beautiful view of the harbor.  The bed is comfy, shower and bath were updated and very nice.  Free continental breakfast in the morning.  Saturday after sightseeing, party and arriving back to the hotel, there was no parking.  We asked the front desk and we were told that we had to wait for someone to leave in order for us to park.  That was the biggest downfall for us.  The area is very busy with shops, restaurants and bars. Parking is limited unless you have parking pass.

My wife and I picked this particular hotel because we had a group whale-watching trip the next morning and were looking for something close. The price was the best I could find in the area, and it was worth it. The hotel was a bit outdated, could use some renovations. The continental breakfast was pretty standard, coffee, juice, pastries. The staff however were far more than standard. Both checking in and checking out the desk staff were extremely friendly and welcoming, a welcome sight after a long drive. Also, if you're lucky enough to get a west facing room you'll have an AMAZING view of the Dana Point Yacht Harbor. Overall, I was very satisfied with this hotel and would gladly stay there again.

We had a great few days here in July 2012.  OK the hotel is a little dated but still very good value, with large rooms, comfortable beds, free wifi, ocean view, lots of free parking, a big pool and several good reastaurants within walking distance.  Its peaceful, off the main road and facing the marina.  Beyond the marina is the Pacific Ocean, so its a partial view.  The Upside is definitely the location and the super-value room rates.  Many of the rooms appear to be family orientated and some have efficiencies,so there's something to suit everyone. You can save enough on the room rate to pay for the evening meal.  Oh - and there's a free basic breakfast thrown in.     Downsides are trivial really - the balcony fly-screens were loose in their rails, the TV was one of those old,

I arrived to find that walk-in customers were getting a better rate than I did by reserving 3 months ahead of time!  I was not happy.  My room was equipped with a stove, refrigerator, TV, etc and that was average.  Room did not get housekeeping on two different occasions and I did not have a do not disturb sign out.  There was no offer of having it done either time.  Everyone had gone home, etc.  Bedding was below par.  The mattress was very old and lumpy.  We had a room above us that sounded like it had been rented to a herd of elephants.  Overall a very poor experience.

Summary Heading: Great Location at a Great Price
Summary: The title says it all-older hotel in need of some up grades but overall its a wonderful place to use as your base when in the LA/San Diego area. Its situated directly on the Dana Point Harbor and has lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance. Very friendly , helpful staff-hotel has a really nice pool, gym, laundry and free breakfast. Hotel is CLEAN and everything WORKS.

Musty carpets, high prices, incompetent staff, shoddy maintenance, the Dana Point Marina Inn has it all!  It seems the Dana Point Marina Inn is doing the bare minimum to keep their location in compliance with the law (though the carpets may be older than legal). There was nothing pleasant about this stay, I'm just surprised I didn't get bed bugs.  When you walk into the room and smell the musty carpets do yourself a favor and walk back out. This room isn't worth the asking price, this room isn't worth $1.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: I spent only 1 night at that hotel and was ok, just ok. It is a very simple hotel. Parking lot it is not charged.

Location is the key for this Inn. The room was nice and filled our need for an overnighter before an early Catalina trip the next day. Walking distance to the Catalina Express and the rest of Dana Point Harbor. Several good restaurants nearby including Wind and Sea. My only compliants; I had to turn on the water for the toilet and reconnect the chain to the flapper valve in the toilet tank before the toilet in the room would work, and the A/C unit did an imitation of a passing train. We slept well despite the noise from the A/C and would recommend this Inn to family and friends looking for convenient lodging in the harbor area.

We wanted to stay within walking distance of the Dana Point Yacht Club and the Marina Inn fit our needs.  It is dated and could use a major facelift but the value is amazing for the location. The room was old, with a stained popcorn ceiling.  However, it was clean and quite large with the attached kitchen.    Our only complaint was we received a queen bed when we booked a king.  The front desk person was rude when we asked for a new room.  She said they were fully booked, too bad.  The bed was very soft with small pillows but we still slept well.  Waking up in the Marina was a treat.  We had cappuccinos and a nice breakfast while we  enjoyed the boats, pelicans, views, and people watching.

Summary Heading: Great location in Dana point harbor
Summary: I have stayed at the Marina Inn several times and it is a solid bet for the price in Dana point. The hotel shows its age and the decor is stuck in the 70's. However this past trip showed promising signs of some long overdue improvements. A jacuzzi spa has been added to the pool area. What a welcome addition! There are signs of other renovations as well. Might I suggest starting with the hideous artwork in the rooms. Followed by the bedspreads?  DP harbor is a great place with lots to do and some great restaurants. For the money you can't go wrong with marina inn. Just don't expect the Ritz Carlton. I just hope the improvements don't translate into higher room rates.   Ps. Don't spend the extra money for the harbor view. It's not worth it since all you do is walk outside and

I have stayed here twice before and it was disappointing both times.  The public areas were dirty, the desk staff extremely rude and non caring, the bathrooms seriously out dated with chipped sinks and tubs.  I could go on but why......  I will pick a new place next time.  The location is nice and made it kind of worth it for $100 a night (even that is questionable) but now when I look I see they want $173.00 and more on their own site....  NO WAY!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your insight as to the property. Information will be passed on to the proper department.

Summary: Everything needed updating; however, it was a clean room.  If we didn't need to be close to the harbor (Catalina Express - to take us to Catalina Island), we would have chosen something nicer for the same price.  Would not stay here again unless we needed the boat ride.

Stayed a few days in August and again for a week in November...a bit disappointed both times.  Family in area recommended due to a coupon.  Great price so booked the 2nd trip.  Asked several times for an email confirmation because I wanted proof of the price since it would be Thanksgiving week.  Each time, was told they were too busy to send email, that I should call back.  Well surprise surprise, was charged $30 more each night when we got there..had no email to back it up.  Was told they have never had those rates, even though I had them 2 months earlier! At any rate, (no pun intended:) each time I had to talk anyone at the desk for any reason,  they seemed irritated, put off and borderline rude.  We had problems with the room keys daily, the bathrooms have very limited
Great location but the walls are paper thin. Lots of noise. Over charged me on check out.

The setting overlooking the marina was beautiful, but the accomodations left something to be desired, particularly considering the price of the room. It was clean and roomy, but the towels were cheap, furnishings were old, and while we had a small refrigerator there was no microwave. The continental breakfast was quite limited, I've had better at hotels charging half the price. If you need to be on the harbor, it works. If not, it's worth your while to find a more suitable hotel a block or two away.

Stay for a night last week. The hotel is really old and worn. The view of the harbor is obstructed. If your expectations are a motel 6, then you won't be disappointed. Rooms have very thin walls so you can hear all your neighbors on both side and especially above.

Summary Heading: Great bargin for a beautiful spot
Summary: Free parking. Normal free breakfast. Great location. Frig in room. CLEAN! This was a great place to crash. Not a romantic, hang out all evening kind of place.  It is older but the windows were so clean you could not tell if they were open of not. I would stay again.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Perfect location for a beautiful 3 day getaway!
Summary: The hotel is the only hotel on the marina side and close to shops and restaurants. It is older but our room was clean with a balcony and kitchenette. The staff was very helpful. The rate was very reasonable since you could not touch a room in Newport, Laguna for that price and have it not be a dump! Continental breakfast was ok, just what it states....rolls, juice and instant oatmeal.  The hotel rents bicycles and has a nice ice machine for taking coolers down to the beach. I had heard bad reviews and was uncertain about staying here, but we were very pleasantly surprised and definately would stay here again. We were on the third floor which has the view of the pool and the marina.  We took Captain Daves Whale and Dolphin Safari and that was a nice day adventure walking distance

Summary Heading: Beautiful Room, nice folks, clean and delightful!
Summary: After reading the reviews of this hotel, I was dubious about going. It was rated 2 diamonds by AAA. I stay at 3 diamond only and above. Well this was easily 3 diamonds or 3 1/2 stars. The room was huge, overlooking the marina, 2 Queen beds. The decor was lovely and the bathroom new , expensively done, and clean as whistle! The whole place was spotless! Had a nice patio too. Very pleasant breakfast room or eat at the pool area. Fun breakfast of lots of carbs. I was very impressed with this hotel, the area and things to do. I will return with the whole family, I know they will love it. There were about 50 of us and all of us had a great time and loved the hotel and front desk staff. I did notice that the front rooms, facing the mountain and parking lot, seemed somewhat smaller
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Picked this place randomly, as we were going to a wedding nearby.  Yeah, I checked out other places.  One night.  Ritz?  Montage?  When all we needed was a bed???  This place was PERFECT!!!  The location is THE BEST!!!  Right on the Marina.  Restaurants, shops, so much activity...I loved that I could just walk out the door and be on the water.  It's basic.  The parking is convenient and free.  We were totally satisfied.

Stayed there for one night in Jully. Asked for a non smoking room and was anything but! It smelled so bad! Front dest said there was nothing they could do as they did not have any more rooms. Were not told at check in there was a free breakfast but overheard someone else mention it. Went down in the morning and it was horrible! The hotel is old and the rooms very out dated. The staff very rude and really did not seem to care. We stayed in southern California for 14 nights in different hotels and this was by far the worst. I would not recommend this to anyone. Go somewhere else!!!!
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: We stayed off season mid week - great rates - funky style room with frig and mini kitchen was nice... Walk to any harbor activity or restaurant. Not the ritz but great find...

Our family had a nice time and the location was great. 2 adults and 2 boys ages 11 and 13. One boy slept on the floor in a sleeping bag since they would not provide a roll away bed. (fire safety).  The room was nice and quite.  We went to Salt Creek Beach and it was great. We would stay again. A hot tub near the pool would have been nice.  They had a cont. breakfast which was okay.

This place is old, beat and it stinks! The walk to the room had me worried. There is no air-conditioning in the hall and there is NO air flow (it's July). The hallway smelled like chicken, the carpet looks 50 years old and it’s dark. My room smelled like an old lady's hair caught fire. The paint was peeling from the vanity. The Shower not only had two hairs in it, it was chipped and equally as old as the carpet. The walls were covered in smears and hand prints. There was a broken desk facing backwards in the closet. The air conditioner in the room is a window unit equivalent. It’s old, cheap and loud. The sad part is unless it’s running the room is stagnant and smelly even with the slider open which is impressive. The walls are really thin. The folks next to us were up chatting

Summary Heading: Great location and perfect spot for wine festival
Summary: This hotel was in short walking distance to the California Wine Festival, which was the purpose of my visit. Went with my mom and aunt and had a great time! So many great restaurants nearby, staff was friendly and the location was ideal. Room was comfortable for the price and seemed well kept up enough other than the bathroom which could definitely use a renovation. My only complaint is that we were disturbed by a phone call from the front desk saying we were too noisy, and it was only 9pm! First of all, my mom was sound asleep so my aunt and I were keeping it down. The only thing I can think is that they called the wrong room, which is sad because it woke up my mom. Other than that, the stay was perfect. I will for sure be visiting again next year.

Stayed here for a wedding in Laguna Beach.  The rooms are really basic, but other hotels in the area are very expensive, so this is an option if you are on a budget.   Pros:  Nice location with marina views and plenty of shops and places to eat within easy walking distance.  Very near a beach area with various types of boat rentals available. Free parking.  Although basic, there was free breakfast, pretty standard - but a nice addition to get your day started.  Sheets and towels smelt clean and fresh - cleaning staff was polite and attentive.  Fridge in room, although we did not use it.  Free internet, but it was spotty.  Pool was heated. Cons:  Very basic room, dated furniture and very old TV's that do not work very well.  Bathroom needs overhaul. Somewhat musty smell in rooms

hey gang this is a beach hotel. if you want the ritz carlton, stay there. everything is lovely. easy walk to: beach, decent restaurants, whale watch, ferry to catalina. inexpensive bike rental at hotel. suggest the upstairs room facing water.  spacious, good bed, plenty of fresh air, free parking

Summary Heading: Room smelled like stale cigarette smoke, no tp, rude service.
Summary: You definately get what you paid for.  When we booked we were told we were getting the last room.  We were not told it  would be a smoking room (I have asthma and would not have taken it).  Upon check in we were informed it hadn't been used by any smokers for at least 2 years.  So now they're lying to us.  The stale smoke smell was extremely strong, despite their efforts to air out the room.  Room in general was not very clean, and the furniture was battered.  We noticed we had no toilet paper and called the front desk.  When someone brought up a roll he was blatantly rude and seemed really put out.  Strangely he was followed by someone really polite 5 min. Later with a second roll.  Great location, but really needs to be cleaned up.  I would not stay again.

We had a wonderful stay at this Hotel.  It was clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the continental breakfast was deliciously fresh with lots of choices. Best of all, it was within walking distance (5 minutes) of everything we had traveled there for; Fishing, Dolphin and Whale watching, shopping. I would stay again in a heartbeat. Our room faced the street, which made me feel like people could see in with the drapes open. Next time I would request it faced the harbor. I had to go with the cheapest room I could get on this trip because of all the extra activities I planned. Even so, it was roomy and clean, had plenty of towels and the all important coffee pot. Also, there was a fridge in the room so we had a place to freeze our catch. They even let us check in
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: Great stay for the money and a peaceful setting, made for a relaxing getaway!
Summary: We decided to stay overnight after going out from Dana Point whale watching and chose this inn because it was at the harbor. Glad we did! Great service, good room with comfortable bed and nice kitchen area. Did miss our HDTV but then we didn't stay there to sit in front of a tv. You can walk to almost everything you need. The bike rental was reasonable and comfortable. We will definitely stay there again.

As always the Dana Point Marina Inn did not disappoint, the Hotel has always been a consistent establishment. It’s not a Marriott but they’ve never claimed to be either. The room was clean; the general condition of the Hotel was clean and functional. We called and requested a roll in bed and told the desk we would be late due to weather conditions and asked if the roll in could be placed in the room prior to our arrival, we were told it would be handled. When we arrived, check in was a snap and the bed was waiting as promised. The only cons we noticed was the questionable Wii Fi and the limited continental breakfast, this has never been the hotels strong point but it is something to eat but I would recommend one of the many non-chain restaurants within walking distance of the

Summary Heading: Very pleasant we enjoyed our stay
Summary: Beautiful view of the harbor. Walking distance to restaurants. Room was comfortable. Breakfast was spartan but acceptable.

So it's not the Ritz Carlton but who cares.  I have stayed at this great little hotel several times over the span of many years.  I love the value, location and staff.  The rooms are pretty standard, but are clean and well cared for.  The staff is excellent, the front desk are warm and knowledgeable.  They have been able to fulfill any request I have.  The absolute best part is that you can walk to everyhing - no need for the car.

Summary Heading: Great people, not so great facilities
Summary: The people here are great.  When we asked for toothpaste or extra towels, we got exactly what we needed quickly and with a smile.    The tub and sink drained very poorly; a 5 minute shower had my feet completely inundated.  We asked the desk clerk to fix it while we were out to dinner, and it did drain a "bit" faster after that, but there is a problem with a main drain somewhere requiring the attention a professional plumber.  The room (especially the bathroom) was old-looking, with a small amount mildew along the sides of the mirror, obvious caulk patching here and there, and earwigs running around at night.    The "Harbor View" room on the first floor is really a "Parking Lot View".  And the ceiling made that creaking noise every time someone walked around in the room above.

Summary Heading: old  some redone great view freindly service
Summary: we read all the comments about this  inn some good some bad - we bought as fan for 15 bucks before we even checked in- ( from the reviews ) the room overlooked the bay with the boats coming in and out the a/c was good but the fan came in handy- room was clean and well stocked- breakfast was provide and it was good   overall nice place
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: Great hotel in a great, quiet location. Restaurants, shops and beach all within walking distance. Hotel staff was great, Let us  pick our own room and we got to check in early. Room was nice and spacious, clean and comfortable. Pool was nice. We would stay again. ****The pictures are of the marina outside the back of the hotel.....Gorgeous  scenery.****

I stayed here for 2 nights with my husband, and mother. This was a nice place in a great location. We had the standard 2 queen beds, fridg, desk, table w/2 chairs, ground floor w/patio. My husband liked it because we parked right in front of our patio. Other people commented on the shower head being low, IT WAS! I'm only 5'2" and I had to bend down to rinse my hair!  I also had to tell the  front counter guy that the carpet really needed a good cleaning.  The room was always clean, but when you got into the shower you made black footprints, and I always were shoes. The area around the hotel is great. You can walk any where. There are shops and restaurants and when I say walking distance I mean walking distance. I have an artificial leg and my mom is 76 and we had no problem. We

This hotel was ok.  We did stay in the older section.  Room was typical hotel room, two double beds and a window.  The plus was that there was a fridge and we were close to the pool.  Landscaping was nice around the pool area.  Not a lot of restaurants near by.  The shuttle for Sea World was nice to have so we didn't have to pay for parking.   I thought that there was more of a beach area but there wasn't.
Dont stay here!! Horrible customer service, cockroaches and flithy rooms!
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: The carpet in our room was filthy, giving black, dirty feet if you dared to walk barefoot.  The bathroom definitely looked like it was under renovation- not the opposite. Also, I asked to borrow a pair of scissors to wrap a wedding gift.  You would have thought I asked the clerks to fly to the moon the way they acted.  Very unprofessional and unfriendly staff. Had to ask "the one in charge" if I could use their scissors. This hotel sadly does not meet the expectations of its brochure.

Summary Heading: Absolutely Pathetic dump with very poor service
Summary: Checked in Sunday 8/2 out on Tuesday 8/4.  Room was not ready so I cordially agreed to return later in the day.  Booked online at $139 per night.  While attempting to check in the first time, the front desk was useless and I would have preferred the personality of a kiosk.  When I returned, the lady in front of me checking in asked for the advertised rate - $79 per night without an advanced reservation.  When I requested that rate, I could not get it since it was a "locals" special rate. It did not matter that I had stayed there a few times previously, and once for a month while my house less than a mile was being renovated.  The room was absolutely disgusting to say the least.  The stench, the carpet, and the plywood pillows on the decrepid bed.  Then the bathroom, which I
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights, the room was a nice size.  We paid for view of the harbor, which was on the 1st floor and it was really a view of the parking lot in front of the harbor, save your $$ and do not book harbor view.  The beds were ok, we just came from a night stay on Catalina Island and we slept on a bed of rocks there, so these beds earned a thumbs up for us!  The location was great from everything near by. The front desk people had a pulse with no personality, but able to answer a few questions.  The housekeeping staff was friendly and helpful.  Our tub was not draining, so we called maintenance to fix it and then we left for the day, they fixed it by calling a plumber.  The room was clean but very worn, especially the bathroom (sink, tub and floor).  I think I saw

Summary Heading: Location great, hotel not up to much
Summary: Stayed at the Dana Point Marina Inn for 5 nights. For the price this is a so so hotel in a great location. The surrounding harbour is very picturesque and town of Dana Point is very safe and friendly with great access to Laguna and San Clemente via the PCH. The harbour itself and the beach adjoinging it provided great routes for a morning run each day. The hotel was very basic. The room I stayed in had recently had the bathroom refitted to good standard. Shame the rest of the room didn't match. Unlike other reviewers I didn't suffer from other noisey guests but then I was on the 3rd floor away from all the communual areas. If you have any intention on using the gym at this hotel then forget it. It's not safe and seriously neglected. I tried it once and didn't bother again. The

Checked into a room that was suppose to be nonsmoking but smelled of old smoke and nauseating air freshner.  Room was old, dark, musky. King bed with only 2 twin pillows.  The bathroom door would not close because it was warped.  The bathroom sink and tub were chipped, and mold under the calking. Complained to hotel desk and they offered another room that was very similar to this one so left the hotel and lost my money  because it was booked through Expedia. com.  Never again!
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary Heading: A great location does not compensate for danger...
Summary: Yes, the Dana Point Marina Inn is centrally well located and essentially very clean.  The problems arise when you actually expect to rest there.  From the moment we arrived until our departure the next morning, the place was as noisy as a bus station.  The bar crowd wanders back all evening, speaking loudly; car horns sound as the vehicles are locked in the parking lot that separates you from the marina;  the soundproofing between rooms is minimal  and for the first time in 40 years, the front desk keyed a duplicate set of keys to our room and we were awakened at 2 a.m. by another guest.  No sleep for me!  Protect yourself.  Choose another inn.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: I read the other reviews on tripadvisor and stayed here during my recent vacation. You can't beat the proximity to cute souvenir shops, bars and restaurants and you can be in Laguna Beach in about 15 min if you take PCH and Hwy 5 is just 5 min away. Perfect spot for getting around. That is not to mention - clean rooms, own kitchenette, great views etc. Unbeatable if you throw in the price! HIGHLY recommended. Will DEFINITELY come back.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: My husband and I love Dana Point, but had never stayed at this hotel before.  It's on the marina, and everything is walking distance...restaurants, shops, water.  (Make sure to check out the hidden beach behind the Ocean Institute!)    The standard room was clean and spacious.  It includes a kitchenette with full size fridge, sink, coffeemaker, stove and oven.  A few miscellaneous utensils and dishes...but enough for the two of us.  Only thing missing is a microwave!  Bed is quite comfortable, but watch out for the shower.  Couldn't keep a consistent water temperature...kept getting surges of hot or cold, and the showerhead is made for someone 4 feet tall!  Overall, a great stay.  And for less than $90 a night, a pretty good value.

A small, friendly hotel in a great location.  The hotel is on the marina, off the street, and is very quiet.  The staff was extremely helpful, making calls about the whale watch times for us, recommending the best beaches, and helping us with directions to local attractions.  The rooms were very clean but the sinks and tubs need replaced.  The cost of the rooms was excellent for this area.  The pool area was clean and well kept.  The mattresses and pillows were very comfortable, and I am very particular about the comfort of bedding.  We stayed five nights and would go back again.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: I'm a resident of Dana Point and with gas these days and distances family can travel, I came up with a fabulous Idea for the Holidays.  I booked 13 rooms at the Dana Marina Inn for a steal of a price, located right in the Heart of beautiful Dana Point Harbor.   30 family members will have a wonderful reunion at our home and leave to enjoy a night at the Dana Marina Inn. Waking to a continental breakfast in the morning, bum the shops, walk the Harbor and do whatever they want before their drive home.     Everyone is very excited to come- If you are expecting a 5 diamond resort, it won't be had here- go somewhere else.  The rooms are clean and the hotel is well run.   I was recently in a hotel in LA that was triple the price and the rooms were marginal, broken down and the billing
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: This hotel should be a gem in a great location. But, the bathroom was dirty, shower had sand or something around the rim. I found a dead bug behind the bathroom door when I closed it (at least it was dead, I guess). The patio door was broken, and hardly usable. The Deluxe Marina View was a bit of a joke, because we were pretty much looking at a fence around the pool. Avoid! The desk staff was OK. But, far from warm or welcoming like I'd expect at a small independent hotel like this.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary Heading: Great Location, bureaucratic, surly customer service
Summary: The location is fantastic, and the hotel facility is very pleasant, however, the customer service leaves alot to be desired. We needed to change our clothes for a wedding and couldn't get into our room because of bureaucracy and lack of concern on the part of the front desk help. The front desk people just didn't seem to care whether they served their guests or not. The room was very nice, but noise from the pool area, and due to thin walls was an issue. Overall, I would recommend the hotel, provided no extra attention is required. The location is beautiful, and very centrally located.

Summary Heading: Two room suites not worth the price
Summary: Have stayed at this property in the past.  Location can not be beat. We were there four nights. Never moved the car. This year we took friends and stayed in a two bedroom suite.  The second room did not have air conditioning.  The temperatures were in the high ninetys.  The front desk acknowledged that the old hotel has not updated in many areas. The front desk people also were not helpful on finding attractions in the area.  For the price of the rooms the continental breakfast is poor. The price of the suites are not worth the money.

When booking the room, the desk clerk assured us that an early check in would be no problem at all. Assuming that to be correct, we left home very early in the morning to be sure to arrive before noon since we were only staying 2 nights and wanted to get the most out of the trip. When we arrived shortly after noon, we were told that the towel bar in the room had to be replaced and would be ready for us in 15 minutes. Several hours later we were allowed into the room, and the towel bar had been replaced, about a 20 minute job.  None the less, it was a fairly nice room with stove, coffee maker and refrigerator. We had requested a third floor room because of advisement that lower floors conducted noise of people walking on the upper floors. The room was clean, the air conditioner

Summary Heading: Cannot recommend the Dana Point Marina Inn
Summary: My cousin and I stayed at this hotel for two nights and did not have a very good experience.  The people at the front desk (especially a lady named Crystal) really seemed overwhelmed and incompetent.  You got the feeling like they were not happy campers working there and were probably underpaid and disgruntled about working in such a tired place.  I also got the feeling like somebody bought this place a long time ago and just keeps cashing in on guests, but does no up-keep or remodeling, which is really needed.  The rooms, simply put, are tired.  Very tired.  The room was decently cleaned, I must say, in all fairness and the location (right on the marina) is nice.  However, all in all, I cannot recommend the place.

the rooms where fine, the staff where great. but the weddings which take place took over the very small patio area where the restaurant sits. Felt like we where intruding on the wedding guests because we wanted to sit at the restaurant. Also there where kids running around in the pool until late and after 11pm which wasnt relaxing if you are sitting having a drink at the restaurant/bar area. the free internet was also good because we had been to hotels previous to the Dana on the same trip which charged for this service. Apart from this the hotel itself was modern and the new rooms overlook mission bay which is nice.

Summary Heading: got there at last - but worth it
Summary: The sign posts to dana point didnt  exsist and we ended up going over the top of a mountain range in the dark losing our  way  numerous times but eventually we got there, hotel check in was good the room was clean with a large private balcony overlooking the marina  there was a free continental breakfast with cereal toast and muffns and juice the hotel also included  was a nice swimming pool that we didnt use. the one problem we had was the people upstairs left the bath running and water flooded our bath room so we couldnt use the shower before we left (the hotel till take 20% off the bill )and the people from the room upstairs gave us a bottle of wine .the staff handled it well and i would stay there again if visiting dana point. Our room was on the second floor overlooking the

Summary Heading: Okay, don't expect it to be like the Ritz, but you'll get a good bargain
Summary: The old saying "you get what you pay for" is always true.  However, I'm not complaining about this hotel.  When I booked my 2 night hotel stay here for around $150 total for both nights, I knew what to expect.  The furnishings and decor is old & outdated; this is a no-frills hotel.  However, another saying "location, location, location" also rings true here.  You won't find a hotel for a better price right on the marina.  I booked a mountainside room but was upgraded, for no cost, to a partial ocean view.  Now the room did have lots of signs of wear & tear.  I found small holes in the plaster of the walls both by the bed & in the shower in the bathroom.  All in all, I was content with my short stay here.  If staying for more than a weekend, you may want to look elsewhere & find

I was looking for a reasonably priced room near the water for my daughter and I to stay and was pleasantly surprised to find the superb location of this hotel. In addition, it was very clean, well maintained and the staff was friendly and helpful. I enjoyed walking out of the hotel and being right on the marina front. It's well within walking distance to many restaurants and shops. An adequate breakfast is included in the rate, as well. If you are looking for a good bargain waterfront this is the hotel for you. My only complaint is the walls are very thin, bring your earplugs!

Summary Heading: Would not stay here again, well below average
Summary: Stayed here recently on a business trip to the area.  The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything that your "neighbors" do.  I had a room that optionally adjoined the adjacent room.  Even with the adjoining door closed, the sounds coming from the neighboring room were as though its occupants were sitting in my room.  The quality of the room was what I would expect from a very low-end hotel.  The kitchenette in the room was a nice thought, but the stove was so old I would be concerned that it would catch the building on fire.  The carpeting and finish of the rooms is subpar, and the bathroom fixtures outdated.  The rooms are clean overall, but definitely have the apparent "old" dirt to them that can no longer be cleaned out.  The location, on the other hand, is amazing

Stayed here for two weeks March to April 2007.  Rooms are so old fashioned they look as though they have not been touched since 1970.  Walls are made of paper, we could hear everything going on in room next door.  I felt the people above were actually going to come through the ceiling.  We asked to be relocated to another room but were shown the exact same.  Some rooms have a kitchenette which I suppose are handy but absolutely hideous.  Exterior looks ok from a distance but once you enter you will find the timber on the balconies rotting.  Cleaning service and all that o.k.  Pool area o.k.  Fitness room equipment a joke.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: The hotel was very nice.  The front desk was friendly, professional and helpful.  Our room was interesting.  There was no phone!  There was a little kitchenette.  The bathroom had a very small sink area and the floor was old and dirty but we just put towels down. We had a little patio overlooking the little harbor shops next to the hotel.  The room was clean and quiet and very close to the whale watching we were doing the next morning.  It is a nice place to stay and experience the ocean culture. Lots to do and see very close.

Summary Heading: Didn't get a good nights sleep
Summary: We elected to stay at this inn because it is in such a great setting, the staff was very friendly and it looks like a well tended facility.  However, upon checking in we found the room and furnishings were less than first class.  Later we found the walls and floors are so thin we were awakened at 4:30 in the morning by our upstairs neighbor(s) who proceeded to open and close the sliding glass door to their balcony, continually stomp across the room, and flush the toilet several times.  You can hear the water rushing through the pipes and generally everything else that is going on in the neighboring units.  I can't recommend this place at all.  Maybe if we had requested a top floor unit, our experience would have been better.

Ok, so some of the hotel looks like it's in need of some redecoration, but for the price it's fine ($89 prpn). The hotel are currently in the process of redecorating which is good. There's a small laundry that we found useful. It's $1 for the washer and 75c for the dryer.  The staff are really helpful, one even lent us her umberella when it rained.  My parents used to stay at the hotel for a couple of weeks each year and always found the rooms satisfactory and the staff pleasant.  There's a small gym, pool and complimentry breakfast.   Would definitley reccommend it for a weekend away, especially in the Summer months.

We stayed here at both ends of a trip to Catalina Island. We were able to leave our car at the inn free during the trip (parking for the ferry is $9/day). The staff was cordial and helpful. Both of our two rooms were large, light, and very clean. WiFi free in the lobby. Paid $69 and $80 (weekend) for the rooms and we are very satisfied. Also you get 15% off at the nearby Jolly Roger restaurant with your room key. Eat at Olamendi's at Capistrano Beach if you get a chance.
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: We had problems with a bathtub drain that did not work and hot water that never got above warm. Apparently, rooms that are the greatest distance from the water heaters all experience only warm water instead of hot water. By the time the water got somewhat warm there was 4-5 inches of water in the tub since the drain did not work.   The staff did a great job to help us by allowing us to use the bathroom facilities in the unoccupied suite next door.

The hotel boasts of having spent huge sums on renovations but I couldn't see the evidence.The rooms were old and tired,the air conditioner cut in and out making it difficult to sleep,the wallpaper was coming off the wall,the ice machine nearest our room never had any ice and the lights in the bathroom buzzed very loudly.Worst of all was our check in experience.We were early and knew we probably couldn't check in.We asked for a bellman,he never came.At the desk we were treated as an inconvenience not a welcomed guest.Our bags were stored and we went for lunch.When we came back our bags were just where we left them,in the lobby out of sight of the front desk.Absolutely inexcusable !There wasn't a bellman to help us to our room so we pushed the cart,with very underinflated

Summary Heading: Should be better for the price....
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for two nights after a long road trip. It is in a superb location right on the Marina in Dana Point.  Compared to other hotels that we stayed in on our trip that were of a comparable price the Dana Point Marina Inn was disappointing.  All of the "name" hotels in the area were fully booked due to a large conference taking place nearby and so the only available rooms were at The Dana Point Marina Inn  Our room had a definite stale and musty smell...we wished we had taken some Febreeze or Oust with us. The room seemed pretty clean but because of the smell it never really felt clean.   Overall the decor looked a little old and tired and I think it would be a good idea for them to think about maybe renovating some of the rooms.  I've stayed in a lot worse places

I stayed one night at this location and checked out the next morning. The air conditioner did not work. There was a musty smell in the room and throughout the hotel and the next morning when I turned on the shower the water was a rusty brown. I was not pleased.
Manager Response: We are sorry you did not enjoy your stay. We are under new ownership you should give us another try

Summary: We are frequent guests of the hotel and enjoy it everytime.  Yes, we have stayed at more luxurious hotels, but this hotel has many advantages that make up for the average decor of the rooms.  The room is a nice size, very clean and comfortable with a view overlooking the marina which is just a beautiful sight to wake up to.  We can walk over to the marina where there are many restaraunts and shops.  Sitting outside having breakfast overlooking the marina, and not having to get  up  and drive somewhere is quite relaxing in itself especially when traveling with a family.   The staff is very accomodating,  By the way, they do serve continental breakfast in the lobby.

Very nice place.  Great, clean room.  Balcony faced the harbor which has a very nice view.  Call the inn directly to get a great price for a water-facing room.  They didn't inform us of the free breakfast -- stumbled on to that by accident on the last morning -- which would have saved us a little money if they had mentioned it.     The pool was very clean.  Nice shopping within walking distance and if you are going to Catalina Island you can walk to where the boat leaves.  Very convienent.

This hotel has only two things going for it: amazing location (gorgeous locale on the marina, walking distance to beaches, shops, and restaurants) and the pool.  When we tried to checked in on the evening of the 4th of July, we discovered the road was blocked off for the fireworks.  My husband and I had just made a cross-country plane trip with a toddler, and we were all exhausted.  The sheriffs located at the blockade told us the other hotel on the road had alerted them about guests who would be checking in so they were allowing them to access the road, but the Dana Point Marina Inn had not done their guests that courtesy.  We had to wait until 11 p.m. (2 a.m. our time) to get onto the road where the hotel is located.  The worst part of the ordeal is that when my husband asked

I have been here a few times and always enjoyed myself. It is in a quiet area and easy access to restaurants. The Marina is lovely and I felt safe here. I would like to go again and again. There is Ralph's supermarket up the hill if I needed pack a picnic.

The location is fabulous.  Lots of fun shopping and good restaurants.  The staff was very friendly and accomodating.  The hotel is old and in need of remodeling.  Although the rooms were clean, the end tables and coffee table and desk were badly stained.  Being by the ocean it's difficult to prevent rust build up but the bathroom had a lot of mold in the sink and tub and the bathroom sink backed up ever time it was used.   You get what you pay for.

Summary Heading: Good location, but you can hear everything
Summary: Good location - you can walk to a number of restaurants and shops. Right next door to a liquor store and two blocks from a coffee shop. Nice pool and good view of the marina. If you like to run, great area to walk out the front door and go for jog.  The bad: continental breakfast. Wow, really bad. Desk personnel - not very nice. The ugly: the walls of the rooms are PAPER THIN. This doesn't normally bother me but I was up every morning at 6 am due to a baby, a person chanting with their long lost Aunt, and a wife and husband having a discussion (not an intense one,  just normal conversation). I don't know how they can fix this, but it's pretty bad.

Summary Heading: Location Great, Older Hotel but Still O.K.
Summary: First, the location of this hotel is excellent.  If you like marinas, nice restaurants, a small convenience (liquor) store, and crashing waves within walking distance, this is a great place.  The hotel itself is clean, staff friendly, but it is an older hotel.  The walls are thin and you can hear every word from guests in the next room (we had noisy college age guys with foul mouths in the room next door at 3 AM).  The rooms are small, and fixtures are of another era.  The bed was also a bit uncomfortable.  If it is all about location though, it is hard to do better at Dana Point.  I'm sure we will stay there again despite the problems.  Location, location, location.

First the positive attributes:  This hotel is in an excellent location right on the Dana Point Marina.  The continental breakfast is good and the free parking is a nice plus in an area with mostly pay parking.   And now the negative:  We stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend with a number of our family members.  We booked a total of seven rooms and arrived from all over the country anytime from Tuesday to Thursday.  We learned that the room location and quality did NOT depend on the room booked and the price paid but instead DID depend on when our family members happened to arrive over the course of the weekend.  After a number of visits to the front desk over a couple of days, we eventually received the types of rooms that we booked, but not without considerable hassle.  The

First of all, this hotel is old...not as modern as one might think.  Upon arrival, we were put in a room without heat.  In January and in a hotel this close to the water, one needs heat at night.  The friendly staff did move us into another room.    In our new room we soon discovered that the walls between the rooms at this hotel are paper-thin.  We could hear every creak from the room next to us...causing a terrible night of trying to get to sleep.  The neighbor next to us had her radio on and it was like we were in the same room--we could hear everything.  If you're looking for some peace and quiet and more modern surroundings, I would recommend somewhere else.  Overall, not the best.

Dates of stay:  Nov 4 - Nov 6.  For the price, the Marina Inn is worth the money.  We had a large room on the 3rd floor with a King bed.  The room was spacious with a sofa, coffee table, desk, King Bed and a small round table for dining.  Our balony overlooked the marina.   The bathroom was quite small compared to the room.  But everything worked perfectly.  The hallways and elevator had a strong pine-smell from the cleaning agents.   Dana Point is a true resort.  The marina area was quiet and peaceful.  People were up at early hours prepping their boats, the Marina Inn was also up and buzzing at 7am.....we heard several of our neighbors' doors slam and the maids were vacuuming by 7:30am!  Breakfast at Marina Inn is complimentary (if you select the option at reservation), but

Be aware - not all rooms are equal. We spent 3 nights at the Inn expecting something special. Ended up with a room that never got the sun - smelled musty, and had mildew on the sheer curtains. The balcony was about 5 feet from the parking lot, was dirty and not useable. Attemps to change the room to something better were fruitless - we were offered one over looking the road, and another that was next to the elevator in a corner.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel at a great price!
Summary: I just came back from a 3 day vacation in Dana Point. We stayed at the Dana Point Marina Inn. I was surprised at the high prices for the hotels in that area. The Marriot up the hill was charging over $200 a night, plus $22 just for self parking. Anyway, after checking around for a few days, I saw a rate on Travelaxe for about $100 a night. I decided to call the hotel (Dana Point Marina Inn) and see what the hotel was ofering directly. I was quoted a Manager's Special price of $89.00 a night. I booked it and crossed my fingers.  The hotel is in a great spot located in the middle of Dana Point Harbor. You can walk to the area shops and restaurants and the beach is just a few blocks away.   The room was nothing special, but they put us at the end of the complex which was nice and
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary Heading: A refreshing destination for a "mini vacation"!
Summary: My sister, best friend, and I just returned from a quick "gals mini vacation" to Dana Point and thoroughly enjoyed staying at the Dana Point Marina Inn.   We've all stayed here in the past with our families and find that the service and cleanliness has been consistent throughtout the years.  It's true, you can park your car for free and really don't have to use it unless you want to take a short drive to the beach.  You can walk to all the quaint little shops along the harbor and all the shopkeepers are friendly. Also, there are plenty of restaurants to choose from.   Our room was very clean and comfortable and they serve a good  continental breakfast (which we were able to take outside and sit at a table by the pool).  This is a perfect getaway to a nice location and you don't
Manager Response: THANK YOU FOR YOUR GREAT REVIEW!

Summary: Very nice Hotel. When I go back To Dana Point I will stay there again. Everything in walking distance--plus a very nice breakfast--The staff was very nice-And free parking!!!And I received a senior discount--The room was a good size and very clean-Hope to  go back there soon!!! So if you want a Hotel near everything this is the place-No need to use your car at all.

First off, do not book online!  We were going to Catalina Island, leaving from Dana Point and looking for a nice hotel to stay the night before.  I used Trip Advisor to do my research and selected this hotel based on location and reviews.  I then looked into rates online, but decided to call the Inn itself just to see what they would quote as well.  I got a deluxe room, with a king size bed, mini fridge, beautiful harbour view, on the top floor for $129.00 on a Sat night. Quite a bit cheaper then all the prices quoted online. And by calling I was able to specify what floor and room type I wanted and have it blocked out for me right then.  The room was large, and very clean.  The bed was really comfortable and the view was great!  It overlooks the harbor, is very quiet and the

Frankly I would not have stayed in this hotel, but the others were fully booked.  I was however, pleasantly surprised at how welcoming and attentive the staff were.  Unlike the St Regis and the Marriott Hotels that I visited on business during my stay.  This is a modest hotel, but the staff make it a diamond in the rough.  Thanks!

Yes, this motel is right across from the harbor.  The location is quiet and you can walk to shops and restaurants (a walk to get to the closest beach is, while not a looong walk, quite a bit further than a short stroll).  The rooms are clean, the staff is nice.  There is absolutely nothing wrong with this motel.    But, overall, everything is simply average, nothing more.  For the money, it's ok.  If you are looking for something romantic, something close to the beach, something cozy, or something even a bit eclectic, this is not the place.

Stayed May 2004, very pleasant quiet 3 story motel, standard but decent sized rooms , right across from the marina with private balconies and next door to nice little shops and restaurants , no highway traffic or noise, and walls fairly well soundproofed.  Got best deal by going to their website over contacting direct. Found their staff very friendly.  The only negative was that our rooms (on the ground floor) had minor problems requiring maintenance calls but was handled immediately. Overall feel was relaxed and comfortable
Two nights in July 2003 were fine. A quiet inn right at water's edge, overlooking a marina.
